Reviews.Title: “Absolute Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: Tracey W
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews on Trip Advisor, my husband and I chose The Toren for our 3 night break in Amsterdam and we weren't disappointed! The hotel is absolutely gorgeous and the staff were extremely welcoming and friendly and couldn't do enough for us. We had booked a deluxe room with spa bath and while it was quite expensive, it was worth every penny and we would definitely book it again. The buffet breakfast, priced at â‚¬14 each, was great value with plenty to choose from. The hotel itself is situated in a nice quiet location but still within walking distance of Dam Square and local attractions. We really can't fault The Toren at all and look forward to our next stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff, Lovely bath”
Reviews.Author: hallwoodh
Reviews.Content: The staff here are very accommodating. We had a deluxe room (overlooking canal, no noise, no flies as previously suggested), there was a jacuzzi bath in the room which was just lovely. Its a good location, about 5 mins wander to much of the action. The reception staff are very, very helpful. And the communal areas areas are really nice. My only gripe (hence the four stars), is for the price we paid (320 euros per night), I think they could have included breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Favourite hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Julofromtheblock
Reviews.Content: With a seductive boudoir feel to it, you can't help but fall in love with the Toren. Perfectly placed for wandering, both times we've stayed here have been fabulous, our rooms sumptuous and stylish. The first trip here I had to check in early, feeling unwell, and because our standard room wasn't ready, was given a beautiful upgraded suite overlooking an inner courtyard where a fashion shoot was taking place. On our last trip in December, we had the ground floor suite that opens directly onto the Toren's garden terrace, with a little seating area cordoned off just for the use of the room. It made us hanker for summer, not 5 below and rain. Just don't stay anywhere else - thoroughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Karl80
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three-night return visit to the Toren, and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Our deluxe room was spacious and luxurious, with a canal view, and contained special finishing touches such as opulent decor, good quality bathroom accessories, bath robes, double Jacuzzi bath and iPod alarm clock. It is this attention to detail which sets the Toren apart, and our stay felt really special. The reception staff were friendly and extremely helpful, going out of their way to provide advice on tourist attractions and recommended restaurants. For example, their advice to visit the Anne Frank museum early (a few minutesâ€™ walk from the Toren) prevented a lengthy wait in the rain! There was a good selection of rolls, cereals and fruit for breakfast, as well as a cooked selection. Finally, its location is great if youâ€™re on business or holiday â€“ close to all of the major attractions as well as the central train station.

Reviews.Title: “a true gem of a boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: wakanaman
Reviews.Content: arrived pretty late at the Toren, only to find that my reservation had not gone through and somehow ended up in the spam folder, but the front desk couldn't have been more helpful and accommodating so I ended up getting a canalview room, probably one of the largest and most beautifully decorated hotel rooms I have ever seen. the location is perfect: Amsterdam is a small town, you can easily walk pretty much everywhere from here. haven't tried breakfast as there are way too many great cafes around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A little beauty”
Reviews.Author: MBastin
Reviews.Content: If you stay in Amsterdam there is no where better than here, and trust me I've stayed everywhere...an outstanding little gem :-)

Reviews.Title: “Thank you to all the staff - wouldn't stay anywhere else in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Bevanda
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a birthday treat for my partner. I read the Tripadvisor reviews so I had quite high expectations - we were not at all disappointed. As one was available, we were given a room upgrade with a massive jacuzzi bath to die for! The room was beautifully decorated, bed very comfortable and a fresh coffee maker. Mini bar all sensibly priced and although we didn't order any, the room service food looked great. We loved the location, very central with a quite canal front. There was a very pleasant garden at the back. The staff could not have been more helpful or friendly; they were always available even if it was just for a chat. We had a great cocktail in the bar - A Sebastian - try it! Once again, thank you to all the staff at The Toran who helped make our stay one to remember.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: adaki
Reviews.Content: All around great experience. Lavish rooms. The jacuzzi in the room was perfect. The hotel staff were extremely nice and helpful at every turn. Loved it. Hope I can afford to return someday.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet!”
Reviews.Author: ktoui1
Reviews.Content: I really have to say that I happened upon this hotel because my usual favorite was booked, but boy, was I pleasantly surprised. Big windows that open, lots of sun, a gorgeous room with a canal view and jacuzzi tub, what's not to love. I was told the room had been newly redecorated and it was lovely, with lots of romantic touches. The staff was charming, especially the tall blonde guy, who was always very nice to me and helped a lot with info about the city ;-}. The front desk was always cheerful and efficient, which is not always a given in Amsterdam, where the staff can seem a little nonchalant. The location was great for me once I figured out the odd logistics of the Amsterdam curve. I loved the canal and walking back 'home' along the canal in the evenings. I loved this place, its a little pricey, but worth it. I am not the kind of person to rave unless I really like something and I am pretty picky, but this hotel was very clean with a very friendly feel and fun decor. Oh, and the bar looks staid, but its actually fun to hang out there for awhile. It has canal views and is quite comfy, add the friendly staff and you have a great spot for a chat and a drink. I never visited the fitness center as a walk in Amsterdam is perfect exercise.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: xtinasf
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a nice and CLEAN hotel with super comfortable beds in a quiet area, yet still close enough to the nightlife, this is definitely the place to stay. It's only about a 10 minute walk from Centraal Station (depending on how fast you walk), and within walking distance of Anne Frank's house. This hotel has rooms in 2 separate buildings which are a few doors apart, and we stayed in the building located a few doors down from the main one. Everything about this hotel was wonderful and I couldn't have asked for a better experience. Everyone from the Front desk staff to the housekeepers were extremely hospitable. I will definitely be back upon my return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Well done!”
Reviews.Author: SunshineFinland
Reviews.Content: My second stay in this charming family run boutique hotel. We had a classy room with canal view in the annex building. This time we had our three year old daughter with us. Last year it was just me and my husband. The staff is very helpful. Great athmosphere and great service. This time we ordered dinner via hotel from Restaurant Christophe (french cuisine, fine dining) to our hotel room and everything went extremely well. The breakfast at the hotel was very good, too. (And we are quite picky vegetarians!) I am very pleased and we will return next year. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “The most wonderful experience from start to finish!”
Reviews.Author: Maccy030303
Reviews.Content: My friend and I visited The Toren a couple of weeks ago and I cannot recommend this place highly enough! If I was asked to give marks out of ten, I would have to give 15!! The hotel is beautiful, elegant and charming and the staff are so warm. Before we went we emailed the hotel to advise them of my dietary requirements,(I am Vegan) and not only did the tell us it was not a problem, but positively went out of their way to accommodate me.I This was a huge bonus for me as being Vegan is too much for some places!! Fantastic start before we even arrive! Upon arrival, (which incidentally was my friends birthday), the reception staff were so friendly and helpful and were aware of her birthday and gave us an upgraded room for free. When we got to our room, which was luxurious and beautiful, with a fantastic canal view, we noticed that they had also put in a letter of congratulations from owners of the hotel and a bottle of bubbly. All the staff at the hotel really could not do enough for us, talk about made to feel special. Their customer service could not be any better. The food was beautiful, the hotel had arranged vegan butter and vegan milk. They made me the best Latte ever!! One the evening we were due to leave, the hotel was hosting an event and the Proprietors (Eric and Petra) invited us in! They made us feel so welcome and really looked after us, the only bad thing was that we had to leave that evening! We really wish that we could have stayed. If you are going to Amsterdam and you want a beautiful, boutique hotel with fabulous food and amazing staff - then The Toren is definately a sure bet. We loved it so much we are due to go back in May.

Reviews.Title: “charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: beirut2005
Reviews.Content: charming hotel along the canal in a calm area, the rooms are victorian style and the staff are very helpfull

Reviews.Title: “Gracious, comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: harveystone Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Found my spot in Jordaan. Classical in style, contemporary in amenities. Great location. Wonderful breakfast and well worth the expense. Not far from great bike rental. Even helped me order Thai delivered and it was just perfect. Wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: ranirahul
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, small and very personnel, we stayed here to celebrate my partners birthday! Had a luxury outside suite with the jacuzzi, ut unfortunately it didn't work! However the hotel did all they could to fix it...was very romantic, and the rooms are very plush.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: vanessm
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at The Toren for one night in March. After having been to Amsterdam a few times in the past, I knew I simply had to find a hotel that would enable us to stay on one of the old canals. I booked a small double canal room which faced Keizersgracht and it was absolute perfection. Although the room was on the smaller side, it had everything we needed. We really wanted to have the view of the canal in the morning and night and this definitely ticked that box. The deep reds and blacks in the decor of the hotel and room made it feel very cozy and luxurious. The room was a bit dark, but not too problematic. The bed was very comfortable with nice linen, there was plenty of closet space, and we even had our own nespresso machine which was a lovely touch. We were able to walk everywhere without having to hop on any of the trams as the location of the hotel was close to everything. The hotel is located about 7 minutes walking distance from the Centraal Station which you can get a 9 euro ticket to/from the airport. The staff were exceptionally professional, hospitable and friendly. No request was too large for them. I would highly recommend The Toren to anyone visiting Amsterdam whether it is your first visit or hundredth. You will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: madasa
Reviews.Content: chose the Toren because of Trip advisor reviews. This hotel is located perfectly for walking to most of Amsterdams attractions. There are plenty of good restaurants nearby. The staff are very professional and could not have been more helpful. The rooms are a good size and well equipped. Would definitely stay again and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, tranquil, simply stunning!”
Reviews.Author: piratepower
Reviews.Content: Easy to find just 10 minutes walk from Hull p+o ferry coach drop off. First impressions were wow!! Stunning decor, they really have put the effort in here. Very warm and welcoming staff with all the information you could want. Glady stored our bags for us until check in time. Steep winding staircase not a problem for the able bodied and a lift for the not so. Ceiling paintings, lush carved woodwork, incredibly comfy and relaxing bar/lounge. We didn't get time to eat here but had a lovely ice cold beer at normal pub prices. Nice toiletries provided. Slippers and gowns if needed. Spa bath big enough for 2 ;) total bliss after a days non stop walking in the city. Sheltered courtyard to sit and chill in or nice for smokers. A bit too cold on our visit to appreciate it! Had a room overlooking the canal, lovely view. Sadly only stayed one night for a little treat but it was the best nights sleep ever for both of us. Treat yourself, you know you deserve it and just stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, amazing view, helpful staff...overwhelming interior”
Reviews.Author: k2snobordr
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at The Toren (we just checked out yesterday). Our stay was wonderful - we were in a room with a jacuzzi and a view of the canal in front of the hotel (room 119). The room was remodeled only three days before our arrival, so we may have been the first couple to stay there. The staff were wonderful and helpful, and the location is unbeatable - only a 5-10 minute walk from the loud touristy areas. I'll offer this small piece of advice though, and I don't hold this against the hotel at all: pay close attention to the photos before you book. This is a "sexy" hotel with lots of deep reds, shiny striped wallpaper (at least in our room), and multi-colored lights over the bed and in the jacuzzi that could be dimmed. It was a bit...too much for us. We're nerds with Ikea taste. I found myself spending quite a bit of time looking out the window at the quaint city view than looking inside the room because it was overwhelming. Again, I don't hold this against The Toren at all. It just wasn't for us. TIP: Don't pay for parking in front of the hotel, which you're not likely to find anyway and costs 50 Euros per day. When you check in, ask the staff to call a valet service for you. It costs half the price, and they were very professional and friendly. CLAUSTROPHOBES: You can take the stairs up to your room! Convenient, especially as I noticed their elevator is almost exactly the same size as a coffin.

Reviews.Title: “Toren, can I move in?”
Reviews.Author: Kristy C
Reviews.Content: The bummer about staying here is that at some point you'll realize that you'll have to leave. That was a bit depressing. Yes, the other reveiwer said she'll pray for a return and so shall I. Obviously you know a hotel like this with a #4 reveiw on Tripadviser will be wonderful. That is why I booked it and it really didn't disapoint in any way. The only surprise was that although it's right in the center of everything, it happens to be on a pretty quiet street-yeah!. Some hotels near the center of the "half circle" city center- so to speak -are in quite loud neighborhoods. Had breakfast with lattees every morning, that was wonderful too. Although everything was top-notch, it was the service that stood out the most. I got the impression almost nothing was out of the question from the lovely staff. One night I had terrible heartburn and asked if they had anything for that or where I should go to get it. The staff member insisited on going out (in the rain) and getting it and said he was going there anyway. Not sure if he was. He did and I was so grateful. This is how it went for 4 nights. Yes, we paid quite a bit, but I can say I don't regret it at all. Will certainly be returning. Thank you, Toren for great memories. They are priceless.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: WLRoos
Reviews.Content: The reception staff were friendly, professional and very helpfull. We got the suite which is a lovely experience. The rooms are big, well equipped and inviting.Breakfast in the delightful dining room is a feast. This hotel is worth a visit!

Reviews.Title: “Heavily decorated hotel on a good place”
Reviews.Author: SummerKesa
Reviews.Content: Location of the hotel is good, walking distance to major attractions and shopping streets, without being noisy. Our room was rather small and dark, though we had a room facing the canal. The whole hotel interior is very heavy with decorations: Dark red walls, lots of old and new decoration items. Room was a bit old and bathroom would need some facelift. Hotel breakfast was good and staff helpful, but Iâ€™m not sure if I would choose the hotel again. Perhaps if room rate would be a bit better.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Becky C
Reviews.Content: Fantastic service, we had our room upgraded on our arrival and we were able to choose from 4 beautiful rooms all equally luxurious and immaculate. So many lovely touches, chocolates and strawberries in our room, complimentary welcome cocktail, lovely staff - nothing was too much trouble, they recommended great restaurants. Brilliant location - just around the corner from Anne Franks house. We enjoyed delicious breakfasts - I worry now that no other hotel experience will live up to The Toren!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Experience EVER”
Reviews.Author: Shawn A
Reviews.Content: If you come to Amsterdam, you MUST stay here. I would love it if there were a "The Toren" in every city I visit, but sadly there isn't. Pros: -Room comfort -Staff were phenomenal on every level (knowledge, helpfulness, and courtesy) -Food and beverage were not price gouging opportunities -Location was amazing with it just a few blocks away from everything (shops, food, and the train/bus service) Cons: -That I had to leave

Reviews.Title: “A really great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: BigTA
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in December 2011. A very nice property and room, excellent value, outstanding service. A great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Too much fashion, but great”
Reviews.Author: UDesideri
Reviews.Content: The hotel may be considered a boutique hotel. The bar/breakfast room is really pleasant and it is very nice to spend time there. The location is fantastic and the hotel staff was helpful and friendly. We stayed in a room on the top floor with a wonderful view on Keizersgracht. Everything almost perfect, except my not liking the room's furniture and colors: too black and purple. Too exotic for such a wonderful place.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem! Home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: wendolina
Reviews.Content: After checking on TA, I decided to book the Toren for my husband's birthday trip. I had high expectation after seeing the great reviews and I must say I was not disappointed! As I mentioned in the booking e-mail this is a birthday trip, Upon arrival. There is a bottle of MoÃ«t and strawberry waiting for us in our room with a letter from the owners to wish my hubby happy birthday. I am sure they also upgraded us to a double room with canel view instead of a standard double from my original booking. The ladies at the check in desk was so helpful, providing maps, making suggestions on where to dine...always cheerful with a smile. The location of the hotel is perfect. Next to the canel and in a quiet location, it is a stone throw away from Ann Frank house. Dam square and 9 streets and you can even take a canel cruise two minutes away from the hotel door. Red light distric is in walking distance. If you want to go somewhere further. The hotel can call you a taxi and it will be there in two minutes! ( not joking, two minutes every time) The free wifi is so convenient and the I phone dock, coffee machine in the room are just other little extra touches to make you feel at home. The bed is also so comfy we had great sleep. The Toren is such a gem in Amsterdam. Luxurious surroundings plus 5 star service. This is what I call home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Neighborhood, & Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Smplysublime213
Reviews.Content: First off the Toren is a great hotel! The atmosphere was amazing, as the have turn a canal house into a boutique hotel. The roomâ€™s dÃ©cor is what really makes the Hotel stand out! You feel like youâ€™re in the Victorian age with a modern twist. This is especially true for the bar/breakfast area, which truly feels like a combination of your grandmotherâ€™s living room and a hip lounge. You have to see it to believe it. The other selling point of the Hotel is its location, which is within walking distance of the most popular areas and still residential enough to feel like you can get away from the city. The only reason I am giving the hotel a 4 out of 5 is a slight miscommunication in the beginning of the trip, which was sorted out later in the visit.

Reviews.Title: “Quality little place”
Reviews.Author: Michael B
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed at this little romantic gem in the heart of Amsterdam and loved it we had a jacuzzi in the room with other amenities shower coffee maker etc it's an ideal get away it would be a great trip for valentines day because of the amazing decor its a boutique with gothic kind of style The beds are so comfortable we stayed in for the hole day and only left the hotel to dine. The cost is worth It because the hotel is so original one of kind the location is perfect you are not far from Amsterdams most famous attractions but not smack bang in the hustle & bustle we will definitely be returning and would recommend this hotel to any couple looking for a perfect romantic get away.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice, even if pricey”
Reviews.Author: LincolnSquare
Reviews.Content: Terrific location near the Anne Frank House and Jordaan. It felt like we were living (albeit like the very wealthy) in Amsterdam rather than merely visiting as tourists. Staff was very helpful and cordial (I say cordial because I'm not sure I could accurately refer to most Dutch as "friendly"; thats just not their culture, nothing against the hotel). Upon receiving our tip, the porters gently reminded us about the tipping policy in the Netherlands (which is usually no tip required). That was nice of them because later on in our trip a waiter at an unrelated restaurant took advantage of us disbelieving Americans. We never had breakfast at the Toren and found out the hard way that breakfast is hard to come by at nearby restaurants; so I suggest eating breakfast at the hotel if you crave American style breakfast food in the morning. By the way, from inside your room you can faintly hear the bells of Westerkerk chime which is a haunting and subtle reminder of where you are. Hotel is luxurious, comfortable and close to everything; you'll pay for that but it might be worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Decadent.”
Reviews.Author: Irochka77
Reviews.Content: Oscar Wilde would have loved this hotel. With heavy drapery, thick carpets, dark violet flowers, black marble, pictures of golden age angels. You will feel like a dutch reach merchant.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel fronting the Canal”
Reviews.Author: adchas
Reviews.Content: My DDG Lady and I spent 5 days here over the Valentines Day period and had an absolutely wonderful time. We got a free room upgrade into 'the annexe' which is identical in appearance to the main hotel but is a few doors down the road, and is an identical canal house The hotel is decorated, furnished and presented in rather 'bohemian' colours but this works well, and it is located in a nice part of Amsterdam conveneint for the trams etc. The staff were very attentive. We did not try the breakfast as it was NOT included in the room tariff AND surprisingly there is no on-site restaurant for lunch and dinner (although there are some nice places nearby including the lovely restaurant next door (in separate ownership)). There was a TV in the room BUT which was 'pay to view'. There was some noise from the room above ours which the hotel did try to remedy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, superb hotel, fantastic staff!”
Reviews.Author: trix4
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location, short walking distance from everywhere you would want to visit and just around the corner to Anne Franks house. There is also a great little restaurant just around the corner called De Luwte - would highly recommend a visit. The decor is quite flamboyant and maybe not to everyone's taste but it is certainly luxurious feeling and extremely comfortable. Bathroom amenities were great, bed comfy and the Nespresso coffee machine in the room with complimentary capsules was definitely a great extra! Breakfast was lovely and the staff as a whole from reception to bar staff, couldn't do enough for you - very helpful and friendly. Would definitely recommend staying here. Amsterdam as a whole, we found to be a lovely place to visit, very picturesque, lots to do, lovely little cafes and the stereotypes that you normally associate Amsterdam with were limited and only there if you went looking for them!

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: pinkboy7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Toren in mid-Feb. 2012 for one night before flying back to US. I wanted comfortable, roomy hotel that feels romantic. And the picture of the room was exactly what I had in the hotel.. The hotel was located right in front of the canal that was frozen to ice skate, and it was easy access to Anne Frank House, and Dam area.. Excellent choice, and I can highly recommend this hotel to anyone who travels to Amsterdam without any hesitations!! one caveat: I didn't notice, but my husband said he's been hearing low frequency sound in the room that was on and off during the night. He said it bothered him, but he fell asleep regardless.

Reviews.Title: “Superb.”
Reviews.Author: sweetasanut_NZ
Reviews.Content: Wonderful experience. Lovely rooms that are luxurious, warm and trendy. The beds are so good you won't want to get up in the morning! Location is central and close to many great bars and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “A great & unique hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveller123345
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel with a unique decor and a great atmosphere. An especially great place for a couples, but I can recommend it on business trips as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Cory E
Reviews.Content: My wife and I planned a last minute getaway to Amsterdam this past Thanksgiving. Based on a number of reviews we had read, we decided to stay at The Toren. As it turned out, The Toren was everything we expected...and more. When we first arrived, we were greeted by a very friendly staff at the front desk. One of the young ladies at the desk (her name was Lisa) made sure that we were aware of the all the major attractions in the city. Throughout our stay Lisa continued to offer assistance in arranging the tours we wanted to see. We stayed in one of the Deluxe Suites overlooking the courtyard in the main house. The housekeeping staff made sure the room was cleaned every day. We'll probabaly stay in the garden cottage suite next time. At the end of the day, we'd look forward to meeting other guests in the lounge they have on the first floor. One of the bartenders (his name is Michiel) would ask about what we saw that day and would then provide us with a brief history of each attraction we visited. He even told us about a brewery that is located inside of a windmill and is located on the east side of Amsterdam. My wife and I went there on our last night with some friends we made while in Amsterdam. In fact, we still keep in touch with them. If you're planning a trip to Amsterdam, my recommendation would be to stay at The Toren. Between the quality of the rooms, the wonderful people they have hired to run the hotel and the location in the city, we would not consider staying anywhere else. B & C (Fairfax, VA, USA) PS - Askfor the Rick Steves discount when making the reservation and you will receive a 10% discount at check-out.

Reviews.Title: “a beautiful boutique hotel .... so pretty!”
Reviews.Author: Lucky13AP
Reviews.Content: our stay here was absolutely amazing. we always choose the best room of the hotel we stay in so here we stayed in the 'garden cottage' which is a seperate room to the whole hotel that is situated in the hotel garden. it is an open plan room so the bedroom is incoporated with the bathroom. very romantic feel! great for couples.... but don't worry the actual toilet isn't in view, that is still in private! when walking into the hotel we were amazed at the decor and presentation. it was so lovely. totally different to any other hotels we have been in. no boring cream and beige decor, no standard themes, everything was totally unique. they have really gone out of their way to make the hotel look so inviting. the staff were faultless, so helpful, so polite, and went out of their way to help us. we ordered room service every night, which was also very impressive. hot food arrived so quickly! if anyone is looking for a luxury stay in amsterdam... stay here! get away from the seedy red light district and weed cafes and treat yourself to this place. A short and easy walk from the shops. About 20-30 minute taxi ride from airport. high standard of cleanliness and hygiene. our room was cleaned every day, it was like walking into pure bliss every day when we returned to our room. mini bar was restocked everyday. free internet both on wifi on your mobile and also there is a computer in the room and a television which both have free internet access.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel deserves to be stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Vitakix
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights in January and cannot fault this hotel and everything about it. The room was comfortable and sumptious, the staff pleasant, friendly and eager to help. Breakfast was delicious and it's in a perfect location for exploring Amsterdam. I stayed in a small double but it had a decent sized bathroom with a mega sized bath which was perfect. My only small grip was the noise in the mornings! They seemed to be having work done and it started far too early for me! ...... 9am, which is a time I wish not to be woken when I'm on a break. Highly recommended though.

Reviews.Title: “Good location with friendly and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: FindingNismo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Toren in January 2012 for 3 days in a standard room. Location was fantastic, in the middle of the lovely canals of Amsterdam and a short walk to Anne Frank Huis, Dam Square and the Red Light District. The museums were a short tram ride away. Lots of lovely restaurants in nearby Joordan. The staff were all exceedingly polite and helpful, which we really appreciated! My only caution is that the decor in the room was dark opulence, a lot of reds and deep purples, which might not be for everyone. Other than that, we thought the hotel was near perfect and we wouldn't hesitate to book it the next time we return to Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Clare R
Reviews.Content: One of the nicest hotels I've stayed in....very central location. Staff were friendly and accommodating. We were situated in an annex building a few doors up and while there was no much view to speak of there was a little patio area outside the room which was nice. Would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Gem”
Reviews.Author: CockyKK
Reviews.Content: Located on one of the more scenic streets of Amsterdam and a short distance from the Central Station and/or passenger terminal. The hotel is just round the corner of Anne Frank's, Jordaan area and the delightful boutique streets of DE NEGEN STRAATJES. We were delighted with our find from the time we stepped outside the taxi and into reception. The service was excellent, the room was stunning, the jacuzzi bath in spa like products were divine, I loved the walk in cupboard and of course the decor was gorgeous. At the back of the hotel there is a garden area which is great for an afternoon cafe (Nespresso machine in the room) or sundowners. We only spent one night here, as we were onroute home, however were very tempted to forget exploring and stay in and enjoy the comforts of this stunning hotel. We had to be at the airport early the next morning so we were a little worried that the hotel wouldn't be able to assist us with breakfast, however their breakfast setup was ready and we had one of the nicest breakfast selections on our trip. Well worth a visit and a highlight for us. Treat yourself

Reviews.Title: “The choice of stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: 8vita
Reviews.Content: Everything!! I will certainly recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip to Amsterdam. It was a convenient location and we could easily walk to dam square and Amsterdam central station. We were welcomed warmly by the staff who led us to our room and gave us a mini tour of the room. The hotel prepared a little surprise as we stated in our booking that we were on our honeymoon. Our room had a coffee machine and the capsules were complimentary. No wonder the Toren was listed as the top five hotels in the book, "a guide to Amsterdam" that we borrowed prior to the trip. We stayed for four days and it was hard to leave on the last day!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: Rydkvist
Reviews.Content: The besr experience ever. Great location, excellent service and pleasant room. Museums and great restaurants nearby. Warm and welcoming athmosfere

Reviews.Title: “A sumptuous and luxurious boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: lorrainebooth75
Reviews.Content: This hotel made our four days in Amsterdam quite a special memory. The trip was a surprise present for my husband, he had no idea what to expect (neither did I really) so I was very happy and excited when we finally arrived. It is a very beautiful building, inside and out, and the unique decor was refreshing and kind of inspiring actually. Websites can sometimes give false impressions of their hotel, but not this one. You really have to be there to feel the quality too, the deep mattress and heavy curtains and all the small details that large hotel chains seem to forget about. The room was decedent and we loved it straight away. The staff were very cool, so cool that you'd want to hang out with them and it's in the perfect location with two VERY good restaurants a few minutes walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel, staff and location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Charlesington
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great and in a wonderful location! The staff were the best and very helpful!! Whenever I come back I'll stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “As Vintage as Vintage can be”
Reviews.Author: Blackmage1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in November 2011. From my Amsterdam hotels so far this has been far the best . The location is great for all the sights and the hotel is as vintage as vintage can be. The bar and breakfast area and flower arrangements are stunning. Service and staff has been flawless. We lived in the garden suite which prooved to a very good and stylish choice. We loved this place a lot and will definetely book it again at our next Amsterdam trip.

Reviews.Title: “Very cool boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tiffrush
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel after my parents highly recommended it. It was my husband's birthday and they did a fantastic job of making him feel very special! Front desk/staff Amazing! So very helpful and perfect English! We had such a nice time just chatting with them. Anything we needed they were there to accommodate. For me, it started via email. I contacted the hotel to help me find the perfect restaurant for my husband's birthday dinner and also ask about other suprises they could offer. All of my needs where met and I was very happy with the outcome! Location Super close to the Anne Frank house. Amsterdam is such a walkable city, but the nice thing about this hotel is that it's close to everything, but far away enough to not be in the hussle and bussle. Room We had a beautiful room with a huge jacuzzi. The shower was wonderful, the bed was super comfy, but the only thing that made me rate the sleep quality so low was the annoying blue light coming from the heating/air conditioning unit. The room was so nice with all the curtains drawn, but then if you have the unit on, this bright blue light shines directly in your eyes all night. I actually slept with a hand towel over my eyes. If you don't have to have darkness to sleep then this would not bother you. I, on the other hand, have to have it nice and dark. Decor I have to commet on the decor...it's very cool, unique and bespoke!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Ashli F
Reviews.Content: This hotel is gorgeous. It is in a great location for exploring the city, just around the corner from the Anne Frank House. I stayed in the main building. Our room was on the first floor at the back of the building. The room was beautiful. Rich colors and fabrics. Typical in size to European rooms but absolutely beautiful. The staff is excellent. I had accidentally booked the wrong date and they were incredibly accommodating when they didn't have to be. We had a fantastic stay and would stay there again in a second. It is a little pricey, but worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Great, safe and caring !”
Reviews.Author: Judith W
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Toren in November. I was a single female, travelling meeting friends. When the staff knew this they said they would have moved me to be next to them. I stayed in the main hotel building, this is where the reception and dinning area is. The bedroom was fabulous and way over my expectations because when I booked said it was small. There was no noise, my room was at the back, I slept very well, bed was large and extremely comfortable. Bathroom was large, quality fittings and beautiful toiletries were left for me. The breakfast room and food in the morning were excellent, fresh fruit, cereals, bread, pastries, scrambled eggs, bacon. The staff heard me mention toast and they made me some plus a latte, thank you ! The reception staff were lovely and couldn't have been more helpful, booking me a cab to the airport, giving me a map and directions. All in all, good value, a quieter place to stay near the Anne Frank museum. Everything close by. Can't wait to return. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: thfc1afc0
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend, it's actaully split into 2 buildings one where the main reception was and another a couple of doors down. We had a canal facing room in the top floor of the second building. Bathroom was a little tired, but the bed was very big and exceptionally comfy. The breakfast buffet is in a pretty small room so it's very intimate with the other guests and not much room to move but can't complain about the standard of the food or service. If you are looking to stay in a period building it's a very safe bet with a desinger twist to the rooms, would recommend to my friends if visiting Amsterdam as it's not in the heaving tourist trap area, but ideally located to be a hub to explore from.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely boutique hotel - deserves all the praise”
Reviews.Author: brandybob
Reviews.Content: Chose the Toren after reading TripAdvisor reviews. Have stayed at the Pullitzer on the Prinsengracht many times before but it's just a bit too pricey these days, so the Toren seemed like a good alternative - so glad we chose it! As good a location on a canal just round the corner from Anne Franks House - easy access to Central Station on trams from the nearby Westerkerk church, and easy walking access to the nicest parts of Amsterdam (Jordaan and Western Canal Belt). Friendly receptionists, very helpful hotel staff who took luggage to the room and showed us the hotel. It's quite small but beautifully decorated in dark, rich colours - quite quirky but stylish. We got upgraded to a canal view room which was compact but big enough for one night. Spotless bathroom with a good shower and Rituals amenities (very good quality), Nespresso coffee machine, and welcome chocs (nice touch). A few scuffs and marks on the walls and furniture but they get away with it due to the dark colours - wear and tear could be an issue in the next few years though. Free wi-fi (so why do so many hotels charge for it?). Great bar with a cool barman. Really nice breakfast the next morning in the same bar which is transformed into a breakfast room, and at only â‚¬6 (we had an offer) it was great value. The whole vibe of the hotel is friendly and relaxed but at the same time the staff are unfailingly helpful and attentive - nothing was too much for them. Overall a great stay and we'll definitely return - get a good price and this is a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding customer service”
Reviews.Author: dytrsi
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at The Toren for three nights just before Christmas. Even before arriving, I had been impressed with the level of customer service we were recieving; the concierge having secured for us tickets to a nearly sold-out performance of Handel's Messiah at the Concertgebouw for the night we arrived. They also happily accommodated us with an early check-in and a late check-out despite their being fully booked. Their restaurant recommendations were excellent and they were more than happy to call for reservations. I would enthusiastically recommend The Toren to anyone visiting Amsterdam for location, ambiance, and service. I do however agree with a previous reviewer who noted that the hotel may not be the most appropriate for children. Though, when enjoying a romantic stay in the Venice of the North as we were, this may be one of the features that most recommends The Toren to you.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: TaraR09
Reviews.Content: My partner booked this hotel as a surprise for my birthday in December and it was everything I would ask for a short city break. The location was excellent about 15 minute walk from the train station and close to Anne Frank House and the 9 streets boutique shopping. The service was outstanding, all staff were very attentive but also respected privacy being there in the background when needed but without being overbearing. The room was lovely we stayed in room 101, it was spotlessly clean, a very large bed, jacuzzi bath and separate shower, espresso machine with coffee included in room price and a chargable mini bar. The bar in the hotel was very cosy and stylish, a nice place to start or end the night. Overall the hotel was beautifully decorated, clean and cosy, I was very pleased with my stay in this hotel and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Lo mejor del hotel, el servicio de su personal”
Reviews.Author: Cardenalguardamino
Reviews.Content: The Toren Amsterdam 80% perfection! perfection! [12/30/2011] I stayed at The Toren in my last visit to Amsterdam and I was impressed! Very comfortable room, the service was excellent and very warm, the location is perfect both for turism or business and breakfast is very complete. I will go to this hotel in my next visits to Amsterdam for sure again, without doubt. Thank you for the Toren family to continue running this marvellous hotel.

Reviews.Title: “simply wow”
Reviews.Author: dwain_11
Reviews.Content: this is truely one of the most romantic and wonderfully place to return to after a day in a city just as nice as this hotel !! The staff are the most caring and non intrusive hotel staff i have ever met (the night porter even managed to find and order me a pizza at 1am without a problem) in my 20+ years of traveling to some of the finest countries in the world including dubai the maldives and many more the room was immaculate and was well presented this was my 2nd stay here and cant not even think of staying anywhere but here when i stop in amsterdam the location is perfect as is every bit of this hotel thank you so much for a wonderfully stay i will see you very soon :)

Reviews.Title: “The Toren is Terrific!!!”
Reviews.Author: mohaffa
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Toren is second to none. They will go out of their way to make your stay enjoyable. The hotel decor is decadent Victorian in beautiful shades of reds and purples and violet. The location is central as it is a mere 5-10 minute walk to all the major attractions such ad the Jordani, Anne Frank House, Red Light, coffee shops and the central train station. Just wanted to thank the owner and the staff for the very good service you provided my wife and I! We would definitely stay here again when we come back to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great city break”
Reviews.Author: aligscott
Reviews.Content: The Toren is a small, luxury boutique hotel situated around 10 minutes walk from the centre of Amsterdam. It is a converted canal house on the Keizersgracht (canal) and is very well appointed. Hotel staff could not be more helpful and friendly. The room we stayed in was not as large as we expected but had all the facilities you could need. It was immaculately clean and the bed was soooo comfortable. The buffet breakfast was good and pretty relaxed. The bar was also a very chilled place. One word of caution - the bathroom was actually in the bedroom, with no separating door. So, as long as you're comfortable with each other, it's not a problem. The toilet is separate but the shower and bath are part of the bedroom with only a curtain for privacy. All in all, a superbly located hotel for shopping and tourism and a very enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “I *heart* Amsterdam (and the Toren)”
Reviews.Author: Fi_onka78
Reviews.Content: First visit to Amsterdam and was blown away (and not by the blustery weather!) by the city itself and the delightful and stylish Toren. Booking taken care of by a friend, who does his research when it comes to such matters and he found us a gem. Friendly and welcoming check in, helpful room induction, (how to operate the Nespresso, for example!) good amenities - iPod/iPhone docking station, free wi-fi, jacuzzi bath, powerful shower, large bath towels (bonus points!) and a moveable hairdryer that doesn't confine you to the bathroom! I can only think of one niggle and that was the narrow width of the single beds. Probably more to do with my larger frame, but even so, my much slimmer friend agreed that the beds were quite small... Delicious breakfast, served in the bar area. A great selection of food - and freshly squeezed orange juice....none of that concentrate stuff at the Toren! Talking of the bar - Gorgeous, sumptuous and cosy. Very welcoming and accommodating staff, who came up trumps by switching the music to a rendition of 'Happy Birthday' as we all clinked glasses at the turn of midnight as one of our party turned another year older! A lovely touch. And as for the location.... Ideal! About 4 stops from Centraal station on the number 13 tram and a 2-3 minute walk from there. Right on the edge of a canal. What's not to love? Would definitely return. No question.

Reviews.Title: “tiny luxury”
Reviews.Author: iloveaixMelbourne
Reviews.Content: it will be the smallest room you have ever stayed in but it will be the cosiest and most luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “You can't go wrong with it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lisboa_11
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at The Toren for 3 nights. We had their Bridal suite and it was just awesome! The hotel location is great, it is close to the Centraal Station and even closer to The Dam but far enough from the latter to keep you away from the crowd. You can reach both within a reasonable walking distance. The hotel is really close to the Jordaan Walk, where you can find all sort of restaurants and the Anne Frank museum is in the back corner of the block where the hotel is at; perfect! In that same block you have nice canal cruises departing almost all day long. The staff was absolutely lovely and always there for us. Our room had a nice touch of a Nespresso coffee machine with free coffee capsules and it was very spacious and clean. The bed was absolutely fantastic; clean, soft, real king size; all first class! The breakfast was delicious. Not about quantity but had great quality at a reasonable price of 12 Euros per person. Nothing outrageous, although you can eat cheaper really close to the Hotel if you want; we didn't. Bottom line, whenever we go back to Amsterdam, The Toren is definitely our place to stay again. You really can't go wrong with it.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel made our trip.”
Reviews.Author: AudraJean
Reviews.Content: We spent considerable time researching our hotel for this trip, and we were so happy with our decision! We stayed here for 10 days while in AMS, and the service and staff was AMAZING! The hotel was beautiful and the food was delicious! If I HAD to pick anything that I would have corrected... the room was a bit dusty, some of the furniture looked a bit abused, and the lights in our tub didn't work. But all-in-all these are very minimal things in my opinion, especially when you keep in mind that European standards for hotels are NOT the same as American, and this isn't five stars yet... though it feels like it definitely may be soon. And honestly, when you're thousands of miles from home, hotel service like this is priceless! Who wants to stay in a generic-looking hotel anyway?

Reviews.Title: “As good as it gets.”
Reviews.Author: patricia m
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it all. Friendly helpfull staff, Great Location, Comfortable, Luxurious, Stylish rooms. Delicious breakfasts. It is simply the most perfect plce to stay in Amsterdam. I can honestly say I have never felt so welcome in any other hotel as I did in the Toren.

Reviews.Title: “We didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: spivvycarl
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend took me to Amsterdam for my birthday last week and we stayed at The Toren. The hotel was kept a surprise to me, and what a lovely surprise it was! Both buildings are 17th century canal houses looking onto the Keizersgracht. The main building seemed lovely, the reception staff were very helpful and the porter who carried our bags and showed us to our room was chatty and pleasant. We didn't drink in the bar, but the porter showed us it anyway and it looked amazing! We were staying in the annex building, just a couple of doors down the street, and it was equally lovely. The decor throughout is very sumptuous and decadent. Our room was a double, with an amazing bath/shower (VERY deep bath and VERY powerful shower) ensuite. Again the furnishings were lovely in various shades of red, burgandy and purple. The room itself was on the small side, but I gather that that's a feature of the canal houses. It was a great touch to have a Nespresso machine in the room too. The hotel doesn't have a restaurant but does provide a menu from the nearby Christophe's, a formerly Michelin starred place (1989-2006), and will deliver - we didn't take them up on this but had a look at the menu and it looked very good, although unsurprisingly quite pricey. The location is great, being a stone's throw from the Anne Frank Huis and 5/10 minutes walk from Dam Square. We'd definitely recommend going to The Toren!

Reviews.Title: “How perfect!”
Reviews.Author: ruth66
Reviews.Content: Just had a great stay at the lovely Hotel Toren! Kind, helpful staff, plush room, ever so comfortable bed and linens (and a jacuzzi - well worth it on chilly nights). The hotel was professional yet intimate. Loved waking up to one of the best hotel breakfasts ever. Truly a destination in itself. Highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sally B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Toren Hotel for 10 days and can't wait to go back. The Toren is a beautiful and unique boutique hotel on Amsterdam's most beautiful canal. The ambiance was wonderful, I can't rave enough about the customer service and friendliness of the staff. It was first class from facilities, staff, to food and beverage. It is in a perfect location central to the best part of Amsterdam. We travel often and the Toren tops our list of favorites.

Reviews.Title: “Just fabulous...”
Reviews.Author: Libby K
Reviews.Content: Stop looking. Book the Toren. You could spend all day considering other hotels but the Toren is central, beautiful, sumptuous, and is completely made glorious by its outstanding service from friendly English-speaking staff. Letâ€™s be honest, if youâ€™re paying money to go somewhere, you want to have your needs met, you want somewhere beautiful and safe you can look forward to going to sleep in, and you want to feel you got value for money. After our 4day stay I can honestly say that even though there were some glitches (the underwater light in our double Jacuzzi didnâ€™t come on â€“ shock) the staff instantly move to â€˜make it betterâ€™ (quick, have a drink on us to say sorry) and little touches like the VERY kind Wendy on reception totally surprising us with complimentary champagne and chocolates because sheâ€™d heard we were there for a birthday and anniversary... just gorgeous. We had breakfast (which they kindly designed to our wishes at no extra cost) in the room whilst wearing the fluffy robes and slippers provided, we had drinks in the glamorous and stately bar, we walked along the canal and round the corner to Anne Frank house, we shopped at the little boutiques 2mins away. I slept like Iâ€™ve never slept before in the massive comfy bed. We stayed in the annexe but it felt exactly like the main hotel as the decor and branding is identical. Our room was not canal side but instead had a little terrace, shared with one other room. Only negatives I could find â€“ Our drawer unit was tiny and drawers kept sticking. Terrace was not cleaned in the 4 days we were there - a glass was left on the little table outside. One lightbulb was out in our chandelier. We didnâ€™t mention these whilst there. Coffee machine broken when we arrived â€“ replaced as soon as we mentioned it. Our Jacuzzi light not working, free drinks given as mentioned before... Not much really. I could have had these same â€˜glitchesâ€™ in another hotel and been left feeling cheated, but because at the Toren it seems to be all about their lovely staff and the instant attempt to make you happy as soon as they hear of a glitch â€“ that is priceless. Overall this is a hotel I can wholeheartedly recommend, just like most of the other reviews - people rave like about the Toren for a reason. Weâ€™ve stayed in lovely hotels in California, Hawaii, France and Spain and indeed others in Amsterdam, but this has been the best service and overall experience that weâ€™ve had. Thank you Wendy and the Toren, we will be coming back as soon as we can.

Reviews.Title: “can't wait to come back!”
Reviews.Author: paul o
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the magnificent Toren Hotel in late 2009 - what a memorable experience it was. the staff were simply amazing throughout my whole stay - nopthing was too much trouble for them, and considering I work at a high level in the industry that is saying something. the rooms, while small (common in Amsterdam), were quite amazing. The position is ideal. In a nutshell, an incredible ghotel, one that I have recommended to many since my stay. I am soon to arrive back at the hotel. The reception team have gone out of there way to make sure that everything is perfect for me, and I haven't even arrived yet! I can't wait to be back in The Toren in four weeks.......

Reviews.Title: “Perhaps the Best Hotel We've Visited...Anywhere.”
Reviews.Author: TOMxxx
Reviews.Content: Everyone has stayed at a hotel that helped define their vacation. You may love the city that you are visiting but if the hotel is sub-par, you'll always remember your trip as less than perfect. Likewise, you may have visited somewhere that doesn't rank highly on your "places I've been" list but the hotel was spectacular and helped make your trip memorable. Well, the Toren is one of those vacation-defining hotels. Do not let the eight months between our stay and this review lead you to believe we are less than enthusiastic about our experience. The Toren ranks as perhaps the best hotel in which we have ever stayed for every reason important to travelers. The property itself is exquisite and has masterfully intertwined history and interior design with all the amenities expected at a first class hotel. The rooms were, as you have likely read, small but they are beautiful, comfortable, and a treat to come back to after a long day in the city...and book a room with a canal view - it makes the room. The charm of the hotel is that it sits amongst the homes of Amsterdamers on the Keizersgracht, just steps away from the Westerkerk, Anne Frank Huis, and outstanding restaurants. When coming and going from the Toren, you feel more like you are visiting someone's home than a hotel -- no elevators, overdone lobbies, or tourists milling about. Beautiful hotel in an excellent location - but what about the service? Well, to say the least, the service was outstanding. The staff is warm and inviting -- whether it was at check-in, during breakfast, each day when we asked for advice on dinner, or when we wanted an amazing cappucino at the bar, we were always treated like guests, not people they were paid to serve. As foodies, we give the front desk staff an A+ on recommendations. Amsterdam is a melting pot of cultures so every day we had amazing dinners from around the world - Indian, Spanish, Italian, Indonesian, and yes, Dutch - and all within a 5 minute walk from the hotel. We were thrilled at the rate we booked online at their site -- albeit it was March and off season so likely quite a bit less than summer but whatever the rate is during the high season, book it - you won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely helpful and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: swimming22
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in early Nov 2011 and had a great experience. The staff could not have been friendlier or more accomodating. When the internet did not work, we were given complimentary drinks at the bar and the front desk staff looked up what we needed. The location was convenient to the main square and good restaurants. The only negative was that my room smelled a bit smoky and dusty due to the heavy draperies, but the comfortable bedding and great bathroom made up for that.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: arturstankiewicz
Reviews.Content: I have just spent one night at The Toren while on the business trip. Excellent small hotel in great location, for less than nearby Pulitzer. The staff is very friendly. Bar with a fantastic atmosphere. Rooms well equipped, with very comfortable bed. This could be super selection for romantic holidays.

Reviews.Title: “All around amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ilovedogs6300
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying my last night at The Toren and it has truly been a wonderful experience. The staff: on par with any five star hotel. The front desk staff was amazing, always cheerful, helpful, and took care of anything we asked of them including dinner reservations and directions. Our room was always clean, the bar tenders took care of us the minute we walked in. The decor: rich and luxurious, beautiful color palette. We stayed in a canal view delux room, and I loved watching the boats glide by or the view of the canal lit up at night. The location: we walked absolutely everywhere, Anne Frank house was around the corner, restaurants and shops in every direction.

Reviews.Title: “No Need To Look Anywhere Else”
Reviews.Author: Paul T
Reviews.Content: A straight 5 stars across the board, from the moment we arrived until the time we had to leave. The staff were so helpful, I cannot fault this hotel and cannot recommend it highly enough. They pick up on the little things and to some, like us, it makes all the difference in making this particular hotel stand out from the rest, that personal touch. Your stay here will be one to remember and one you'll want to come back to again and again. Ideally located on the prettiest canal for those of you who want that little bit of peace and quiet after a long day sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: Lou3303
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing hotel and I wouldn't stay anywhere else when in Amsterdam. The location is ideal and it is by far the nicest in Amsterdam. We stayed in a small double which I was slightly worried about after reading reviews about the lack of space. However we didn't find this an issue. The rooms were spotlessly clean and decorated to a high standard. The breakfast each morning was yummy and the food was of the highest quality. However, unless breakfast is included in the price I would not pay the 14 euros each. There are so many lovely places to eat around the hotel for a more reasonable price. Thank you for an amazing stay to all at The Toren!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden historic gem that should be a five star!”
Reviews.Author: wachoutworld
Reviews.Content: This hotel, situated on one of the loveliest canal streets in Amsterdam is just one block away from the Anne Frank House. The location is phenomenal...just a five minute walk to the city center (Dam Square) without the noise and two minutes from the quaint Nine Streets district. The enthusiastic staff at the Toren always go well above and beyond the call of duty to ensure happy guests. After I flew home, a friend sent a card addressed to me to the hotel. The staff got in touch to let me know, offered to scan the card and to send it to me overseas! They always take great care of us, scheduling tours, booking restaurants and offering their best rooms. The Toren's historic townhouses allow tourists to live like locals. Some of the rooms are very spacious, clean and all gorgeously Gothic, swathed in burgundy and black velvet. Make sure to ask for a canal view which is well worth the extra charges. You can sit by their lobby fireplace, sip champagne and enjoy tasty strawberries. My work allows me the option to stay at another well-known five star hotel just down the street, however, I will always choose the five star service at the Toren instead.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location...service, service, service...”
Reviews.Author: mlange113
Reviews.Content: we stayed in november for 3 nights. occupied deluxe room, overlooking keizersgracht. prior to our arrival i had a number of details to be sorted by the concierge of the htl. when contacting the hotel i found out that they dont have a concierge. my initial reaction was of slight disapointment......and was i wrong! the ladies' at the reception are very swift and highly professional on following up on all sorts of requests made, better then plenty of consierge's in other high end establishments. the staff in the breakfast room and bar in particular are not just friendly, they made our day/s in being extremely kind, offering all sort of help and advise. a salute to the HR department having involved such excellent staff in the toren hotel and congratulations to the staff on being so greatly involved with their guests the room, whilst not the biggest ever occupied by us, was very comfortable. the colour scheme choosen throughout the hotel is lively, fun and bit funky. whilst they list themselves as a 4 star, we thought that they were exceeding many hotels who have claimed the 5th star or being in the high end luxury segment. as for the location we find this particular location probably the most charming. whilst the dylan and pulitzer are just further down the street (where i stayed when the dylan was still the blakes some years ago) we do now prefer The Toren address for its charm and slightly more calm location versus other hotel. thanks to the staff and the management for making our stay so memorable

Reviews.Title: “You just don't want to leave once you are there!!”
Reviews.Author: Paul F
Reviews.Content: Where should i start! Well, prior to arrival i had contact with the hotel and numerous members of staff on many occasions and they couldn't have helped me more!! I could have seemed a little demanding as i was constanly asking questions and for details regarding different rooms however nothing phased the staff, they responded in a timely manner and couldn't have been more helpfull in anyway, i would again like to thank them all!! Upon arrival we did arrive a little early, but the staff took it in there stride and used there knowledge of the area and spent a few minutes while the room was being prepared, suggesting various areas of Amsterdam we may like to visit, this was very helpfull and very professional! Once the room was ready we was escourted to the room where we was shown around and shown how to use all the anmities the room had to offer a very personal touch. The room we had was excellent it was the special room with jacuzzi whirlpool!! This room is perfect couples! The jacuzzi lit up and changed colours which helps set the mood. Also the whole lighting of the room was great many spotlights that are able to be dimmed it just adds to the ambience but a nice touch. The bed was very large and very comfy along with the pillows and quilt. The room was very clean and no noise could be heard. Room service was available which was excellent, along with breakfast that was delievered to our room in the morning. This hotel is perfect for couples especially if you opt for the special rooms. The only problem is, you just don't want to leave once you are there!!!!! Thanks again to everyone who made this stay very special!! Kind regards Paul F

Reviews.Title: “Sparkly fun decor, sparkly fun staff”
Reviews.Author: KDuke7
Reviews.Content: Just had two delightful nights at Toren, travelling with my son the giant 6'6 guy who is usually uncomfortable in teeny tiny Euro-style hotel rooms. He was comfortable at the Toren, with the decent-sized room & the bed was firm and (long enough)! The bathrooms were modern, granite & glass beauties, sparkly and scrupulously clean. The public rooms, bar and lobby were stylish and extravagantly decorated--but seemed a good match for the stylish & charming staff. Location superb, short-ish jaunt to train station, right around the corner from Anne Frank Huis and walking distance to all museums & palace.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GPW22
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a double in there 2nd building, with a twin bed added for our daughter who was with us for 2 out of our three nights in Amsterdam. The hotel is amazingly beautiful as are the rooms. With the extra bed in our room it was fine although not roomy. After our daughter left to continue her trip the extra bed was removed and it was quite roomy. The bathroom was very nice with a luxurious shower/ bath combination - the bath products were nice: shampoo better than what I use at home, face soap too. Bathrobes and slippers provided were nice and comfy.The hotel is in a restored canal house in a nice neighborhood with good places to eat within a short walk. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The hotel bar and breakfast areas are beautifully furnished and although we did not eat breakfast on premise we did enjoy drinks in the bar. The other reviews that suggest this is not a family hotel are right to the extent that there I wouldn't recommend for families with small children, however teens would be perfectly comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Alone in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: lauramChicago
Reviews.Content: I just returned from three nights in Amsterdam which were spent at the Toren Hotel. I was traveling as a single woman alone and wasn't sure when I booked this hotel of its location. I was more than happy with my hotel choice and when I return to Amsterdam, there is no where else I'd rather stay! From the friendly checkin, the daily interactions with the staff, the breakfast and the room, nothing could be improved upon. I can't wait to come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Central Europe 2011”
Reviews.Author: Peter L
Reviews.Content: We read the commentary on this hotel on Trip Advisor before we booked here and after our trip, we agree that it deserves all the positive feedback that it gets. From the helpful reception people to the decorations and fit-out of the hotel, it was first class. Amsterdam was always going to be a challenge with narrow and steep stairs however we were lucky to be accommodated on the second floor. So the 'step master' exercise was enough to counteract the food and drink intake that can be had around the neighbourhood. We look forward to our next visit to Amsterdam and the Torren.

Reviews.Title: “If there was a 6 for service, I'd give it”
Reviews.Author: Gibble1979
Reviews.Content: Only a quick overnight stay, but this place did everything right. First, location is brilliant, in a more calm residential area that feels uniquely Amsterdam and not like the hectic chain store filled streets in the very centre or round Dam square. If you're looking for quirky neighbourhood shops and bars this is the area. As for in the hotel, this place is top 5 for a reason. Staff were welcoming, friendly yet discreet, and most importantly proactive - when you needed something they were there without you having to prompt. Really really good. Rooms were great with bags of style, but as this is an older building all the usual provisos apply if you want lots of space. The bar is nice and atmospheric, and the breakfast also served there is really good. Overall, a great place, well thought out, looks great and caring staff. Nothing else needed

Reviews.Title: “Premier class guest service”
Reviews.Author: cameraderie
Reviews.Content: Just back from 4 nights here with my wife. We stayed in room 431. Spacious, beautiful canal view, Nespresso...etc as others have pointed out and highly recommended. This is an excellent hotel in every respect. But the stand out feature is the friendliness and quality of service provided the staff. In some hotels the staff have 'attitude', in others they are servile but here they smile - and mean it. Just really nice normal people doing a great job. I would stay here again in a heart beat and recommend it to Trip Advisor readers.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Toren”
Reviews.Author: kathiekingston
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about this Hotel and I am an official Hotel snob. It is in the part of Amsterdam that you want to stay in. The hotel is located around the corner from the Anne Frank house. You hear the same church bells she heard, view the trees she viewed from her third floor. Our room at the Toren was located on the 3rd third floor in the sister building of the Toren. The narrow building was a room size from top to bottom. Out room was facing the canal on the third floor. Spacious, huge windows, comfy king sized bed, we were in heaven. The staff was not only friendly but did a great job directing us to the local popular resturants e hidden near the hotel and I can't even express how good the food was. We loved Amsterdam and it was the Hotel staff and the location that helped make Amsterdam the absolute best stop on our Europe Tour. Everything is in walking distance or biking distance. Don't miss the Flea/farmers market on Saturday.

Reviews.Title: “The Toren, Keizersgracht Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Helen N
Reviews.Content: This may be the friendliest hotel in Europe. We stayed for two nights last week (October 2011) having come from Paris and en-route to Brussels. The buildings are charming (We stayed in the annexe a few doors along from the main hotel) and the location is superb, being a short walk from Dam Square and within easy reach of tram and canal-bus stops. But the real stars of the show are the hotel staff. Without exception we found them not only friendly but also prepared to take time to help guests. For example we asked the receptionists where to book our onward train tickets. They looked up the times, booked the tickets and then printed them, saving us time and trouble in going to the station. When our young son had taken some photos in the city the receptionists and the dining room staff took the trouble to look at them. When we returned to collect our luggage the cleaning lady returned some things that we'd left in the room. The man that showed us to our room seemed to be very proud of and enthusiastic about, the hotel. Since filling out a feedback form we were contacted by the hotel owners, Eric and Petra Toren to thank us for our comments. It was a very nice personal touch and this enthusiasm is reflected in all aspects of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly boutique hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: stacey049
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very pretty location overlooking the canals, surrounded by lots of individual shops, cafes and restaurants. The staff are so charming, nothing is too much effort and they want to help in any way they can. The hotel is in 2 separate houses, the architecture is quite beautiful with lots of period detail. We have 2 sons (10 and 13), so had requested a family room. We had the large Royal Suite (room 406) that had a double bed and 2 singles, so there was plenty of room and the windows opened out onto our own terrace with furniture, which would be lovely to sit out in good weather. The bathroom is great with a separate shower and jaccusi bath but is down stairs. Beware, the staircase is very steep and this room would not be suitable for anyone with young children or the elderly, so check when booking. The colours chosen for the decor are dark purples, blacks and reds and because the lighting isn't good the room is rather dark. That said, the breakfast was excellent and the quality of service and charm of the management more than compensated for the dimly lit room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Excellent Staff!”
Reviews.Author: David_in_Melbourne
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were generally excellent - I'd have to say that our check-in experience was one of the best we have ever had, anywhere ... the reception gave a very detailed description on a number of things to do and see, as well as recommendations for local restaurants ... and provided a map that identified each suggestion. The hotel is well located and in a beautiful position on the canal ... there are plenty of places around to eat and see, with the centre of the city a short walk away. Our room (the Royal "Bridal" Suite with a Jacuzzi) had the bathroom on a different level to the bedroom - there was a charming (private and internal) staircase to get to it, although you had to be careful at night as it was very very steep. I wouldn't recommend this particular room for families or anyone with mobility issues. The room was in a different building to the reception which really cannot be helped in historic Amsterdam (it was just irritating lugging our baggage back and forth for checkin/checkout), so we didn't use the bar/restaurant that were in the main building. One minor niggle was that our room was at the bottom of busy passage way that meant we awoke whenever the cleaner started work. While we didn't generally object (we wanted to spend time seeing Amsterdam, not sleep in), it was otherwise out of keeping with the luxury status of the accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Flamoybance at it's best !”
Reviews.Author: lily23Winchester
Reviews.Content: Stayed with our two teenage children for 2 nights. Location wonderful, staff attentive, rooms (very) ornate, cleanliness faultless. What can I say ? A thoroughly satisfying stay. I couldn't fault it. HOWEVER, and it's an observation not a criticism - it struck me that it was a hotel for couples rather than families. It was elaborately decorated, dark walls, black chandeliers, amazing jacuzzi bath and black marble bathroom. My children loved it - but it was a far cry from a Disney hotel, if you get my meaning. Don't let this put you off - unless you have 3 screaming children under the age of 5 - in which case dont go to Amsterdam, try EuroDisney. Thankyou The Toren.

Reviews.Title: “2nd lovely stay!”
Reviews.Author: GuyR007
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel before and you cannot fault it. The staff are very helpful and friendly. The only thing we found is that this time we stayed in a deluxe room with a view of the canal and we found the bathroom to be rather small but mainly were bothered by the noise that you get at night from late party goers returning home. So we prefer a room at the back of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, but with a few caveats”
Reviews.Author: BeatrixB
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, great location, wonderful staff. But, there are some things you should be aware of. First, there are some tiny, tiny rooms. We booked a standard double, which is bigger than the small double, so I figured it would be ok. Wrong. I'm used to small hotel rooms, but this could not fit two people and two suitcases. It was a very pretty room, but we should have booked a bigger one. Second, it was dark, I mean, if you drop an earring on the floor, you can't find it, dark. So, bring a flashlight. That said, it was a lovely hotel, and I would totally stay there again, I would just book a bigger room (I already had a flashlight with me).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but probably not a place for kids”
Reviews.Author: LaDonZ
Reviews.Content: Between the great Trip Advisor reviews and Rick Steves' recommendations, my husband and I decided to splurge on The Toren for our recent trip to Amsterdam. Everyone was right about the attentiveness of the staff, the great location, the nice breakfast, and the rooms were sumptuous and spotless and very quiet. Now, I've never thought of myself as an uptight American, but maybe I am more than I realized. So I thought I'd pass on a couple of bits of information in case they weigh into someone else's decision-making. First of all, the only thing that was enclosed in our room was the toilet. The sink, the bathtub, the shower, were all in the main room. So the only privacy you had was when you were in the toilet closet. This may not matter at all to some people, but it might to others. And they may have rooms that aren't like this but it's worth checking on. The second thing is they have all of these huge artistic photographs on the wall, and it wasn't until we were lingering over breakfast that we got to looking at them closer. That's when we saw the handcuffs on the blurred arm on a rumpled bed. And as we looked at the other photographs throughout the lobby, they were all along the same theme. Again, this is just a "heads up" for anyone traveling with children, or for those who like a bit more privacy doing their nightly ablutions -- who might want to be aware of these features of the Toren.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam Excellence”
Reviews.Author: JordanT25
Reviews.Content: This hotel deco was wonderful! Very fancy :) This hotel location was perfect! Close enough to walk everywhere. The hotel staff was excellent. They were very helpful. They recommended some great places to eat and/or drink. I would stay here every time in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place. Exceptionally friendly staff. Superb location.”
Reviews.Author: Annieloulou
