Reviews.Content: We spent three days at The Toren. It is a great location and easy to get everywhere. We hired some bikes from the hotel which is worth doing. The room was luxurious and the staff extremely helpful and friendly. The perfect place for a relaxing break. I would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mordoty
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Toren. We found the hotel quite easily, and it was not far from Central Station, about a 15 minute walk. Checking in was fast and the receptionist was very friendly. She gave us a city map and showed us all the nearby hot-spots and good restaurants. Then we were shown to our room. 116. It was a basic double room. But it didnt appear basic at all!! A huge comfy bed, with a duvet each, large closet, beautiful ensuite,large bathtub, with Rituals toiletries, Lovely!! As it was my husbands birthday they had left sparkling wine, strawberries and chocolates in the room too!! Nice coffe machine, but tricky to use! Out the back of the hotel is a wonderful patio area with many big couches and chairs to relax in! A great smoking area! The bar is small and quaint. Good selection of drinks. We had breakfast there only one morning, and at 12 euro per person, was overpriced I felt. The Breakfast room is very small, and we took ours outside the back,.There was mostly cereal, fruit, rolls & breads. The hot food was cool, so that wasnt the best! Besides the breakfast though, we had a wonderful time there! Situated on a pretty canal, quiet at night, and friendly, helpful staff. I would stay here again for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and staff!”
Reviews.Author: Susan V
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel based on others' reviews and were not disappointed. We stayed in a room with a canal view. Although the rooms are small, they are adequate compared to other European hotels. The bathroom had an over-sized spa tub with powerful jets for relaxing after a long day of sightseeing. The staff could not have been nicer! They were pleased to store our luggage for several hours on "check-out" day, so that we could spend the day at the museums before heading to the cruise terminal in the afternoon. They also made great suggestions for dining, canal tours, etc. The location of this hotel is literally just around the corner from the Anne Frank House, Wester Kerk, canal stops and plenty of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, well-staffed hotel”
Reviews.Author: ilovehuck
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a garden room that had French doors that opened to a courtyard, which we had to ourselves during our stay in September. The decor was dark and heavy but the room was well appointed and we had a good size bathroom, with double sinks and a shower stall with a full door (if you have stayed in EU hotel before, you will know you don't always get that.) The hotel is well-located and easy walking distance to the Dam, where you can pick up the trams, or to other interesting places. The staff was helpful and spoke excellent English. The one downside was the hotel bar was not big enough to hold all guests for breakfast and we thought the eggs looked runny. The bar is a nice place for a nightcap, however.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Toren”
Reviews.Author: Mark503900
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Toren in the Royal bridal suite. Although the room is impressive it is a bit "Gothic" and could do with a bit of a revamp, tired black plastic orchids need replacing with something a bit more appealing. There is a roof top garden just outside the room with seating but no proper access, air conditioning and irrigation pipes spoil what could be a nice additional feature to the room. The stairs down to the impressive bathroom complete with double jacuzzi are steep and narrow, if you are not steady on your feet don't book this room. The only other bad point is that this room and some others are in an annexe a few houses away from the main hotel so you do feel a little left out. The reception and other staff are very welcoming and very helpful. The bed is absolutely huge and very comfortable. Take an Ipod with you, there are plenty of ipod docks in the room. The television channel choice is pathetic. Watch out for the people on bikes in Amsterdam, they give way to nobody including pedestrians. You always feel you are going to get slammed into by someone on a bike, very annoying!!! Take a good map with you, you will get lost otherwise as everywhere looks the same. It is a beautiful city though and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: 4TUNES
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Garden Room in celebration of our Silver Wedding Anniversary. Everything about this hotel is first class...from the decor to the pleasant, helpful reception and bar staff. We had breakfast each morning which was excellent value. The Garden Room option is expensive, but very private and luxurious, and fitted with the deepest spa bath we've ever seen (watch you don't drown!) On our anniversary, we were welcomed back to our room with a card, complementary champagne , strawberries and chocolates. The only areas which could be improved would be to provide free DVD players and WiFi in the room . If your looking to visit Amsterdam as a couple, the Toren Garden Room is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bekaboo1
Reviews.Content: My Fiance and I spent 2 nights at The Toren on our travels through Europe. Very lovely boutique hotel, chic interior and comfortable. We stayed in a junior suite and it was great. Bed was extremely comfortable (I personally like medium firm beds and this was just perfect) The spa bath is huge, very roomy for 2 people and the bathroom came with 2 seperate basins. Shower is reasonably large and water pressure is great. Their toiletries are lovely, I dont usually use hotel shampoos and conditioners but I loved what the Toren had to offer. Our suite had its own courtyard that ajoins with the rest of the hotel courtyard, very clean, private and comfortable and quite romantic at night. We only ate breakfast there once and wished we had both mornings. Great selection of breads, cold meats, cereal, juice and fresh fruit with yogurt, bacon and eggs. Staff were wonderful, very helpful and polite. A shout out to 'Bas' (pronounced 'Bus') our bartender, great guy to talk to and very professional, he definately made our stay a pleasure. Location was perfect for us, very close to the action (Ann Frank house was just behind us and the flower market was only a 45min stroll away) but far enough away that it was quiet enough to relax and enjoy. Would recommend this hotel for any travellers, we are in our late 20s and there were also older guests in the hotel. Thanks to the staff for making our stay memorable! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great time!”
Reviews.Author: morevacation
Reviews.Content: Location: perfect - cool neighborhood that does not feel touristy at all. feels very local, very safe. right on canals. perfect for morning jog after long night out on the town. most everything can be walked to from this spot.. or public transportation is close by if you opt out of walking. Room: fun, funky decor which fits nicely for this town. get a room with a canal view. room is very small, but was expected. housekeeping was spot on, and no complaints. the bed was REALLY comfortable. Facilities: there is a cool bar / breakfast lounge which we did take advantage of. great to grab a bite in the morning, but at night it was cool to have a place to come back to for a nightcap. Not a party scene, but very relazing and friendly service. Value: felt like it was a good price point and money well spent. Hint: take advantage of the hotel's dinner recommendations... they were pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Heartily recommend it for a romantic weekend”
Reviews.Author: ZetaLondon
Reviews.Content: This is a glorious boutique hotel, situated in a lovely part of central Amsterdam, about 15 minutes walk from the station. The decor is very rich and luxurient and there is a distinct boudoir feeling; this is definitely not the hotel to come to if you like it minimalist. There is a large selection of hot and cold food to choose from at breakfast. We had a large de luxe room with a huge jacuzzi/bath tub in the corner - I was very nervous about slipping in wet feet on the black marble surrounding it and had to watch my footing like a hawk! I've marked sleep quality down because the room was hot, despite the air conditioning being on - probably to do with being in the top of the townhouse in the summer and the luxuriousness of the duvets. This is a very special hotel and the high price we paid reflected this - it's one for the special occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel; Great Service; Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Mark W
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights in the hotel, with a view of the canal. We stayed in a Deluxe Room in the Hotel Annex, as the small rooms are tiny. The rooms have a definite boudoir feel. The staff is attentive and friendly. Overall a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Great week-end in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Dorothy M
Reviews.Content: A really nice week-end (the 15th of August) at The Toren. Good location, very practical when arriving by train and then direct tramway to the hotel. Close to a couple of really good restaurants and the Anne Franck Museum. Special thanks to Jessica and Lili, both very helpful, friendly, efficient young ladies. Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “style AND function - a beautiful, lush hotel”
Reviews.Author: noplacelikehomegirl
Reviews.Content: This is such a lovely hotel. The decor is lush and opulent with a hint of decadence. However as is the case with some stylish boutique hotels, function is not sacrificed for style. The room works, with plenty of space and surfaces and storage just where you need it, the hotel is well run and the staff are friendly and at ease. A small but delicious breakfast (great scrambled eggs) served in the boudoir like dining room. A mixed clientelle when I was there - but to be honest with a room in the annex (so lovely) it felt like I could have had the place to myself. Quiet and serene and quiet other wordly. The room had floor to ceiling windows with a view of the canal and so was very light. In fact the photos of the hotel, on its own website and here, do not do it justice as it seems slightly dark and musty - in fact it is moodily dim, rich and overblown (in a good way). Good location for a stroll out, nice little street of shops and lovely places to eat all within a couple of minutes walking.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and great price”
Reviews.Author: CR2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night and arrived very late for check in and were surprised with an upgrade! The luxury suite wasn't a huge room, but for one night was perfect. The bathroom was lovely a big and had a great jacuzzi bathtub. The service was great, staff were friendly, helpful and attentive. They even allowed us an extra hour after check in, as we were slow getting ready in the morning! We were able to leave our luggage for the whole day in the luggage room, no problem. We got a good price, perhaps because we booked so late - but we'll definitely stay again. The location was perfect, in a lovely neighbourhood away from the busy streets, it overlooks the canal and there are lots of little cafes, bars, restaurants within walking distance. Can't fault the place! (Oh, maybe the expensive breakfast - but we passed on that - there were plenty more places to eat). Hope to go back there soon, and would happily recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Toren Hotel, best of Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: mariajuliavasconcelo
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay last May at The Toren Hotel in Amsterdam and it was VERY, VERY nice! The breakfast - delicious - with salmon, eggs, perfect fruits, juices, cheeses arranged so charmingly that made me stay there for a few more time just to appreciate the atmosphere. The staff is very efficient. Very well located near the nine streets. The Toren Hotel will definitely be my address as many times as I go back Amsterdam! Thanks Toren Family!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have been”
Reviews.Author: TipTripTip
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Everything was perfect. We had a small double room in the dependance with (a nice) view to the backside (into a garden). Very clean. Very friendly staff. Impressing furniture. Beautiful room (though quite small) with a beautiful bathroom. Very good breakfast. I would stay here again at any time.

Reviews.Title: “No need to look further!”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravel709
Reviews.Content: The Toren is a class act. We stayed in the annex with no complaints. There was room for three large suitcases and two smaller ones. There was also a large wardrobe for storage. The best part of the room was the beds. They were without question the most comfortable beds we have ever slept in! The room was very clean(I am very fussy about where I stay!). The breakfast they provide really has something for everyone, and the service is great.The hotel is convenient to many sites including the Anne Frank House, Dam Square and the tram stops. What really makes the Toren special though is its staff. I have traveled extensively, and never have I come across a more caring, hard-working, and genuinely pleasant staff! Every question is met with a smile. They go above and beyond to be helpful.You almost feel as if you are staying with family.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing faulty about this tower!”
Reviews.Author: Psasha
Reviews.Content: What a little gem in the middle of the city. Now I finally have a hotel to recommend in AMS. My friend stayed here for a few nights, got an excellent deal, was treated like a queen by the management. We even got free cocktails (pssst). And the room was lovely and cosy, including Rituals products. A feel good place!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, sublime service!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Pam70
Reviews.Content: We were staying in other hotel (Park Hotel) but wanted to know this hotel due to the excellent reviews read in Tripadvisor. So we went riding our bikes around Amsterdam and stop to see The Toren. We just loved it and made reservation to stay 3 nights! Itâ€™s an amazing old house on the canal with elegant decorated rooms and an outstanding staff. Our room was in the next building but was exactly decorated as the ones in the main one. Bathroom was big, clean and new. Although I must recognice that being in the second building is not the same as being in the main one, we loved the room and the hotel. The buffet breakfast has a small but has an excellent selection, and a very good attention. Excellent value for the price! The best of the hotel is the staff. The service they provide is absolutely sublime! They have recommendations for everything, restaurants, shops, tours, and they even rent bikes from MacBike at the same price! We loved the coffee machine in the room, the free wifi, the breakfast, the location, the canal, the bikes, the recommendations, everything was perfect! We recommend it and will surely return!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: leslie026
Reviews.Content: Beautiful old hotel with a fabulous decor. Very romantic for couples. Arrived after 11 p.m. & Robby was waiting for us to take our bags to our room. He then said if we wanted a drink in the lounge he was prepared to serve us for as long as we liked. The breakfast was outstanding. The best part is the staff who make you feel at home and are very efficient at their jobs. We did have a misunderstanding over the breakfast charge (in hindsight I'm sure it was my fault due to menopause memory problems) and the owner took care of it immediately. The owners of the hotel definitely make you feel like you are important. We stayed 3 nights and had a room overlooking the canal. As the blossoms were just coming out, it was beautiful. The hotel also has an inner courtyard to sit in - which is quite private. We're from westcoast of Canada and this was our first visit to Amsterdam. We felt quite safe and if we make it back again, we'll only be staying at The Toren Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic gem in the heart of Amsterdam, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: LuluLimerick
Reviews.Content: I booked the Toren in Amsterdam after reading the glowing reviews on tripadvisor and it was worth every penny. We got upgraded because it was our honeymoon and we had the most beautiful room with a huge comfy bed, a whirlpool, it may not have been a huge room but it was so romantic and plush, it was just perfect. The service from the front desk to the porter to the guys in the breakfast room was top notch, the bar is absolutely gorgeous, breakfast was yummy and nothing was too much trouble. The location is fantastic, just a stroll to Dam Square and there's lots of lovely bars for people watching just around the corner. It's a stunning little boutique hotel and if you're dithering over whether to book or not, book now!! We'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ryu1974
Reviews.Content: A great example of a small hotel that does things right.. Where this hotel stands out is the attention to detail like the breakfast selection being smaller than other hotels but every item is of top quality. Our room had a robe and safe room with a privacy door, very useful if you forget to close the windows. The nespresso machine in the room was a nice touch. The rooms are spacious, clean with comfortable beds and beautifully themed decor. beautiful views over the canals, fantastic central location. The staff are friendly and helpful. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: Primecount
Reviews.Content: Very very helpful and pleasant staff, great location, good price (100 Euro) for small double room - although didn't get breakfast and interesting room deco. Would strongly recommend for couples

Reviews.Title: “A TREASURE”
Reviews.Author: Janie01
Reviews.Content: We can't say enough about The Toren --- Everything was wonderful!!! The staff were exceptionally friendly and enormously helpful. The Toren is located is in a very nice area and the facility was beautiful, clean & convenient. The breakfast, which was included in the special rate we booked, was delicious and beyond our expectations. I will definitely refer The Toren to family and friends who visit Amsterdam and will choose The Toren again on repeat visits!!!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful break in a long journey”
Reviews.Author: mfandef
Reviews.Content: I wanted to break the journey from South Africa to California with an overnight stay in a central part of Amsterdam. I found the Toren hotel on line and liked it's proximity to the Anne Frank House, the canals and the historic areas of Amsterdam. This is a small family run boutique hotel. The reception was most gracious and helpful. A tasteful little bar had views of the street and canal. It also had a warm fire that was particularly welcoming in the evening. My room was beautifully decorated. The bedroom was long but a little narrow (there was a warning about excess luggage on line). The bathroom was spacious and had a great shower! No balancing shower heads or tripping on soaking floors! The coffee machine actually made a good cup of coffee. The bed was comfortable and I slept very well. I really liked the helpful, multilingual staff who directed me to points of interest with great enthusiasm and pride of their city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel like a family”
Reviews.Author: D3mon3
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with this hotel is the warm welcome and the service very efficient, clean the room was perfect. Superb was the Jacuzzi in the room. The location of the hotel was very close to various city attractions. Considering that the residence was in the winter and I was fascinated, I think back in the summer. Special thanks to the staff very polite and professional with their warm hospitality have warmed our winter holiday. For those who want to make a holiday special and memorable experience I recommend The Toren. See you soon and happy holidays to all

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: jebbyg
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at The Toren. It's beautifully deciorated, clean and has wonderful helpful staff. We had a canal view room which was wonderful. The rooms are rather small but have everything you may need. We parked just outside the hotel at a cost of 42 euros for a 24 hr period which the rate anywhere in the city. The hotel also offers a car pick up service where they can call a company and take the car outside the city to a lot at much lower prices. The hotel is centrally located and is very close to centre of town, shopping, Anne Frank House and the boat tours. We also did a dinner cruise which was wonderful. We had late night drinks at the bar which is also beautifully decorated. I would recommend this hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: marierunne
Reviews.Content: Lovely, lovely hotel! The interior decorations are unique, beautiful and luxuary. The view of the Keizergracht canal and location is superb â€“ and on top of that the staff Ã¤r devoted, friendly and very professional! A stay here is well worth your money and something you will remember. I have stayed at the Toren both with my husband and with my company â€“ and the hotel suited both a romantic weekend and a business trip. And we all were extremely satisfied with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutly fantastic, beautiful rooms and wonderful view!”
Reviews.Author: A1yssaD
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed at The Toren for 2 nights on our Honeymoon in June. We were greeted by friendly and very helpful staff who organised for car packing and directed us to the best areas for shopping, sightseeing and cafes which was very helpful for first timers to the city. We were taken to our gorgeous, recently renovated special deluxe room sporting a double Jacuzzi, beautiful bathroom and fitting and a enormous plush bed fit for a queen and a wonderful view of the canal just for good measure. We were also surprised by the staff with champagne, strawberries and chocolates to celebrate our special occasion. The location of the hotel could not be better, you are a few minutes walk to Dam Square, which was handy to drop off all of the shopping bags and many other attractions within walking distance. Our stay at The Toren was not long enough and i would not hesitate to return for a longer stay in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Mesmerizing! We will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: msvoboda1179
Reviews.Content: Spent our wedding night in one of the special suites of this hotel (just a few houses down from the building with the reception). Larger rooms there, same vibe, just brilliant. Service in advance, during and after the stay there was sublime. The best hotel service we have received so far in hotel stays in general. Kind enthusiastic staff making suggestions for things we had not thought of or were unaware of. Spectacular reception area and bar, all rich Rococo style. We got suite 406, with an equally spectacular Rococo style finish of the room: gold ornaments on the ceiling, a beautiful chandelier, fire place area, sitting area by the windows, antique desk next to the entrance. Lot of 'walking around' space. Wonderful king size bed which has the matrass as it should be: ONE large matrass rather than 2 x 1 pers matrasses with the break in the middle (don't understand why other hotels still do that). So Great! Then downstairs... yes, split level. A bathroom beyond imagination. Upon entrance, against the right side 2 beautiful spacious sinks, to the left first a walk in shower with multiple showers, next to it a large jacuzzi and behind the back wall of the jacuzzi the toilet. The bathroom alone is just as big as some of the hotel rooms we stayed in in the past, excellent! Concluding: the experience at Hotel the Toren really finished off an already magical day in style, actually extended 'Our Day' to the day after as well. Extra compliments for the breakfast with champagne and all the dishes prepared for us, brought by room service. We spent an hour on the breakfast and still only finished half ;-) A big thank you to everyone involved at The Toren, you really made the stay unforgettable for us and we cannot wait to return! Recommended to everyone who would like to stay in Amsterdam in a luxurious environment. Located at the canal De Keizersgracht, in the Jordaan (one of the hot spots in Amsterdam), with everything right around the corner (the Dam, Anne Frank House, Flower Market etc) in the shadow of the Westerkerk.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel wonderful bed”
Reviews.Author: Davina12
Reviews.Content: gorgeous hotel, very helpful staff..wonderful bed. staff were very helpful with all questions and recommendations

Reviews.Title: “Bestest hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: kittykat1984_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel recently (16-20th july 2011) with my fiance. The hotel was absolutley stunning. I couldn't get over the size of the room plus we had a hot-tub which had lights that changed colours and a shower room with a power shower and a shower with a big head.The decore in the room was beautiful and there was everything in the room that we needed ie hair dryer,coffee machine tea etc. The lighting in the room was vey nice they had spot lights on the celling over the bathroom area and a chandiler above the bed. The veiw from the room was gorgeous as it over looked the canal. The hotel staff very extremly nice and friendly and would have done anything to make your stay more comfortable. They made us feel very welcomed in the hotel and helped us out with information when we needed it.The hotel also has a bar with gorgeous decore in it also. I could not fault this hotel at all apart from a little outside noise which was not from inside the hotel itself and it was def not a problem as we both enjoyed our stay here and were very sad to leave and we would def recommend anyone to stay there if they were travelling to Amsterdam. Fantastic hotel. :) :) :)

Reviews.Title: “La belle Ã©poque”
Reviews.Author: TuckyBroSnr
Reviews.Content: The Toren is a fin de siÃ¨cle boutique hotel that provides a level of comfort and service rarely encountered since Edwardian days. It is in a prime location making it easy to wander in to the Dam or the Jordaan. Service was very friendly and extremely helpful. I had sketched a full-on programme for our five day visit, and reception facilitated everything I wanted to do perfectly, from pick-up at the airport, bikes, boats, tickets, restaurants, bars, taxis etc. A wonderful long weekend celebrating our Pearl Wedding Anniversary made extra special by the attentiveness of the Toren. Thank you all so much.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marketmiami1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Toren for 2 nights in early July. I was excited to check in and see the rooms, because from the pictures the rooms seemed pretty unique. In actuality, seeing the rooms first hand was much better. Everything was very well decorated and the big fluffy bed was extremely comfortable. My favorite part was the bathroom with all the marble and a lot of space for a small building. All of the staff were very friendly and gave us some good tips on nearby restaurants. Although I did not have breakfast in the hotel, we did get some drinks at the bar at night. The bar area was also one of my favorite rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Moulin Rouge comes to Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Fresiandaniels
Reviews.Content: Having read other reviews, I can agree that the uncollected rubbish around the canals was a bit surprising and disappointing, as we have never encountered the situation in Amsterdam previously. Perhaps there is some industrial action? However, this in no way affected the sultry fun of the Toren. Better to stay in luxury when there is rubbish in the streets than in a hovel, I'd say. The rooms are small- no doubt. We were upgraded to a canal deluxe and although we had to shuffle around the room with suitcases, it in no way affected the magic of the giilts, crimsons and blacks of the room. The breakfast buffet was more than adequate and served in a simply gorgeous room which owes more to Moulin Rouge than Van Gough. Sumptuous, splendid and a lot of fun. Reception staff were smiling, fun, helpful and a good introduction to the experience. A great place for a little fantasy for the real world.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to the mark”
Reviews.Author: GoldCoastOzzie
Reviews.Content: We have no reason that the hotel is not an authentic canal house from a former grand era.. However the area was littered with household rubbish, the canals were filthy and the cyclists prepared to run us down-we felt physically threatened until I used an umbrella to ward them off! You have difficulty presenting a premium property whether in Amsterdam or Cairo if you are surrounded by uncollected rubbish and filth. The staff at reception were excellent, but the room was small (we arranged a larger canal view room) and dark. Day after day many of the bath towels in the room were frayed at the edges- just not up to the mark.

Reviews.Title: “great place, great location”
Reviews.Author: tadwook
Reviews.Content: this is really nice place. of course the rooms are bit small and make sure you request to stay in the main building and you wont get to enjoy the bar. really enjoy the burlesque feel of the place and the location is amazing. prob not the best value for money but worth the treat if you are in the mood to spend a little extra money

Reviews.Title: “Heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Baidun
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights with 2 children in separte beds in the Bridal Suite - a very large bedroom with a downstairs bathroom. The kids loved the huge jacuzzi, although the narrow stairs down are not for the frail (needs another handrail). Plus a makeshift balcony for drinks on the roof accessible by climbing through the window ! The hotel breakfast is better value (extra $12 per adult) than anything around and the lounge and rooms are fascinatingly decorated. Good reception service, easy to get the car parked via their B Smart service. Die Toren has an enormous variety of good restaurants close by, such as Prego. The Boathouse Canal Cruises start just around the corner (better than going to the station). In all the hotel offered a great room wiith lots of space and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary Hotel, Extraordinary People”
Reviews.Author: hmh1949
Reviews.Content: Those of you who use Trip Advisor to help you select hotels are unhappily familiar with these typical types of review: the "we didn't get treated exactly like we wanted, so this hotel is terrible" review, the "something extraordinarily horrible happened not ever experienced by any other guest, so this hotel is terrible" review, and on the other end of the spectrum, the "this is absolutely the greatest place in the entire universe, even though we haven't traveled everywhere, but this hotel is extraordinary" review. Â  My review of Hotel Toren isn't any of these review types, but this hotel IS extraordinary.Â  Yes, the location is excellent: overlooking Keisergracht canal, a short walk from the Anne Frank House, Nieuw Kerke, the Jordaan neighborhood with terrific restaurants and shopping, and a key tram line.Â  Yes, the web site photos of the rooms, the breakfast area, the garden, and the lounge can be depended on: luxurious, comfortable, inviting, and Â beautifully appointed. Yes, the breakfast is delicious and generous, and the bar is well-stocked with top drawer bottles, good wines, and tasty snacks. But the key to why the Hotel Toren is extraordinary is the PEOPLE who work there, from the owners to the reception team to the bartenders, waiters, bellmen, and, maid staff. Â  One expects the reception staff to be knowledgeable about the city, local restaurants, and inside information about local events...and the reception staff's ability to tune into our interests quickly was amazing - their dining suggestions were perfect and their help with our itinerary was spot on. One expects good service from staff at meals and in the bar, but this team had the right mix of attentiveness, skill, and unobtrusiveness, to make our experience very comfortable. Most of all, the Hotel Toren staff was KIND...not a term one usually applies to hotel staff. Â  When I was injured in a fluke accident my first day ( I tripped on the street, sprained my ankle and broke my wrist), the owners and staff helped clean me up, get me to a hospital, find a wheelchair to use during my stay...every day, they anticipated my needs for ice for my ankle, taxis to get around, a helping hand to go up and down stairs, to carry myq wheelchair through the lobby...all without a grumble. They did it out of kindness and concern, as one would have for a friend or family member. Â My wife and I have stayed at good hotels and B & Bs, and we have stayed at great ones...but never have we experienced a hotel staff that was so human, so capable, and so kind. That is why the Hotel Toren is extraordinary. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great start to a visit to Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: gardenadmirer
Reviews.Content: Euro-chic is the decor with its black and purple fabrics and gorgeous chandeliers. A great way to start your stay in Amsterdam; a city with design oozing from its window fronts. We had a smallish but delightful room with a very clean bathroom with a roomy tub. Air conditioner was in great working order and we appreciated the stream lined in room coffee machine. We used the stairs even though the elevator was available. Be careful you might miss it because its designed to look like a room door! The bar and reception staff was very attentive and breakfast was was good. A lovely canal right out the front door, close to great restaurants and just around the corner from the Anne Frank House. After a night out, it was wonderful to see the hotel lights glimmer from across the canal as we headed in for the evening. Have a drink in the garden patio; lovely at night. You can walk from the train station if its a nice day in 20 minutes. If you have alot of luggage take a cab and safe your feet. Excellent location. Be ready to walk cobblestones ladies.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service and Great Location - I will return here anytime”
Reviews.Author: margijane
Reviews.Content: I spent 8 nights at this hotel while attending meetings and conference at the RAI - it could have been a stressful time for me with the level of work I had going on but staying at the Toren helped minimise stress because it was so comfortable. From the moment I arrived, the staff could not have been anymore helpful. Nothing was too much trouble and many staff went out of their way to provide outstanding service. The room I was in (421 in the Annex) was enormous and had excellent canal views. It is an easy walk into the central area of Amsterdam but set back enough to not get any noise. It is also in easy walking distance of the Jordaan area with many restaurants and quirky shops. I travel often for work and this rates up with the best accommodation I have stayed in anywhere in the world and, for Europe, it was the best! The breakfast is incredible - beautiful food, plenty of choice plus a la carte. Thanks Eric and all your colleagues for making my time in Amsterdam so stress-free and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Beauty, comfort and staff who treated me as family! I am cancelling my trip to the Frisian islands & staying here!”
Reviews.Author: amy h
Reviews.Content: THE UGLY BACKSTORY: I find myself Amsterdam this year for a research project at the Amsterdam School of Art. I have visited previously but have never traveled here solo. After having good experiences at hostels throughout Europe, and this being a very busy business trip with 12-hour days working at the University, I decided to save a little money and rented a room at a hostel in central Amsterdam about 5 blocks from the central train station. This hostel will not be named but will receive a review from me. I (a female) was put in a room with 5 males. Foolishly, I assumed that they had their rooms segregated by sex. In any case, I thought this would be okay... it was really not okay. Aside from having to get up early in the morning to a room of steamy, boozy breath, I was in a top bunk that made loads of noise when rising. Upon arriving back at 10pm after my first full 12-hour day, I found that the hostel staff seemingly arbitrarily moved me to a different room, when I was told that I would not be moved unless I wanted to. They denied this. I was moved to a room at the back of the hostel that looked out onto a busy and loud walking street, the room was not cleaned, had open bottles of alcohol, empty pizza boxes laying around. When I tried to have a conversation with the staff, they became loud, hostile, rude, dominating and unapologetic. They attempted to make me feel that I signed off on this type of arrangement, and should have expected this. I demanded and got my money back, got my money back and called a taxi. Somehow, fortunately, I wound up with Vincent Versteeg as a taxi driver, and told him that I needed to find a place quickly. I told him that I did not want to be around partying, in thick clouds of marijuana smoke and people up until all hours. I told him that the last time I was in Amsterdam, I stayed at a very nice (and not terribly cheap) hostel that was near the Anne Frank House. ARRIVING AT THE TOREN!! I named Vincent my angel, because he brought me to The Toren. It was well after midnight. I met the lovely Wendy at reception. Wendy was so helpful and cheerful that I immediately felt myself calming down, when an hour before I was in tears, and also still horribly jet-lagged, knowing that I had to be at work the next morning at 9am. They had a small one bedroom only for one night, and I took it immediately. The room was absolutely beautiful, the bed was heavenly and the bathroom was completely updated and after washing up I felt very pampered. All of this was amazing, particularly for the price. Everyone that I met on that one night and beyond (continue reading) was so helpful and friendly and there was no pretense in any of the employeeâ€™s behaviors. The next morning, since I only had the room for one night, I had to pack up again, and was dreading having to look for another place to stay somehow during my 12-hour work day. Checking out, I mentioned my dread, and Anouk and Christy at reception very quickly pieced together a reservation for me that included two different rooms. One standard double, and then for my remaining time, a small single, like what I originally had. Again, I felt immense relief. Not only that: all of my bags were moved for me when I had to move rooms. From the time that I arrived and every night following, the entire staff including: Wendy, Christy and Anouk as mentioned above, Ger, Thomas, Yassar, Sebastian, Marina and Danielle all treated me as a friend, if not family. This is a very good feeling as a female traveling alone. I have stayed at many hotels and have traveled extensively, but have never encountered this kind of genuine kindness and hospitality. After thinking about my experiences, I started thinking that the owners were very smart people, if not also extremely unconventional. I spoke again with Wendy, who incidentally mentioned that she has worked here for 10 years about my theory regarding the owners Eric and Petra Toren: that they had an incredible sense of social intelligence in hiring their staff. Wendy agreed. A day later I was fortunate to meet Petra and Eric. We spoke for about an hour, but only ten minutes into the conversation I realized that I was right. In a nutshell, Eric told me that he not only hires from the heart, hires people with heart. That is: people who are not only willing to be kind and gracious, but actually have a natural propensity to give generously and work together. There are numerous reviews of The Toren that speak to its incredible design, dÃ©cor, location and food. I agree with all of these. However, I am writing to speak of my human experiences here, experiences that were actually inspiring. As a professor, I am very used to contemplating how people interact, and am sensitive to these interactions. The type of management, the people, the experience that they created for me at The Toren was literally something that inspired me to the extent that I plan to write about the experience: I will be writing about the sort of care in management and human relations as something that is a dying art in our largely superficially-connected world today. So, what now?? My plan for after my week-long project at the University ended was to travel to one of the Frisian islands. But, in the end, because of my experience at The Toren, I have decided to stay here in Amsterdam at Sebastianâ€™s, another hotel owned by the Torens and just down the street. I have been to Texel in the past with a traveling partner, and in thinking about making the trip alone, I realized that I was nervous about possibly finding myself in another situation where I did not feel comfortable or even safe. So, I am staying here, with family â˜º Thank you to everyone at The Toren! PS. And yes, it is all exquisitely beautiful, mindfully decadent and gorgeous.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed in the Garden Cottage and loved it”
Reviews.Author: awestesq
Reviews.Content: The room is a little small by American standards, but big enough for two. The bed is really comfortable and the steam shower is great once you figure out how to work it. The room shares a courtyard with the hotel on one side and the owners' residence on the other with each having its own seating area. I suppose it could get loud out there, but we didn't have any noise issues. The only downside to the room was that the wi-fi signal was so weak that I had to go to the bar to get online with my phone. The bar is pretty cool (very purple) and has a decent breakfast for 12 euros. The staff are very friendly and efficient. The hotel is on a relatively quiet street, but just minutes from all of the fun stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely common areas and staff, depressing room”
Reviews.Author: Hotel646464
Reviews.Content: After viewing the photos of this hotel on the Internet, we were very much looking forward to staying at this hotel. We were thrilled with the opulent decor in the main building's lobby and bar. However, things went quickly downhill once we were shown our room in the annex building several doors down. Room 422 is small, even by European standards and has one window overlooking an inner space (not really a courtyard) and water pipes. The walls are blood red, and the room is dark and depressing. We have trouble closing the door each day because it catches on the bedspread. The AC has been quirky, and we sweltered through our first night here even after having a staff member attend to it. I feel as though I am staying in one of the less expensive European hotels that I used to visit in my student days. That being said, the hotel is in a very convenient location, and the staff is absolutely outstanding. Other than our room, this hotel is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly haunt right on the canal”
Reviews.Author: Dotcomm212
Reviews.Content: What a lovely find. We were in the annex building in a double room that had a lovely little patio that was shared by 2 rooms (we were the only ones who used it while we were there). The red and purple decor was like stepping back 100 years ago albeit with a hot tub, free wi-fi and flat screen TV. Not terribly large but very comfortable. The staff could not be more accommodating and gave us a list of their favortie restaurants. We had them make reservations at a few and they were great. The location is just around the corner from the Anne Frank House (get tickets in advance on line by the way and avoid the block long lines to get in). The bar is lovely and perfect for a pre or apres dinner cocktail. I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “No pretences, just lovely staff and surroundings”
Reviews.Author: dng52
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to say thank you to all at the Toren. My wife and I found ourselves in Amsterdam a couple of months ago and couldnâ€™t find a hotel. After ringing ten hotels including a most unhelpful Ibis who kept putting us on hold on an English mobile we found the Toren. I said to my wife, weâ€™ll do a drive by and if we donâ€™t like the look of the place weâ€™d move on. We loved it. Weâ€™re a pair of 50 somethings who still think and sometimes act as though weâ€™re in our 20â€™s. The staff helped us park our car in a secure pound as we had valuables on board, the barman, whoâ€™s name I forget was such a nice guy, helpful in everyway and totally in touch with our thoughts. We eat out on his recommendations and had a fabulous meal and stay. All good. The guys and girls at reception were spot on â€“ friendly, helpful, relaxed and happy. So nice to see in todays life. They all made us feel really comfortable and â€œspecialâ€� It's Boutique and beautiful. I'd recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam favourite, hotel with heart and soul!”
Reviews.Author: gueray
Reviews.Content: Beautiful small boutique hotel, with warm colours, chandeliers, velvet, comfy beds, excellent breakfast choice reasonably priced, â‚¬12. Great service, good location, 5 mins walk to Dam square, 15 mins to Leidesplein. Quiet canal location. Charming bar and outdoor garden and lounge furniture in the back. This hotel has soul, and wipes your stress away! Simply one of my absolute favours, will return!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: mrskeeks
Reviews.Content: Had a beautiful couple of days at this gorgeous hotel. Location is just perfect, in a quiet canal area. Room was luxurious and the bed and pillows were so comfortable. The staff were really helpful, nothing was too much trouble. They advised us which area to go for dinner and their advice was perfect! We stayed in room 404 in which the toilet and shower are quite small. If you are on the large side, you will have problems getting through the shower door! Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Jolize
Reviews.Content: My very 1st trip to Amsterdam I was lucky enough to stay in The Toren - thanks to the reveiews I read on Tripadvisor. I was NOT dissappointed at all. My elderly mom accompanied me on this business trip and how glad I was that I made a booking here. Not only did I love the oppulant decor, but again the staff went out of their way to assist us with luggage, extra bedding, a room on the lower level - all to accomodate my mom that is that all that agile anymore. The lounge (which doubles up as the breakfast area and bar is quite something. I felt lost in an era of Baroque oppulance and grandeur - I loved it. The rooms were beaturifully decorated, with plush towels, a spa bath and down bedding. The hotel is within VERY easy walking distance of all the major Amsterdam attractions. It is surrounded by many lovely restaurants. Right behind the Anne Frank House (a must see) and close to all the public transport stops. Although one of the claims ot fame is being situated in the "Nege straatjes"area, I personally found THAT to be overrated. If your time is limited, you can skip this and rather visit the many other fantastic sights in the area. I also found this hotel to be very good value for money ito European standards. The breakfast every morning was something short of a continental FEAST! And do treat yourself to a traditional Dutch meal at De Roode Kombuis"just down the road from the hotel. The best stamppot and red wine I've had after a LONG exhausting trip.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: rhorgan
Reviews.Content: this hotel was a fantastic experience! My husband and I came to Amsterdam for the first time and had no idea what to expect. Upon arrival at The Toren, the receptionist immediately welcomed us and advised they would be available to fulfill all our needs. These were not just words, they stood behind this throughout our stay...... from booking tours for us to providing a list of recommended restaurants in the city to recommending the ins and outs of the city. They have a lovely breakfast bar in the beautiful sitting area of the hotel. There is no restaurant in the hotel but they work closely with the french restaurant next door for all room service needs. Our room was a little small but they accomodated us immediately when we asked to upgrade to a larger room. Our room was beautiful and overlooked the canal in front of the hotel. The hotel is extremely clean and the decor is absolutely beautiful. The beds were the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in at a hotel. I have severe back issues and these beds were sheer heaven. We both slept like babies. The hotel is close enough to the city center, within walking distance, yet far enough to not be disturbed by any night life noise. We were never disturbed by any outside noise. The general hotel staff was very helpful and responded immediately to any and all needs. I would highly recommend this hotel. It is not cheap but it depends on your needs when away from home. We prefer luxury and a homey atmosphere. This was the place!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: LincolnRio
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in Amsterdam, and staying at Te Toren really made a difference! We had seen hotelsl near The Dam Square and other famous places, but The Toren's location was just perfect, on the canal near Anne Frank's house, and walking distance from the places one wants to visit. The staff is the best, very helpful, friendly people who did anything we needed to make our stay better. We definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Toren, great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: 1TravelingCanuck
Reviews.Content: Due to a necessary stopover in Amsterdam to transfer planes, we decided to extend our stay three nights. Based on the reviews we read on tripadvisor, we decided to book our stay at the Toren. We wanted to be within walking distance of many of the sites, but in a quiet neighborhood, so we could sleep at night. The room we got was small, but then we expected that. It was clean and tastefully appointed - the bed was very comfortable. The only problem was that since I was suffering from jet lag I had trouble sleeping a couple of nights and could hear the chimes from Westerkerk (I think) faintly in the distance - this was my problem though and not the hotel's. The hotel itself had so much character, unlike the bigger chain hotels-loved the decor in the breakfast room. Breakfast buffet was included with our room and we thought it was well worth it. The front desk also had very good suggestions for dinner and were generally very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely THE perfect place to discover Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: Two_Wilsons
Reviews.Content: For us as first-time visitors, Amsterdam was a city of surprises: the grid of canals, the throngs of bicycles, the cafes and restaurants scattered throughout, the honest directness of its people. The Toren was for us the perfect place to discover this beautiful city. The location was fantastic, the room was cozy but comfortable, and the staff was truly friendly, not just officially polite: one of our many pleasures during our visit was sharing a drink and conversation with two hotel staffers after their working hours. Our stay at The Toren helped make our first Amsterdam visit absolutely outstanding. We don't know when we'll return - but when we do, we'll definitely be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic boutique Hotel - centrally located, wonderful decor”
Reviews.Author: Dawn043
Reviews.Content: Stumbled across this on Trip Advisor when looking for a reasonably priced, and decently located, Hotel room in Central Amsterdam. The Hotel was as described, and photographed, on its website. Beautifully decorated room (we were in 412 - which was a few yards down the road from the main reception desk and other part of the Hotel), fantastic bathroom - Vileroy & Boch fittings - flat screen TV, Nespresso coffee machine, safe (no charge). Went for a slightly bigger deluxe bedroom - which slept 3, even though there were only 2 of us. Room wasn't huge, but big and comfortable enough for its purpose which was somewhere to lay a weary head after a lot of walking around the City. The Hotel is fabulously located - just a couple of canal bridges from Dam Square, and about 10 minute walk from Centraal Station. 1 minute walk to Anne Franks Museum (House), and the next door Westerkerk Tower (well worth the climb for the views). Staff were attentive and helpful - from reception to bar, and recommend an evening nightcap in their lounge, complete with Music (&/or football!) TV, and a chess board to end the evening on a competitive edge. Would recommend nearby Restaurant, which is actually affiliated to the nearby Pulitzer Hotel - so didn't feature on the Toren's recommended list of nearby Restaurants, but it's at 238 Keizersgracht - so just a few doors down, on the corner. Excellent food for an evening meal - not the cheapest! Also dined at Toscanini - need to book in advance (internet bookings available via their website) - local Italian, again within a short walk from the Hotel. The Hotel is far enough away from the Red Light District (which is walkable) and in a much nicer, and quieter, part of town than the other side of Dam Square. Dam Square itself is less than a 5 minute walk from the Hotel's front door. This Hotel has clearly had a lot of thought and attention put into its decor - which is in keeping with the style of the building; traditional and atmospheric, but with modern fittings and amenities. Well worth a stay - and cheaper than the larger "business style" Hotels. Wi-fi available in bedrooms, via the TV or your own laptop - may be a small charge, our porter said it was free in the room, but the TV indicated a charge of EURO 8 for 24 hours access to the Wi-Fi - so we were not entirely sure which applied, but as we intended to do no business and it was purely a leisure trip, we didn't bother finding out! At least the facility is there if you need it.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing”
Reviews.Author: SandBTokyo
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel and were sad when it was time to leave. Everything was so beautiful, we felt so relaxed and peaceful. My wife called it the "petit-Versailles". We booked for a deluxe room and were upgraded to the Royal Bridal Suite upon arrival. This is in the annex a few doors down. This annex has a wonderful entrance hallway and the room is fabulous. It was luxurious and huge. The room is actually 2 floors with the huge bathroom downstairs. The bath is a whirl-pool bubble bath and there is a large shower as well, 2 sinks,...and many nice soaps, etc... The room has a large bed, fireplace and of course everything you need to be comfortable. The windows open to a patio on the back, although this may not be an official hotel garden yet. The main building has a garden for people to enjoy and lounge around in. The staff is amazing, so friendly and helpful at all times. The location is wonderful, right in the beautiful canal district a block from the Anne Frank house. It is a great area day and night. The breakfast buffet was a real treat. Very nice food in a very beautiful setting. We looked forward to having breakfast there every morning. The hotel doesn't have an official dinner but they said they can make whatever you want whenever you want. The bar and dining area is really nice. We would love to go back. We booked because of the reviews on Trip Advisor and now also highly recommend The Toren. The Toren is a wonderful memory for us.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic boutique hotel in the heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: CatherineWalker
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Toren during a short beak and were absolutely delighted by this lovely hotel. The location on the canal was perfect for sight-seeing and the staff were welcoming and friendly. Nothing was too much trouble. The bedroom was decorated beautifully and there were even strawberries and chocolates to cheer a weary traveller on arrival. The beds were extremely comfortable and a proper coffee-machine was available for your early morning cuppa. The breakfast was delicious, varied and plentiful and set us up for the days of sight-seeing. Thank you to everyone for making our holiday so special.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, Romantic, & Elegant!!!”
Reviews.Author: Coupleflorida
Reviews.Content: Amazing!!!!! 4 star, more like 5 star!!! Thank you! It truely was like heaven! My husband and i went for our 10 year annivesary and it felt like another honeymoon. Sooo Romantic and Elegant. It was like a someplace from a movie that you would look at and say you wish you could go there, and we did. Amsterdam was By far our favorite on our European trip. We loved it so much we extended our stay an extra day! You first walk up to this luxurious hotel full of antiques, beautiful red & black wall paper, and baroque like furniture! Then, we were greeted by nothing but smiles by the front desk! The room was like paradise, the bed was soft and fluffy like a cloud, there was also choc and strawberries waiting for us in the room. Also, a beautiful tuch was our names on the tv welcoming us, so waming! This staff by far were the best, not only with help around beautiful Amsterdam, but all around People! Good and true! Hard to find in a hotel in home town. Words can not thank them enough! Thank you to all; Wendy,Rule, Thomas, Sirella, Danielle, and all the otter amazing staff, bar tenders and security. You made our trip one we will always talk about in years to come! We will be back and will never stay anywhere else but the Toren!! Thank you for such an wonderful experience!!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent service”
Reviews.Author: aaa12
Reviews.Content: we enjoyed our stay very much.nice location.price/quality of breakfast very well.excellent service.clean room.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location and great service”
Reviews.Author: nhentschel
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel after reading the trip advisor reviews and talking with a friend who had spent a month in Amsterdam. He was right; this is the best neighborhood in Amsterdam and I don't think we would have enjoyed the city as much if we had stayed in a different location. The hotel staff was terrific, helpful and fun to talk to. Also on the plus side, great bed and bath linens. We had dinner a couple of nights at the Seasons restaurant which I would strongly recommend which is just a few blocks from the hotel. The common areas at the hotel are nicely done and the breakfast is goo. On the not so great side, the room was quite small so that you did not want to hang out there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Beds!”
Reviews.Author: lulugaughan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect spot, opposite a canal and really near all the major attractions without being in the heart of the tourist area. It's setting was tranquil, but it had loads of great bars and cafes behind it...all full of locals too so it was definitely a great spot to be in! The rooms were very small and a touch dated, but the comfort factor of the bed more than made up for that, and the bathroom was modern and clean. The staff were very helpful and friendly, and the bar area was nice and sumptuous. All in all this hotel had a great feel to it and I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay!!”
Reviews.Author: DafneJerusalem
Reviews.Content: We took the Royal bridal suite which was georgeous!!! The service provided by the receptionist is very very kind ,pleasent,welcoming and patient. The area of the hotel is great , very nice to be in a hotel which is in a residential area.You feel less as a tourist and more as a local. We were each time impressed to see the canal in front of the exit (and entrance) of the hotel.Great view &feeling. The only 2 little drawbacks are that the bathroom is in a lower level of the room with narrow stairs in between, and the lack of bottles of water provided to the guests especially for making coffee. We did not try the breakfast but it looked awesome. Thank you very very much for your great hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Best service EVER experienced”
Reviews.Author: love-2-travel_2820
Reviews.Content: Thank you for a wonderful stay at your marvellous hotel â€“ I will like to give you the very best recommendations. Room not at all as small as I had expected/feared â€“ and very nice deco. Arrived rather early, and was able to get the room early â€“ very nice. We were out shopping, sightseeing, dining all day and returned to the hotel 10 pm. Even thought my daughter just turned 7 she uses a diaper at night â€“ and yes I forgot to bring themâ€¦ Called the front desk around 10:30 pm to ask where we might be able to buy some at the late hour. 5 minutes later a charming young man knocked our door with 5 diapers â€“ excellent service. I was just so very relived and happy about the excellent service. Breakfast was VERY nice, warm delicious bread, fresh baked croissants, eggs lotâ€™s of cheese â€“ all we could want and more â€“ especially taking into consideration this is a small hotel â€“ it sure didnâ€™t show in the large selection of breakfast. Excellent location, easy and very charming walk to all of central. ALL staff was very sweet, helpful and very effective and fast. Charming little garden, where we enjoyed something cold to drink, before we left for the airport. Suggestion of improvement: Clearly state if a room booked is not in the main building (even though the other building is just as charming) I personally did not like there were no staff on duty at night in the building our room was in.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel, lots of style and great location”
Reviews.Author: Lynn262305
Reviews.Content: A very stylish hotel centrally located esp for the Jordaan area, where there are good restaurants and an interesting market on a Saturday. The staff are attentive and helpful. Our room although small was nicley decorated and had all you would expect from a city centre hotel. Some intersting posters on the wall also entertained. A good breakfast in lush surroundings which served until 11.30 at the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic & unique (& a bit kinky)”
Reviews.Author: ViaggiaBene
Reviews.Content: Beautiful boutique hotel! Wonderful staff (friendly, helpful, welcoming) and perfect location. I stayed at the Toren as I was attending a conference in the city and I did not have a chance to try the very beautiful bar or use hotel services that much, but the atmosphere is truly unique - a blend of traditional Dutch house, OTT decor all red and black and purple velvets and brocades and chandeliers and candles and modern facilities. I had a cozy room with view over the canal and big bathroom. They serve a nice buffet breakfast at reasonable price and it was amazing value for money. The only thing they could improve is maintenance in the rooms - no major problems but a bit more attention to details would be good. It is the perfect place for a romantic weekend - too bad I was there alone. And staff if fantastic - from reception, to breakfast to porters

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to Stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: napman
Reviews.Content: I meet my wife who had been working in Amsterdam the week prior and we switched from her larger meeting hotel to The Toren using Trip Advisor's high rating. The Toren lived up to everything we expected. The location was excellent. Close enough to walk or get on a Tram to all the sights we planned. There were excellent small restaurants within five minutes of the hotel. The staff went out of their way to help us get around the city and make our stay in Amsterdam one to remember. We had not planned to return to the city before leaving for home however we enjoyed our stay so much we hope to rearrange our plans and spend the last day in Holland at The Toren.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: MMSArkansas
Reviews.Content: Wonderful experience, staff was like family. Arrived in town on a early flight so room wasn't ready when we arrived so went to eat & they phoned us shortly afterwards to tell us room was ready. Met owner in back garden who sent us a round of drinks on the house. Rooms quiet, luxurious. Big windows which open up to canal. Street scene gorgeous at night when lit up. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This beautiful hotel is chic, welcoming, luxurious and inspiring.”
Reviews.Author: Omram
Reviews.Content: The Toren is located on a beautiful canal. The owners have created a hotel that offers a wonderful feeling of luxury mixed with hippness. A place Mick Jagger and Oscar Wilde would both like. The lounge is great for writing or people watching. It has velvet chairs and warm amber chandeliers, The music feels like you are in a french new wave movie. It's a good atmosphere. The breakfast at first glance looks average. But it is incredibly good and more than ample. I strongly recommend if you wake up early to eat there. Most other places aren't open. My daughter and I ate like queens. Cheeses, ripe grapes, yogurt, cold cuts, lox, nuts, cereals, strawberries, eggs, bacon..... The front desk folks are fantastic. Kind and generous. The location is not only beautiful it is also conveniently located by the best shopping. It is a five minute walk to the Anne Frank museum. My room was smallish but I liked it very much. The coffee maker made great coffee. The bathtub was huge and memorable. I would recommend the hotel for a romantic getaway, business trip, and it is perfect for a mother and 20 year old daughter to come and enjoy a great week together too!

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic luxury hotel - very opulent room”
Reviews.Author: VixFaxFan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the suites for my husbands 40th birthday. Room was very opulent & bed was comfortable, fantastic bathroom with double bath, shower & his & hers sinks on lower floor, you just need to be careful accessing it after a night out as the stairs are steep! Staff are very pleasant & helpful. Great hotel bar with a wide selection of drinks & very luxurious & comfortable surroundings & lots of interesting people watching! Hotel is conveniently located & we were able to see the whole of Amsterdam on foot despite the snow!

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: sophsta
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at The Toren hotel. Our room was gorgeous and enjoyed many drinks in the hotel's beautiful bar. Staff were friendly and helpful. Location was great - short walk to the centre of town and many great places to eat nearby. Will definitely stay at The Toren Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A very special romantic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Maxime2
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with two girlfriends on a mini break. It lived up to all it's reviews, we all absolutely loved it and would definitely return with our partners. It is perfectly situated with easy access to all of Amsterdam. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The breakfast in bed was 5 star. The bedrooms were extremely tastefully decorated and the beds were so comfortable. The only drawback was the small double room that we booked(for single use) would not be comfortable for two people, so make sure that you get a bigger room. Also the storage space for clothes etc was extremely limited. Having said that, I look forward to a return visit to this hotel and would not stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: NihalF
Reviews.Content: We had an unforgettable experience at the Toren starting with interior design of the hotel, it is so unique in style, extremely cozy, warm, and charming. we stayed in a delux room with Jaccuzi, it was relatively small, but it did not matter as the beauty of it over shadowed that fact. the staff were extremely firendly and helpfull, after spending more than three nights in the hotel, u feel like u r home and staff are family..Breakfast was stunning, served in the magical main lounge of the hotel. Location was also great. The Toren is the best place to stay in when visiting Amsterdam, it goes very well with the culture of the city ;) Would highly recommend it..

Reviews.Title: “An absolute stunner”
Reviews.Author: DrTrelawney
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, having booked a regular room, we were upgraded to one of the gorgeous larger spaces with french windows onto a small patio. The jacuzzi was a delightful added bonus. The staff were friendly without being obsequious. The situation was ideal. Such was the experience that, when planning to return this month, we deliberately booked the same room -- still quite reasonable with a discount for returning guests. One of the loveliest hotels we've stayed in. And we have stayed in plenty.

Reviews.Title: “delightful hotel, excellent customer service,”
Reviews.Author: siobhanmuskett
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Toren on February 14th(for two nights) and it was suitably romantic and absolutely delightful. We had Valentines dinner in the Toscanini, an easy walk away( organised by the hotel) and it was great fun and good food. The room was well furnished, with velvets and brocades which gave a luxury feel and the bathroom with jacuzzi bath was fine. It was the sort of room you would expect in a good canal house hotel ie not large but charming. We had a good view of the canal but it was surprisingly quiet and we heard nothing from our neighbours. We bought roses in the flower market which the hotel put in a flower vase for us, a typical gesture. The reception staff were charming, very eager to help and we felt that they really cared whether we were enjoying our stay. They made sure that we had a good experience of the hotel and Amsterdam. We had breakfast on our second day and wished we had it also on the previous day as we discovered it was remarkably good value - Amsterdam is not cheap for food and 12 Euros for a full buffet breakfast of such high quality is exceptional value. We would definitely recommend this hotel to our friends and have already done so to two other couples looking for a romantic and high quality/value for money experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful customer service”
Reviews.Author: KatieW414
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Toren- the rooms and staff were wonderful, and the location was excellent and close to everything we needed. The customer service was really excellent, especially in accommodating our many requests for room service and helping us find our way around.

Reviews.Title: “Magical return to a fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: primerh
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Amsterdam after a 4 day stay at the Toren Hotel. This was our third visit and as before the holiday exceeded our expectations. We had a double room overlooking the canal with a comfortable bed, jacuzzi bath and the service was exceptional. My husband mentioned we had returned 10 years to celebrate our engagement and were astounded at the arrival of champagne, red roses, chocolates and strawberries compliments of the Toren on Valentines Day. We have never been disappointed by the quality and service provided and we are sure to return again and again. Many Thanks Toren for another unforgettable memory.

Reviews.Title: “Not a review, but a Thank You note !”
Reviews.Author: bashdxb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Toren for 4 nights, at the new building (146). I write this review to say that that this boutique hotel is amazing in every aspect, be it the service, the rooms or the overall ambiance . If i was going back to A'Dam, i would stay at the Toren any time time and over again. This is not a review but a thank you note for the hotel staff for their amazing hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel conveniently located in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: pposte
Reviews.Content: What a gem this place is! So conveniently located with only a 5 minute walk to the center of town. My wife and I were there for only one night but can't wait to go back and stay here again. The rooms are adorable and the bar/restaurant area is beautiful. I can't think of one negative thing about this hotel, except for the fact that they put two small beds together to make a large bed, but that's pretty typical in Europe. If you get a chance to go to Amsterdam, vist The Toren.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and location but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: cartslang
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff, incredibly friendly and helpful. It's a great location particularly if you want to enjoy the nine streets and their quirky shops and restaurants. The breakfast is excellent and good value. The room decor is lovely, confortable bed and quality bed linens. The only negative thing I can say is that the rooms are really very small. Not sure if this is the norm for Amsterdam as it was my first visit. Heartily recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Boutique Hotel in the Heart of Town”
Reviews.Author: Love-n-NY
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this hotel! Being our last night on our trip we decided to splurge and booked the Jr Suite, making the decision easy was that the price for the room was hardly more expensive than the other rooms with jacuzzi tub booking with the internet rate. What a great decision! The room was gorgeous! The decorating in the entire hotel is so classy and elegant for a small botique hotel and the rooms have the same ambiance! The jacuzzi tub was the highlight...we're hesitant to book jacuzzi rooms because it seems alot of the time its just a bathtub with jets, but wow...this jacuzzi was amazing! It sat both of us comfortably with the jets on and bubbles sipping a bottle of champagne...what a wonderful way to end our trip! We werent able to use it because the weather was extremely cold, but the room also comes with a private patio that would be wonderful in warmer weather...as my husband says "to relax and smoke a cuban cigar on." Location, location, location...we were only in Amsterdam for 1 day and because of where the hotel is situated in town we were able to see the entire central area of the city! The trams are extremely easy to navigate, just make sure you buy your tickets from the Central Train Station, otherwise each ticket is only good for 1 hour, and from the Central Station you can buy 24 or 48 hour passes, well worth the price!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: missjulied
Reviews.Content: The Toren is beautifully decorated in an old-world and romantic style. The location was really convenient, right around the corner from the Anne Frank house and close to the Noordermarkt. The staff here is fantastic. I arrived on an early flight, and they sat me down to the buffet breakfast and let me know the minute a room was available. The room I was in was pretty small, but reasonable by European standards. It might have been too cramped for two people, but I peeped in the room next door to me while they were cleaning it and it was definitely big enough for two. I was lucky enough to get a room that looks right out on the canal! The bed was really, really comfortable and the shower had plenty of water pressure and hot water, plus good-quality towels. The hotel bar is beautiful, and they had a lovely roaring fire in the fireplace one cold evening. There were only two small things I thought could have been better. The room had a small desk, with an annoying metal chair. It wasn't even remotely comfortable, and it made a loud clang when anything hard hit it. It seemed really out of place with the rest of the decor. Also, when the tv was turned on it was set at a really loud volume, regardless of what the volume setting had been previously. I don't list these items as reasons to not choose the Toren, more that I hope the hotel will read this and make these small changes. Overall, I would recommend this hotel without reservations. I will definitely be staying there if I spend time in Amsterdam again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mr_and_Mrs_Smith0013
Reviews.Content: An amazing, inviting, luxurious hotel with helpful friendly staff and impeccable service, stayed in a Garden View Deluxe Room with Whirlpool bath, which unfortunately we didn't get the time to use! room was spacious, well laid out and very clean, bed was very comfortable, there were two single duvets on a double bed which felt slightly odd but worked really well for differing body temperatures throughout the night! Hotel decor was very opulent and the Bar was a comfortable inviting place to enjoy a drink, Breakfast was a buffet and there was plenty of choice from cooked to continental and the staff were very attentive as soon as you walked into the room. Only downsides were that we never managed to figure out the Nespresso machine (instructions didn't produce any results!) so we weren't able to indulge in the coffees on offer, that and the fact that we couldn't stay for longer! would definately stay here again! Mr & Mrs Smith

Reviews.Title: “A gem”
Reviews.Author: BluePG
Reviews.Content: Can only say great things about The Toren. The location is terrific, being a ten minute walk from Dam Square, two minutes away from a tram stop, and in a quiet residential area that appears quite affluent. The staff are all extremely friendly and courteous, and very keen to help with maps, directions and dinner reservations in the city. The room itself was a beauty. Incredible bed, with delightful decor and whirlpool bath. A bit dark, but the crimson decor becomes this. The hotel bar is also beautiful in design; it doubles as a breakfast room that provides excellent hot and cold buffet choices. Stay here if you can....and definitely use t'Smalle bar nearby!!

Reviews.Title: “Charming boutique hotel ~ a little overpriced, but nice.”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn2205
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this hotel. The staff was helpful and courteous. The breakfast was not included and not the best value, but there were other places to eat within walking distance. The bar was always open! In the evening, there was no restaurant service; however, the bar staff ordered your food from a next-door restaurant, which was very good. The only real drawback was that a suite to them was about the size of a normal US room. We were expecting more. Other than that, it was a terrific place to stay as we explored Amsterdam and surrounding cities!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Heaven”
Reviews.Author: clairebear0209
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were lucky enough to stay here for four nights on our honeymoon. We had room 406 one of the bridal suites and it was divine. The room was spacious and the decor was fabulous and very romantic. The bathroom was similarly very large with a jacuzzi bath with plenty of toiletries, bathrobes and slippers. The public areas are fabulous too with marvellous decor. We loved this place and hope to return!!!! The hotel is in the Jordaan area, just around the corner from the Anne Frank Museum.
