This is a less touristy area and is more residential, we spent quite a lot of time wandering around the streets looking into the windows of people's houses (everyone in Amsterdam keeps their curtains open) and looking at the fabulous interiors, no IKEA rubbish to be seen here. Also check out the nine streets for some seriously amazing shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: fiona1509
Reviews.Content: I secured a reservation with the Toren after being badly let down by 717 (two days before Christmas!) for a 7/8th January booking made and paid for in November. An initial 'phone call, after searching through Trip Advisor, was handled brilliantly by the reception staff who guided me through the website to show images of the available rooms, feeling slightly silly, as we've been married for 17 years, I booked the Bridal Suite for my husband's birthday weekend. The suite is baroque in style and during a chilly weekend provided a snug nest for exploring the city, everything is just a short walk away. Staff are friendly and helpful but very professional - we had a couple of minor issues with the movie channel and our shower which were resolved within minutes and on checking out we were pleasantly surprised to be given an unasked for discount to compensate for this. Reservations were secured as requested to two top Amsterdam restaurants, Envy and Christophe and the icing on the (birthday) cake was a bottle of chilled champagne waiting in the suite on Saturday afternoon when we returned from shopping as a gift for my husband. Only one niggle...... In this age of technology, at a modern, well run, fabulously staffed, frankly gorgeous hotel why isn't there a free wifi set up for guest use in their rooms? I know it's available in the lounge but I didn't want to have to get dressed and trot down the road.... Everywhere else in Amsterdam from coffee shop to airport seems to do it so come on Mr Toren make your hotel absolutely perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, very well managed.”
Reviews.Author: ratbon
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend break in December and booked one of the larger rooms with a jacuzzi. Both the room and the hotel itself were absolutely stunning and the location perfect for exploring Amsterdam. The extreme weather and heavy snow did cause some hiccups with the breakfast service the first morning of our stay, however the management took our comments very seriously and went far out of their way to resolve matters. The staff at the front desk were all excellent and very friendly too. All in all, I'd have no hesitation in recommending the Toren to anyone. It's a great hotel, run to an exceptional standard.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: Olly49Cumbria
Reviews.Content: This superb hotel is everything the reviews say - elegant, opulant, friendly, comfortable, peaceful but just a stroll from the centre. Now we have discovered this hotel we don't want to stay anywhere else in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and ambiance”
Reviews.Author: spmmartin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the centre of Amsterdam, a perfect location for wherevever you want to visit whether walking or a short tram ride. The first impression of the hotel is of a large town house, when you walk in you are immediately greeted to a warm friendly atmosphere. I can only speak for the main hotel building ( as I believe the hotel does have an annex a couple of buildings away) but after checking in, the room (Junior Suite)met all expectations, from fittings, spa bath, to the underfloor heating in the bathroom. The bar ( which is the breakfast area as well) is a wonderful relaxing area after an afternoon / evening exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location & Romance Too!”
Reviews.Author: Janet_Harvey
Reviews.Content: We had a 2 night layover in Amsterdam after traveling three weeks in Kenya and wanted a place that would be restful, romantic and provide easy access to museums and the delights of Amsterdam. Incredible! The Toren was an easy 5 minute cab ride from Central Station (we took the train from the airport -- also very easy), we were warmly welcomed, served like royalty at the front desk, in the cozy bar, by the bellman in our room set up, at breakfast (which is delicious, varied and more than anyone could want) and by all the staff who made sure we found we our way to all the sights we wanted, excellent meals and locations for dinner within walking distance and, what else can we say. We will be back! You won't be disappointed staying at The Toren and you are likely to be delighted.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay.”
Reviews.Author: adahgerst
Reviews.Content: Location is very good. It is on a quiet street in a very nice part of town and yet very centrally located , so that you can walk everywhere. The staff was very very friendly and our room had everything one needs when traveling,I.e robe slippers ,nespresso coffee etc. Really we were very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “MARVELLOUS!! :O)”
Reviews.Author: Ter13
Reviews.Content: It's a great -clean- economic hotel in the city center. Nice staff. I recommend it everybody: families-couples- friends!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: PoodleRank
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Toren for two nights in November. My room was in the annex, which is several doors down from the main building that houses both the reception as well as the dining room. The Toren is in a what appears to be a residential area right on the Keizersgracht ... one of the major canals that ring the Amsterdam. The two buildings appear to be townhomes that was converted to a hotel. I had a room on the fourth floor, and I think I was upgraded to a canal view room. The decor and furnishings are rich and classical ... maroon velvet furniture abound, and even the rooms are framed with crown moulding and a chandelier. My room was a nice size as a single traveler and I would consider it average sized for a European hotel room. The bathroom was a surprise because it had a combo shower and jacuzzi tub. Frankly, the jacuzzi seemed a little unnecessary for such a little bathroom, but it was a nice touch. The service is what set this hotel apart. I arrived at the hotel at about 9:00AM, after having taken the Thalys from Brussels to Amsterdam. I had just expected to drop my bags off so that I could go have breakfast and explore the city until check-in time. The reception offered breakfast, and I had initially refused because I just didn't want to have a hotel breakfast. I had misunderstood, because they were offering breakfast to me for free. That was a really nice start. Breakfast was a hot buffet breakfast, with wonderfully polite service. From start to finish, the staff all were helpful, exhbiting true hospitality ... I felt like a guest in their house. In terms of location, I was initially hesitant because it seemed a little off the beaten path. Don't let the location on the map fool you ... it's close enough to the big tourist sights, while being far enough away that you feel like you can explore the "real" Amsterdam. The Anne Frank house is around the corner, and the very interesting district of Jordaan is right nearby. The Amsterdam Centraal station is a fifteen minute walk for a fast-walking urban dweller, so everything is very accessible by foot. What's great about being in a residential area is that you can explore restaurants, cafe's and bars that have a nice local/tourist mix. And it's wonderfully quiet at night, except for the church bells of the Westerkirk which ring all day and all night long ... it's a lovely auditory frame for an European city. If you want to explore further, the tram is less than two blocks away. Since it's not a big hotel, the amenities are at a smaller scale. There's a restaurant lounge that might seat 20 (and that would feel crowded) where breakfast and cocktails are served. There's also free internet here, so if you need to connect come here instead of paying in your room. The next time I'm in Amsterdam (and I hope to return!) I will definitely be back over the big luxury chains.

Reviews.Title: “great stay at the toren”
Reviews.Author: one80
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a long weekend at the Toren in Amsterdam. We were really impressed, not only with the decor of the hotel but also the really helpful staff at the hotel. On arrival they will give you a detailed map of the city and also a list of recommended restaurants (which we did follow and were really pleased with). The hotel is located in a lovely part of Amsterdam - straddling the canal district and Jordaan, so there are plenty of nice cafes, shops and markets to visit as well as only being a short walk from Anne Frank museum Definitely worth a stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, sumptuous decor.”
Reviews.Author: Taistealoir
Reviews.Content: The Toren is a stylish designer hotel on a canal in the heart of Amsterdam. The decor is sumptuous rather than the usual designer minimalism. Staff are helpful and friendly and the bar is a cosy retreat from icy cold Amsterdam in winter.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations.”
Reviews.Author: kphardeman
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel for a quick romantic getaway based on the reviews of the quality of it's staff and it's location, and our expectations were exceeded on both counts. We arrived in Amsterdam at 5am and thought we would have to have to wait until the afternoon to check-in but the reception staff did their utmost to accommodate us. The room itself was just what we had hoped for and the location of the Hotel is perfect....as are the lychee and the passion fruit Martini's!

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Fantastic Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: CollinsAvenue
Reviews.Content: Exceptional. Wonderful hotel. Great location. Low key, ambuent lounge like atmosphere in hotel bar very good cocktails. Excellent breakfast buffet with very fresh fruit. But the real standout is the service. I was treated like at VIP the entire time. Perhaps the best price/value I've ever experienced, and I'm an airline pilot flying over 20 years. Frankly, I'd travel back to Amsterdam simply to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, great location, highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Niivi
Reviews.Content: Such a gem! Charming and romantic! We stayed 3 happy nights here. Interior is beautifull, 17th century house with ornamets but not too antiq decoration, gold, black and red colours. Fantastic breakfast: juices, fresh berries, fruits, pancakes, eggs, croissant, breads, muffins, cheeses, hams etc. Great location: relaxed, quiet, front of the canal, about 1.5 km walk from railwaystation and just next to trendy Joordan area and "De 9 Straatjes", 9 street area with great small shops and restaurants. Anne Franks House is only few hundred metres away and if you want to go to canal cruise, you can get it on Boat House, which is on the next corner (150 metres). Very helpfull and friendly staff. A small double room is small, but there`s enough space and room is lovely and bath is great. Also rooms have Nespresso coffee machine and bathrobes, minibar and lcd-telly. Great big and cozy bed. Sleep quality was excellent! We were looking for a romantic and lovely hotel and Toren really was a top choice. Highly recommended and will gladly return!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Serge10613
Reviews.Content: That was an amazing and wonderful stay in Amsterdam - great location, superb servise, excelent staff and so on... Nothing to complain except the building at 17th centure could be built in a way that we would have a little bit larger rooms:)...

Reviews.Title: “The Toren is a gem; a place of great hospitality.”
Reviews.Author: rik0057
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were truly lucky when we came upon The Toren in our on-line search for a hotel in Amsterdam. We wanted a great location, breakfast included, a canal-front room, a welcoming lobby, twin beds, and a little more walking space than the typical small European hotel room. We got all that at a reasonable cost (we stayed a full week, warranting a "special" price, and we split costs) PLUS the great pleasure of the Toren's superb hospitality.The entire staff, from the front desk to the bar/breakfast lounge, to the maids, were all amazingly friendly and helpful, and made us feel entirely welcome and at home. To examplify how completely thoughtful they are to the needs of hotel guests....in the front hall of the main building as well as the nearby second building where we stayed, sits an umbrella stand with several large, strong umbrellas, available to any guest who needs one. In the month of November, when the winds and rain kick up, it's a great convenience. We came with pocket-sized versions that didn't hold up; we were so appreciative to be able to borrow The Toren's umbrellas. How trusting and thoughtful! I must add that the hotel is beautiful - ornate, but lovely - and the breakfast buffet is outstanding; delicious, fresh food, eggs or pancakes to order if you wish, and heavenly coffee. It was tough coming home and having to prepare my own morning food. I would return to The Toren in a heartbeat and highly recommend it to anyone who wants to feel like they're going home each night after a busy day in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect City Break in a perfect hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TerryandGayeB
Reviews.Content: Charmed and relaxed is the overall feeling you are left with after a stay at The Toren. From the welcome we received until the time we left, the staff, decor and general ambiance of this hotel is superb. After staying many times at the five star Hotel Pulitzer, we felt that this hotel had become more suited to corporate clients and a little impersonal. We were looking for a hotel with a bit more of a European feel, we found the perfect place in The Toren. Can't recommend this place highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - absolutely perfect”
Reviews.Author: Kelsrae
Reviews.Content: We booked the Toren for a 3 night stay in November after reading the great reviews on trip advisor. I booked direct with the hotel and from the very start had perfect service from them (via email). We booked the garden cottage and was not disappointed. It was worth paying that little bit extra for for a special weekend. We also booked the champagne on arrival package for 60 euros which was well worth it. We had a bottle of Moet, chocolates and strawberries in our room for arrival and also breakfast in our room on the 1st morning. The hotel advised to use the TCM taxis from the station to the hotel which would cost 7,50, however we took the first taxi (which wasnt a TCM) and he charged us 15 eurors (our own fault). So just be aware and make sure you see the TCM sign on the taxis. The hotel will always use them when booking taxis for you. On arrival the staff were very welcoming and we had a cocktail in the bar while we waited to be shown to our room. Marney (I hope thats how it's spelt) was really nice and a great cocktail maker. When we went to pay they said we didn't have to, a welcome drink :-) We were shown to our room which it outside the hotel because its in the garden - in a lovely large garden area thats also home for the staff. The room was amazing, very romantic/gothic kind of feel, lots of cosy velvet curtains. The biggest and most comfiest bed, seperate area with desk and table. The internet is not free however there are a few options and I went for the wired option which was 8 euros for 24 hours which wasn't too bad. The double jacuzzi bath in the room is just bliss, plenty room for 2. There is a great shower too with a steam setting however we never did work this one out. Lots of lovely towels and toiletries in room. There is a lovely garden area outside the room but the weather wasnt the best when we were there but I cam imagine in the summer it would be lovely to sit out. There is a mini bar in the room but the only alcoholic drinks in it are beer, the rest are soft drinks and snacks but not too expensive. We had a few drinks in the hotel bar, amazing cocktails and not too expenisve. 13 euors for a vodka & orange and a jack daniels & coke. The bar is open until 1am but they staff say they will serve you normal drinks (i.e. not cocktails) any time of the night. They also serve bar snacks, like olives, soup, panninis etc. The location is perfect, we walked everywhere, close to all parts of Amsterdam you'd want to visit. All in all we loved this hotel and would for sure go back. I don't have anything negative to say about it.

Reviews.Title: “Ingen over - ingen ved siden!”
Reviews.Author: Monica2310
Reviews.Content: The best, cosiest, most romantic and coolest place to stay in Amsterdam! The rooms has been upgraded since our last stay, 8 years ago. Now 'our' room had a jacuzzi and a door directly out in the garden. The breakfast is superb, fresh made and very tasty. And the staff is friendly and serviceminded, they will help you to make reservations at restaurants and answer any questions you have. My advice: just try it!!

Reviews.Title: “CHARMING HOTEL,SUPERB SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: REALTORSG
Reviews.Content: Great location, on a canal, walk to most everything and convenient to the trams, which is an excellent way to get around,.. around the corner from the Ann Frank house.Rooms very luxurious,wonderful bedding and bathroom also fabulous..Over the top decorating for my taste, red velvet, flocked wallpaper..very nice lounge, great breakfast, staff most helpful , polite. would go back, loved Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Our secret gem in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Ginmillphil
Reviews.Content: The best decision we made in planning our trip to Amsterdam was to stay at the Toren. My partner and I stayed there for six nights beginning October 16. I could go on and on about how beautiful and quaint and charming the place is, and how wonderfully helpful everybody was who works there, but many people have already written about that in this space. What I liked best, was that after a long day of walking about town, and then dining out, we had this beautiful lounge/cocktail bar to come back to that was open till 1:00 AM. See the photos for yourself on the website. Here was truly an oasis where one could kick back in luxurious elegance and socialize with fellow travelers. All of us felt so lucky to be staying here. The bar is presided over by a bartender named Marne ( I hope I got his name right.) Let me tell you, while the Toren is a charming little townshouse, this guy could be working in the most elegant saloon in the grandest five star hotel in Europe. The fantastic cocktails, the cheerful conversation, the feeling you get that your the most valued guest in somebody's house; this is what is was like each evening as we ended one wonderful day after another in the fireplace lit lounge of the Toren. Bravo to the owners who run a tight ship, to the very helpful front desk attendants and concierge who patiently assisted us in our day to day planning, to the bartender whom I already mentioned, and to all the behind the scenes people who help make the Toren my private little gem in Amsterdam. Phil Calbi

Reviews.Title: “A perfect gem of a city boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: pamelaornstein
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at The Toren Hotel. Mr. and Mrs. Toren have created a superb gem of a hotel. The decor is over-the-top baroque but with modern touches that make it eclectic as well as appealing. The lighting throughout is atmospheric and really quite romantic. Our room was gorgeous, with high gilded ceilings, comfortable bergere chairs, large windows that we could open on to the garden, a great coffee machine (really some of the best espresso), a handsome and large bathroom with a jacuzzi tub and all the amenities, plus plenty of fluffy towels. And of course TV and internet access. The bed was heavenly. We had booked one of the larger rooms, since our agent advised that the regular ones would feel too cramped. I'm glad we did, we loved our room. The hotel is in the Jordaan (one of the most hip parts of the city) on a very beautiful and old canal. A perfect location. I know I am raving, but the best part of the whole experience was the staff. They were the most attentive and helpful I have ever encountered. In the evening upon our return, they would position two comfortable chairs in front of the fire for us in the bar. They made every reservation we needed for dinners and events. The room was immaculate cared for and we never saw anything out of place. At the terrific breakfast in the salon which is magically transformed to a dining room, they replaced strawberries as fast as they were finished, poured coffee before you asked, and made a casual lunch feel intimate and special. I actually cannot think of anything that I can complain about. We had a perfect week and can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel......Great position and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Libben0717
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived at the Toren expecting a good stay after reading all of the reviews on Tripadvisor. At reception the staff could not have been more helpful. They went through the map of Amsterdam in great detail and nothing was too much trouble. We stayed in the Garden Cottage and were not disappointed. After being shown a guided tour of the hotel, we were shown to our room.....Wow !! This is the place to stay if you are thinking about celebrating in style. Room was decorated to a very high standard, rich deep colours making it feel so romantic. Having a double jacuzzi in the room topped it off. Also the steam shower was great. After relaxing with a bottle of champagne, we had a drink in the bar. Once again we received first class service from the bar staff. Drinks were reasonably priced for such an exclusive hotel. This was also where we were served breakfast. For 12 euro's each we found this good value. Buffet style with choices of omelettes on demand, cooked breakfast, ham and cheeses, fresh bread, croissants and pastries, fresh fruit including strawberries, yoghurts, muffins, fresh juices and as much tea and coffee that you could drink. The waiter/waitresses again were excellent. The position of the hotel is great. As we both liked walking, we did not use public transport once as we found that everything we wanted to see and do was well within walking distance. Without doubt the best hotel we have ever stayed in. Thank you so much for the Toren and all of the staff for such an excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and Cozy”
Reviews.Author: trvllife1
Reviews.Content: I booked at the last minute and this was the least expensive hotel with a 4+ star rating that I could find. I knew I was getting the smallest room they had but since I was traveling alone and was only going to be there 1 night it was no big deal. When I arrived I was very pleased with the location and the charm this little hotel has. Reception was very nice and helpful. The small bar off the lobby is very welcoming and comfortable. Great place for a snack, night cap or just sit and relax with friends. The room was very small ( about the size of a large walk in master bedroom closet) but was perfect for my 1 night and very clean and comfortable. The location was perfect and I found it easy to walk any where in the center. About a 10-15 min walk to the train station. I travel through Amsterdam frequently and while I like to stay closer to the train staion this hotel was an excellent back up for me and I would stay again in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: eakthomas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Toren for a long weekend and LOVED our time there! Very unique hotel in that it's purposefully decorated 'over the top.' Red velvet walls, shiny black furniture, glittery flower arrangements...You can't help but feel sexy! It's like a classy bordello, if that makes sense! The staff is very friendly- always smiling and saying hello. The housekeeping staff did an excellent job at keeping our room clean each and every day- which was very important since we were traveling with 2 dogs. Location is AWESOME. You're smack dab in the middle of all the districts and can walk EVERYWHERE. Comfiest best we've ever slept in while in Europe. Fridge and tea maker in the room were perks, too. Our only gripe was that the air conditioner didn't work very well- without the windows open, the room was unbearably stuffy. Internet isn't free and there's no parking, but that's the case everywhere you look...DEFINITELY stay at The Toren if you're looking for something classy AND different!

Reviews.Title: “Gem in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: sherif_chicago
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Toren for five inghts during our first visit to Amsterdam. The hotel is SOOO charming and the staff are extremely personable and helpful. They made great recommendations for dinner. The hotel is perfectly located - on a peaceful street along a canal but within a few minutes walk to great activity. Cute bars and local restaurants right down the street. We were within walking distance of almost everything. The bar/lounge area is gorgeous and there is also a courtyard to have drinks in or to just relax and read. By American standards the rooms may seem a bit small but the beds are huge with fabulous linens and pillows. The showers are great - tall and large showerheads with great water pressure. There is a Nespresso coffe machine in the room and television and internet. A/C worked very well. We had a great experience at The Toren and hope to return. We highly recommend it as the perfect place to stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, very friendly and helpful staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: Villa08
Reviews.Content: I arranged a short break at the Toren Hotel for my husbands 50th birthday as a surprise. The staff were very friendly and welcoming and nothing was too much trouble for them. The room was nicely decorated and the bathroom facilities were fantastic, especially the shower. It was a lovely touch that the staff were aware of my husbands birthday and acknowledged this at breakfast with a complimentary glass of champagne. They also provided a birthday cake at my request. Great location, close to everything, but also quiet away from the hustle and bustle. Would definately staff there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved hotel friendly helpfully staff”
Reviews.Author: kesachris
Reviews.Content: 3 wonderful nights in this romantic hotel, canal view room was lovely our room was in separate building from reception but this was not a problem. Breakfast met our need are reasonably priced. Pre dinner drink in bar a must, great bar tender. Travel a lot and found this one of the better hotels we have stayed in. Staff extremely helpful booking museum tickets recommending and booking restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel - really made our trip!”
Reviews.Author: zoe1m
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in July when we visited Amsterdam for the first time to celebrate my husbands birthday. After lots of research on the internet and worries about the cleanliness, size of rooms or location of all other hotels, although I little more than i wanted to spend I decided i would rather overspend and guarantee good quality than risk a poor hotel ruining our stay. The Toren did not disappoint. The guest service at this hotel is one of the est we have experienced, sometimes the bar staff were a bit slow with their service but everyone was polite, helpful and welcoming at all times. The hotel is a unique style very 'boutique' and the quality of furnishings and especially the bed is very good, the rooms are small but perfectly formed! We enjoyed the plentiful breakfast each morning and also hired bikes which was a great way to see the city. Would recommend Amsterdam and to make your stay a bit special then stay at the Toren you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “A unique hotel in great location provideing great friendly service that met our expectations”
Reviews.Author: corin51
Reviews.Content: The location was great, accessible to all we wanted to do. The staff were wonderful, helpful, friendly and went all the way to assist. The bed was comfortable. Room was inviting, romantic/relaxing. Appreciated the strawberries and chocolates on arrival. Breakfast was plentiful,good variety and peaceful. Wish we'd been able to change flight n stayed another night. Will definately stay here on next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly comfortable and very hospitable boutique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: sunny_ex
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed at "The Hotel Toren" in July this year. We had a wonderful 2 night stay in Amsterdam and at the Toren.We definately should have stayed longer. We absolutely LOVED the hotel and our time in Amsterdam. We commend the staff on their hospitality and friendliness, they were all fantastic. From the very moment we arrived exhausted at the front door when Robert ( the porter) greeted us with a friendly, happy smile and helped us with our bags then suggested we all sit in the very comfortable bar and have a cool drink while he lugged our 10 bags to our rooms. There we met Marne " the best ever barman" who produced some great cocktails for us and then gave us the best advice on where to go for dinner, even made the booking for us. We really enjoyed his drink making skills and his friendliness. Nicco also made a good impression on us, we felt very special. The beds were incredibly comfortable, coffee machines in the rooms. Bathrooms clean and renvovated. My husband and I had a good sized room, my daughter and her boyfriend 's room was much smaller but just as comfortable. My 18 year old daughter had her own room which was tiny but ever so cute and very comfortable. She LOVED it. The decor is very unusual as you would have seen in the website photos. I can't stand cigarette smoke and there was not a wiff of it anywhere. The hotel was clean and well maintained. A canal at the front door. We did not have any views from our windows but we didn't even notice. It wasn't as issue. There are phones in the roooms, intercoms, TV and computers which you can pay to use. My 18 year old did . We paid extra for the breakfast which was well worth it and very delicious. We enjoyed everything about the hotel and the staff. The girls in the front office were exceptionally helpful while booking our rooms from Australia and during our stay. Robert organised our pushbikes for us. Which I also recommend using. We had so much fun with those, riding all around the city and then through the redlight district at midnight. The AnneFrank House was a highlight for us too. Don't miss it.( very short walk form the hotel) I highly recommend this beautiful boutique hotel. We can't wait to go back! Don't try to get the train or tram from the airport, we did and we made it but with only 2 days in Amsterdam we did regret the time wasted trying to find our way at the airport. Taxi would have been much better. We were cranky , hot and tired when we arrived. Thank goodness for Robert! P.S Every street corner looks the bloody same so if you are first timers it takes a bit of getting used to. Don't be scared of the bikes , they made it so much better for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: LoriCarMontreal
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a fabulous location. Our first room was small( by North American standards) but we upgraded and had a beautiful and large room. The staff was exceptional, and the hotel was within walking distance to everything. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Amsterdam...

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: theryanscork
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel from first contact when we were booking. Staff are friendly, helpful and professional. Location is perfect - quiet but close to everything. Rooms are small but that wasn't a surprise. Decor is a welcome change from the blandness of most hotels.... It's definitely on the pricey side for what you get - breakfast, while very good is extra and based on our rate of â‚¬330 per night I think should be included.... Oh - and the double bed comprising of two singles didn't really work as the bases weren't joined so they kept separating :) That said I'd stay there again in a heartbeat. Only real downside for me was leaving......

Reviews.Title: “Highly questionable taste in decor”
Reviews.Author: BreezySydney
Reviews.Content: The Toren gets great reviews, and many of the comments are entirely justified. The staff were exceptionally helpful and the location is perfect. However, the decor was highly questionable. It was on the knife edge between luxuriously glamorous and hideously awful. The room decor was so busy that it felt cramped (and we were in one of the larger rooms). Also, there are stains on the carpet and one of our power outlets was coming loose from the wall. We had to pay extra for breakfast and internet. Overall, not worth the high price we paid for our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother looking elsewhere, this is the only place to stay when in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: Little_Traveller18
Reviews.Content: Without a doubt, the best city hotel we have ever stayed at. The Toren has been so beautifully decorated in a Moulin Rouge type feel and the staff were very knowledgable, helpful and friendly - they really know how to look after you and they went out of their way to make you feel welcome (but not in an overbearing type way). The location was very good - right in front of a canal, around the corner from Anne Frank House and about an 8 min walk to Dam Square. We had a standard double room, bit still had plenty of room with the most comfortable bed ever and loads of pillows to sink into. The bathroom was big with a massive shower head and the complimentary bathroom items smelled divine. They don't have a restaurant, but they do partner up with a local award-winning restaurant to serve breakfast or if you want to eat dinner at the hotel or in your room. Ask for the list of recommended restaurants as well, we took a local Dutch recommendation from the list (De Leewte, I think it was called?) and they booked our table for us as it was a busy Saturday night. We weren't disappointed there either. Don't pass on the cocktail list from the hotel bar - they are made with care and tasted fantastic. The barmen really know their stuff! I really can't find a fault with The Toren, I loved it so much and will definitely be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Sumptuous, cozy, great staff. Best hotel we've had in Amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: Pollyanna-Ist
Reviews.Content: As travelers to Amsterdam know, hotels tend to be pricey and you don't always get quality or comfort (or courteousness) for your money. This has often been the case whenever we have taken a getaway weekend in Amsterdam. Thankfully Toren was different. The Toren's location is perfect--on a quiet part of a canal street, in easy walking distance of attractions or tram stops. We were so pleasantly surprised by the appearance of the hotel. Situated in an old canal house, the decor is baroque. A bit over the top in some parts, but the overall effect is far more luxurious and visually satisfying than the concept-less, bare bones style of many other places we've stayed. The standard double room was a bit small, as most hotel rooms in Amsterdam tend to be, but it was SO comfortable! A complimentary in room Nespresso machine was the perfect amenity after a day of walking the city. The bed was so comfortable to cuddle up in that one afternoon after being caught in the rain we came back to change and got so comfortable that we cuddled up, ordered room service, and watched a movie instead. The bathroom was new, modern, immaculate. Above and beyond that, the staff were friendly and courteous--also not typical in Amsterdam. They even surprised us one day with a chilled bottle of champagne, and martini glasses filled with chocolates and strawberries. We will definitely be staying at the Toren on our future trips to Amsterdam. I can't recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: Dalia_Ghaly
Reviews.Content: we spent 4 days /3 nights at the toren hotel this summer me, my husband, our 6 years old daughter and our 17 month kid, the hotel is very close to central train station it cost us 10 euro for taxi , the decoration is really fantatsic , very fast check in , the hotel staff are very helpful , the hotel is divided between 2 buildings we were niot staued in th emain building, our triple room has a very resonable space , they provided cot for free as well , th ebeds are comfy , though the bathroom was small but it was spotless and clean , thr room has a nice view over the canal and the hotel was with a walking distance to all main sites , I defenitely recommend it for all travellers and cannot wait to stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Amaizing hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Luka55
Reviews.Content: Ahhh...this hotel - i am getting goose bumps when i remember Toren...the hotel is soo cozy, "old style luxury hotel"...definitely THE BEST BED I TRIED IN MY LIFE...the soft pillows...great bar...great bathroom..Toren is a bit pricey but it's great value for your money.. There is just 1 bad thing about this hotel, actually the room we stayed in - it was extremely small so my advice is: BOOK THE DELUXE ROOM! next time i'm in Amsterdam - i know i definitly will.. Would definitely recommend to anyone (maybe not to a family with children)..enjoy !

Reviews.Title: “Charming, memorable, delightful, informal family friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: basaltdrock
Reviews.Content: The Toren is the only hotel you need to know if you are staying in Amsterdam! It is centrally located, overlooking one of the many canals. It consists of two beautiful buildings on Keizersgracht. My wife, two young kids and I spent 5 nights / 6 days at the Toren. Everybody we dealt with, were extremely helpful, courteous, polite, efficient and most of all, warm and friendly - from the cleaning staff to the owners. The rooms are beautifully decorated and the whole hotel is totally different from the bland, clinical norm. Service was top class. Food was fantastic, all at value for money. I really mean it when I say my wife and 2 children, aged 5 and 1, would simply not consider anywhere else in Amsterdam. It is a rare place that combines top class professional service, with charm and warmth. We will return to The Toren very soon!

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: maximilianIreland
Reviews.Content: This is a really great hotel. Located in a nice area of Amsterdam and is within walking distance of everything you need - shops, bars, cafes, museums etc. Great staff service. Would highly recommend this hotel and I will be back there again!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel staff in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: hillbillyexpat
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights at the Toren â€“ the best hotel in Amsterdam (and Iâ€™ve been there many times)! From the moment I was greeted by the front desk staff to when checking out â€“ the service could not have been more pleasant. I arrived early (from an overnight transatlantic flight) and went straight to the hotel. The room wasnâ€™t quite ready yet (I wanted to treat myself so chose the Garden Cottage); the previous guests had just checked out, so I stored my luggage and walked around the neighborhood for a bit. The Toren is just a couple of blocks from the Anne Frank House; right on a quiet canal. Went back to the hotel after about an hour (also found a nice wine store close by), and the room was almost finished, so they suggested I wait in the lounge/bar; which I did. Ordered a beer, and about 15 minutes later they came by with my key and told me the room was ready. I tried to pay for the beer, but they had â€˜compedâ€™ it as a little apology; very nice. The cottage was in the garden and very private, yet just 15 steps to the hotel. The room had a nice-sized sitting area with a monitor and wireless keyboard which came in handy to catch up on e-mails (after a 3-week trip previously). The bed was large and very comfortable. There was also a large 2-person Jacuzzi with power jets and large walk-in shower. What struck me most about the Toren was the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. It came as a (welcomed) surprise. I had grown accustomed to the â€˜matter-of-factâ€™ and dour exchange with staff at other hotels in Amsterdam (Marriott, the Victoria, NH Carlton). The honest friendliness of the entire staff at the Toren would put all the others to shame. My next trip to Amsterdam will be spent at the Toren for this fact.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff couldn't have been more helpful - great hotel”
Reviews.Author: demobiles
Reviews.Content: This hotel deserves all the positive reviews here on Tripadvisor. Nothing negative to report - I will definitely put The Toren at the top of our list for our next visit to Amsterdam. Excellent staff, great location, really comfortable beds in beautiful rooms, no noise from trams, traffic or nightlife and excellent breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CandyJade
Reviews.Content: We have just returned home from a one night stay at the Toren. What can I say... I spent alot of time researching hotels in Amsterdam as my brother was coming to visit from Australia and wanted to stay somewhere 'nice'. The Toren was better than I could have imagined. On our arrival we were greeted by friendly staff , and then escorted to the building a few houses away where our room was located while being told some history and information about the hotel. We stayed in a triple room which was larger than I had expected, there was plenty of room for two large men and myself. The decor was beautiful and the room very clean. The bathroom was a little on the small side, but was not a problem for us. Breakfast was delicious, so much to choose from. Breakfast is served in the bar which is a very beautiful setting. A very pleasant experience and will be recommending The Toren to friends and family. We will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent midweek stay”
Reviews.Author: cjmhome
Reviews.Content: We went as a family for 4 nights at the Toren - a family group including two teenage children and an almost octogenarian granny.We were anxious about the mix but the trip was a great success and much of the credit for that belongs to the astonishingly helpful staff. The rooms were excellent - breakfast was the best we had ever experienced in a hotel - and that was praise indeed from my brother who had come from Australia and is a frequent traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel - wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: LDW553
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner recently stayed at the Toren. We found the room to be of excellent quality, however the bed was a tad small and we had 2 single blankets as opposed to one large one between us. The service was top notch, the staff were so friendly and so helpful. Unfortunately we were situated right next to the courtyard so there was some outside noise which infiltrated and disrupted sleep at times. However this was not a common occurrence. There was a great coffee machine in the room as well as a spa bath. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone and would love to stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT hotel - very nice and romantic!”
Reviews.Author: Solfur
Reviews.Content: My husband surprised me with a trip to Amsterdam. We stayed at the Toren, and had a suite. What a great experience! We had a jacuzzi in our room. BIG bed, flowers (my husband ordered it.), fluffy bathrobes ... Interior was very trendy and elegant. We ordered breakfast to our room - and that was GREAT!!! We were totally overwhelmed. Great location. Would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone going to Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel, amazing service - average room”
Reviews.Author: decarabas
Reviews.Content: The hotel is amazing. Two really beautiful houses, in front of a canal, close to the Centraal train station, Anne Frank House, the Dam... The service was also perfect, from the girls in the reception to the waiters. On my first day, there was a small confusion at breakfast. Despite it being my fault (gave a wrong room number, one that didn't even exist), they wouldn't stop apologising throughout my stay. The one minus point in this hotel is the size of the room. It's likely because of its use of the original, old houses, but still it felt quite cramped, and I was alone in a double room. Nonetheless the Toren will be my first choice whenever I return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Charming boutique hotel in converted canal-side mansion with amazing service and great location”
Reviews.Author: ErnieWashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Toren for eight days in June. We arrived early in the morning and the hotel offered us a complementary breakfast to welcome us. The breakfast buffet is fabulous. The hotel also presented us with fresh strawberries and chocolates in the room on our arrival. The warm welcome and geneorus hospitality was typical of the lovely treatment we received. Our room was large and overlooked the canal in front of the hotel. The area is very quiet, but only a five minute walk from the Dam. It is just around the corner from the Anne Frank house. the hotel is very au courant, and recommends the best new restuarants. They also recommended a great running itinerary and nearby swimming pool, and were helpful in getting tram tickets, dinner reservations, and tourism advice. Our visit combined buisness (conference) and vacation. Recommend the hotel highly for both purposes. Couldn't imagine a better place to stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “WOW i want to go back NOW!”
Reviews.Author: ezmee
Reviews.Content: Wow I had looked at the photos and read the review but this hotel surpassed my wildest dreams......My partner had no idea where I had booked and he was blown away......we loved the chandelier in the bar! We also loved the fabulously attentive staff who were always there if u needed them but incredibly unobtrusive if you didnt. We had a special deluxe room with a 2 person jacuzzi - oh my god - that WAS amazing. I just can't fault the place, the room service was swift and prompt and the bed was so comfortable I struggled to get out of it. The raindance shower was great and it was just an awesome hotel in a really cool city. They had even left strawberries and chocolates as a welcome suprise gift in the room, plus all rooms have a Nespresso machine. We didnt get to have breakfast but it all looked very chic and next time, we will make it down to breakfast! Ignore all the reviews that say its too dark, or not worth the money, or not to everyones taste. If you have any sense of style, service, and want to have a fabulous time at a wonderful hotel then GO HERE

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel, Unbelievable Staff!”
Reviews.Author: csg
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I spent three nights at the Toren to start our European vacation. I think this is quite possibly the best hotel experience we have ever had. The reception staff came outside to assist the taxi driver with our luggage when we first arrived. Our room was not ready so we were invited to enjoy a drink in the bar while our room was prepared. A young man then came shortly to take us to our room and explained the history of the beautiful building as he escorted us. The hotel is in a building built in 1605 with 38 rooms. Even though the building is old, there is none of that "old building" smell you sometimes encounter in old hotels. The room was beautiful with a marble bath, and the bed linens were very elegant. The room was quiet - we were never bothered by staff or other guests. And the staff was fabulous. Everyone there from reception to restaurant/bar staff just couldn't do enough for us. We came back one night after 10pm, not having had dinner and they prepared sandwiches and dessert for us. When needing to make reservations for our train to Paris, Melany handled it by phone. When finding out that there were none available (and we had a room booked in Paris), she worked for 45 minutes by phone to get us what we needed. No request was too much for Melany and Priscilla, who both worked the reception area. The hotel is located in a nice area - away from the seedier parts of Amsterdam. It is just around the corner from the Ann Franck House, and close to transportation to other parts of the city. If I travel to Amsterdam again, I will definitely book this hotel. It really was remarkable!

Reviews.Title: “friendly helpful staff and beautiful relaxing rooms overall a great experience”
Reviews.Author: jane186364
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay at the Toren the hotel is lovely and staff very helpful. Lovely rooms and a great breakfast .Perfect place to stay in such a lovely city

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: DavidJonathan
Reviews.Content: The Toren is a conversion of two old houses on the Keisersgracht, one of the three main canals of Amsterdam, and is ideally situated, being on the edge of the Jordaan district with its many interesting shops and restaurants. The decor is beautiful, if maybe a little Gothic for some tastes.The staff are charming and couldn't be more helpful. The breakfast buffet is wonderful - varied and fresh, with everything a mortal could want to eat. The room was small (but I did book the cheapest one) and a bit on the warm side even with air - conditioning, but the bed was the most comfortable I've ever slept in, and It had its own espresso machine. All in all this is a lovely hotel and I would definitely choose it again if I return to Amsterdam. .

Reviews.Title: “Indulge in luxury”
Reviews.Author: jwvdkamp
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Jan2010 for 2 nights. Easy scoring for Amsterdam because of the wonderful snow and iceskating on the canals. Coming to The Toren....beautiful entrance, nice receptionstaff and then we were taken to our room (in the other building), the door opens and the only right word was: wow! Beautiful! Very good bed, so nice decorated, a jacuzzi, canalview, good tv....Great to have a Nespresso machine. In mainbuilding is a nice bar. Didnt have breakfast, thought that this was a bit expensive but for the rest: no regrets at all for staying here! An experience to be experienced again.

Reviews.Title: “Sparkling chandliers and champagne”
Reviews.Author: fairyflan
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to say thank you to the Toren for helping us celebrate our 30th Wedding Anniversay in style. The staff are very helpful, very charming, pleasant and welcoming. The breakfast was superb value for money, the beds make you feel you are sleeing on a cloud and the rooms romantic, dramatic and theatrical. We had a wonderful time. The Hotel is ideally situated within a pleasant walking distance from Dam Square and surrounded by pretty streets. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful, artsy, inviting hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Nosnom
Reviews.Content: "Theatrical" is probably a good way to describe the interior. Pros: Really interesting and beautiful decor. It is on one of the prettiest streets in Amsterdam. Great location for access to the central part of town, but removed enough to be in a quiet neighborhood. Very friendly and helpful staff. The bed and linens were VERY nice. Cons: A modern & clean, but poorly designed bathroom. No way to shower without getting the whole bathroom wet. The natural light in the room was good, but after dark, the room was very dimly lit. There was not enough light to read once the sun went down. Wonderful bed, but the pillows were like rocks.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in fantastic location with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Tim_Donna
Reviews.Content: Helpful staff arranged 2 adjacent rooms for family of 4. Although smallish rooms the decor is fantastic and the rooms are clean and beds comfortable. Bathrooms well designed for space and modern. The position means the main areas of central Amsterdam are easy to access, with Anne Franks museum just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Best service I have ever received! Will definitely prefer this hotel over other (5 star) hotels I have stayed.”
Reviews.Author: Victoria_Ag
Reviews.Content: I have stayed a lot in hotels in Amsterdam and this is definitely one of the best! Great service, extremely helpful stuff! The hotel decoration was in a Gothic style, very comfortable and clean.We had a nice view from the window, jacuzzi and a coffee machine in the room. will definitely prefer this hotel over other (5 star) hotels I have stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Just Lovely”
Reviews.Author: mylesrn
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just perfect! From the moment we checked on April 14, 2010 to when we checked out on April 18, 2010 the staff was most accommodating. Although we arrived a little early our room was ready within a few minutes. We took the time to sit in the lounge/restaurant area, which was very inviting. There was so much attention paid to detail of the decor. The staff showed us to our room and bags were delivered in minutes. The extra that we paid for the canal view was worth it. We were able to open our windows and enjoy the fresh crisp air as well as the great view. We were within walking distance of many restaurants and tourist sights. Our room was not big, but just enough for a romantic getaway. All of the staff members were professional and get an A+ for customer service, especially since we had to extend our stay due to the volcanic ash! We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfuly romantic!”
Reviews.Author: Cloggirl
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at The Toren hotel. Both times were wonderful, it is a great hotel for a romantic get-away! This time we spashed out and got the deluxe room with double jacuzzi bath and garden view. We were a bit early so our room wasn't ready when we arrived, but the girl at reception offered us a free drink while we waited. Our room was in a different building, down the street, but that wasn't a problem as reception took care of our bags. The hotel next to the second Toren building is being totally renovated so I was worried that it would be noisy in our room, but as is was in the back we hardly heard a thing. The room was BEAUTIFUL! Very big with a huge bed and great Jacuzzi. A warning though....10 mins after the Jacuzzi is emptied it makes a bit of noise for a few mins (I think that it has fans that dry all the excess water....very state of the art!). The staff are wonderful. They really do everything to make your stay special. Everyone is bi or tri-lingual. I heard one waiter switch between Dutch, English and Spanish. Breakfast is delicious. Everything is very fresh and the breakfast room never seems overly busy. The chef also makes eggs to order, very good omletes! This is the best hotel I have ever stayed at, I really love it and would reccomened it to couples who are looking for a romatic get-away!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Bunnydots
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely boutique hotel located in a quiet neighborhood on a canal very near the Anne Frank House. It is a bit of a trek from the train station to get to this hotel, compared with the many others very near, but I would stay here again. My canal view room was lovely, the bathroom was elegant and clean with a very deep jacuzzi and I loved the in-room espresso machine, big comfy bed and luxury bath products. The staff was generally friendly and helpful except that there didn't seem to be a good way to get bags up the front stairs to the hotel except under my own power - I didn't see a ramp or anyone to help with the bags outside. (There is a bellboy and an elevator when you get yourself into reception.) When I was trying to drag my bag up the front steps into the hotel a maid who had been sitting outside got up and went in ahead of me - I though she would hold the door but she just let it close in my face! Thankfully that was an atypical experience and everyone else from bellboy to bartender was very kind and helpful. Aside from that, the only other minuses were that the plug for the tub did not work right and had to be pried out of its hole after each bath, and my room also had a very slight musty smell so I kept the window open most of the time and enjoyed the nice weather. But overall I thought it was a very nice European boutique hotel and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pictures look better than the real thing”
Reviews.Author: AmeliaRush
Reviews.Content: cool but not cool enough (or clean enough) for these prices.

Reviews.Title: “The Ultimate Boutique hotel in Amsterdam !”
Reviews.Author: MikeV_Wolverine
Reviews.Content: Had a splendid time at the Toren, once more. The whole personnel (front desk, barmen, luggage handlers) deserve a triple AAA rating, This is the type of place where serenity, discretion & efficient service get a whole new meaning. Can't thank enough the lady from Management who called me back and found a solution to get me a room matching my requirements - the suites and jacuzzi rooms were all booked on that week end for some reason but she still figured something out. I've tried quite a few 5+ starred hotels across the board - on business or leisure - and I have to say the Toren for me ranks in my top 5 - worldwide.

Reviews.Title: “The Wonderful Toren”
Reviews.Author: IanWales
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our 4th visit to this fantastic Amsterdam hotel. Have been visiting Amserdam for many, many years and never found an hotel worth a return visit. Then we found The Toren! This place is warm and welcoming, comfortable, smart, clean and cosy. In a super location which is peaceful yet ideal for getting to the best places to visit and eat. The decor is 'exciting' and wonderfully OTT. We have stayed in the Garden Cottage (a detached property in the garden at the rear of the Hotel), room 222 and room 227 - we have found each of these a real treat - with superb facilities. The owners and their team could not be more friendly and efficient - this really is the only place to stay whilst in Amsterdam. Thank you so much. Ian and Alan

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and very friendly hotel in central Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: tourist2122
Reviews.Content: The Toren hotel is a gorgeous boutique hotel right in the centre of Amsterdam. The staff were so friendly and couldn't do enough to make us comfortable and my 2 year old daughter was treated like a princess. The decor is very elaborate and theatrical and the garden is very stylish too. There is a generous and varied breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Location, Fantastic Decor.”
Reviews.Author: westwing2
Reviews.Content: We partly chose this hotel thanks to the Trip Advisor reviews and it was everything that i had hoped for. I loved the decor, it was plush, opulent and original. On arrival and during the whole stay the staff couldn't have been nicer and all staff whether in the reception or the restaurant were consistently polite and cheerful. Our room was comfortable and nicely decorated with a lovely view over the canal and the location was quiet however within easy walking distance to Damm Square and the numerous restaurants and bars throughout the whole area. Breakfast was good with a variety of hot food consisting of scrambled egg, bacon, mushrooms etc and a nice range of continental breakfast and very good coffee, we didn't have an evening meal there purely because there was too much choice throughout the city. I was satisfied that the price we paid for the hotel for the duration of our stay was well worth it and i would undoubtedly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, romantic, cosy hotel in a great position.”
Reviews.Author: bumbledore
Reviews.Content: We recently had our first night away without the kids and booked a night in Amsterdam at The Toren. The staff kindly upgraded us to the garden cottage which was cosy and romantic with a relaxing jacuzzi and had the best bed ever. Staff were really helpful and friendly and around if you needed them. The hotel was in a good position with everything pretty walkable. We would definitely recommend this hotel and will be going back ourselves in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Berlin833
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, for my trip I used: www.timeinamsterdam.com A really convenient site with a lot of information, and so I booked this hotel. Great hotel in a great neighbor and itâ€™s so authentic. I really enjoyed my trip to Amsterdam due to the staff and the whole hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: K-Man62
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 consecutive weeks on business but managed to include a weekend with my girlfriend as well. Having travelled the world and stayed in many hotels, I can honestly say that this hotel has to rank as one of the best in my opinion. Its location is peaceful yet within easy reach of both Centraal Station or Dam Square. The hotel has a fantastic presentation about it, the decor, the quality and the style. This is very aptly complimented by the most friendly service I have ever received. All the staff I came across had a smile and were more than willing to assist in any and every matter possible. I stayed in a variety of rooms from a single to the one with the in-room jacuzzi and I believe that there is one to suit all budgets, tastes and requirements. Each and every room, no matter what style. perfectly presented and clean. The breakfasts are awesome with a huge array of foods including breads, croissant, smoked salmon, full English, cheeses, meats, fruit, yogurt, to name but some of the delights. The bar is beautiful with its gorgeous open fire and if you catch the right evening one of the barmen cab make fantastic cocktails, but then he is renowned for them. All I can say is go and experience the wonders of the Toren.

Reviews.Title: “Sumptuous, beautiful hotel...a magical experience”
Reviews.Author: Molololo
Reviews.Content: We arrived in a blizzard and were immediately checked in and looked after by extremely polite and friendly staff. They really were an asset to the place, which is in itself perfectly located for all main Amsterdam activities, beautifully decorated and warm and cozy. The canal view from our window was lovely. While the hotel doesn't exactly have a restaurant, it does take orders from Christophe, a Michelin-starred restaurant round the corner. We ordered from their menu and dined in the beautiful bar - the meal was excellent and the service impeccable. I can sort of understand people who find the hotel a bit over-the-top on the decor front, but it's definitely to my tastes - not dissimilar to the Crazy Bear in Stadhampton or Beaconsfield...very sexy at any rate. Would love to return.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Beautiful; great location”
Reviews.Author: JulzE
Reviews.Content: This little hotel is in the canal district. Location is great being a short walk to Dam square across three pretty bridges. There are some small cafes nearby and you can get some snacks in the hotel bar. The hotel staff are very sweet and helpful and the bartender assures me he is a multi-award winning world champion cocktail maker. I didn't put him to the test. My (triple) room was in the annex and had the most stunning opulent red and black decor; I felt like a queen. The bathroom was the nicest ever. Book me again.

Reviews.Title: “One of a kind hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: JeroenStruyk
Reviews.Content: A 'last minute' decision to go to Amsterdam made us book Hotel The Toren and taking the train to our capital. The special offer (EUR 190.00) for the room was far below the rack-rate (EUR 550.00 !) but still this was one of the most expensive rooms we have ever stayed in. The hotel is decorated in a style which you can call 'rich & flamboyant', lots of black, red & gold. We arrived around 15.00 hours and the friendly staff informed us that the room would be ready in 5 minutes and we were offered coffee in the bar. After 30 minutes we felt a little forgotten, and after asking again we were taken to the room by a friendly receptionist. Our room was in the same style, lots of mirrors, red carpet, dark walls, jacuzzi in the middle of the room with colored lights, lots of pillows on the bed. Next to the bed there was a I-pod player & a Nespresso Coffee maker. The room was quiet with a nice view to the back of the hotel (gardens). Breakfast was excellent, all was there unlimited and if you had any special wishes the breakfast chef would help you. The breakfast was not included in the room price, it was EUR 12.00 per person which was not much for such a good breakfast. We enjoyed our stay in Hotel The Toren in Amsterdam, the hotel is located in the middle of the centre of Amsterdam close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Sexy, great neighborhood, wonderful staff... did I mention the bathtub?”
Reviews.Author: magickgirl1
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Toren. We splurged on the jacuzzi tub and did not regret it for an instant. Total blast. Buy some champagne and enjoy! We also loved the location- right in the western canal ring, close to a ton of great bars, cafes, and restaurants, and the prettiest stretches of the city, if you ask me. Don't even bother with the red light district- all you could want is right around here. The staff was very helpful when our flight was cancelled, calling airlines for us, and letting us use their phone lines! Our only complaint is that the internet is not free- boo.

Reviews.Title: “Richly romantic with fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: cwithp
Reviews.Content: We arrived early Sunday evening in the rain. The hotel,especially the bar are fabulously decorated for a romantic evening. We decided to stay in the hotel bar for cocktails. The bartender was excellent and friendly. We asked for his recommendations for a restaurant that he would eat at. It was a fabulous local place. The location is lovely, quiet but not far from anything. The rooms are small but typical for Europe. We had a short but wonderful stay and we look forward to returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: BaktoBak
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Toren with a group of colleagues from 5th to 6th November. It was absolutely perfect. The staff was friendly and very competent, the meeting room was great and we enjoyed every moment of the stay. I already look forward to come back...

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointing....”
Reviews.Author: Gillybergy
Reviews.Content: Spent four days here in August for my Dutch husband's birthday. It certainly lived up to the photographs shown on Trip Adviser, but somehow fell very short of the mark in every other respect. We have stayed in some very exclusive hotels all over Europe, but felt this was very over priced and over rated for what it offered.

Reviews.Title: “Charm and Quality Service”
Reviews.Author: TSVLondon
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at this hotel. We were upgraded to a deluxe room upon arrival. Chocolates and strawberries were waiting in our room that overlooked the canal. Throughout our stay, the staff at The Toren were extremely helpful and friendly. The breakfasts were great value for money and the coffee they serve in the lounge is divine (I also overheard another customer compliment the coffee whilst i was relaxing in the lounge). Although the weather was poor during our stay, The Toren is full of charm and perfect for a relaxing and romantic getaway. Anne Frank's house is also just a stones throw away and well worth a visit. Looking forward to our next trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “just perfect”
Reviews.Author: Topcruiser
Reviews.Content: The Toren is nicely located on a canal. I went on hotel.nl and could get a nice single room at 100 eur/night. It worked perfectly for me with parking space in front of the hotel and charming staff that make you feel someone special. Small room but nicely decorated, quiet and perfect for a one night stay. The bed was really comfortable and you have a nespresso machine to get you the best morning cofee you can dream of. I'll get back there tomorrow for another one night business trip! and might stay in a double room for the coming week end!

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: HupHoegaarden
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful staff. The breakfast was amazing for the price charged. The rooms are big and very cosy furnished. The hotel has a very good location nearby the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “The Toren was perfect for our Amsterdam stay”
Reviews.Author: narnialady
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went on a European vacation in October and our first stop was Amsterdam. We couldn't not have chosen a better place than The Toren. The location was great, easy to get to by city train and within walking distance from the drop off (and we had heavy bags - no problem). Robert was fabulous. We really enjoyed talking to him and listening to the history of Amsterdam and the local hot spots. He gave great recommendations for places to eat (Luwtze and Top Thai) and was very patient with our American naivete. The hotel staff was extremely courteous and helpful. The breakfast buffet every morning was perfect. Almost too much to choose from. The only negative thing I have to say is that the rooms are smaller than I imagined. Pretty tight squeeze, but the ambiance and charm of the hotel make up for it. I definitely think the canal view is worth the little bit of extra cost. We spent a lot of time with the window open looking out over the canal in the morning and again at night.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Enough”
Reviews.Author: GoGirlToo
Reviews.Content: The pros: terrific location, helpful & competent staff, comfortable beds & baths, wonderful & extensive breakfast at a reasonable charge. The cons: not my idea of an effective interior decorating job -- all red & black and quite dark -- not for the claustrophobic. I guess it's trendy. Still, the location's so good, and the rooms are perfectly comfortable ... if you get a good rate, you'll probably be very happy here.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing customer service”
Reviews.Author: katylevin
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely small hotel in a wonderful area of town. Our room albiet small was cozy and romantic. The bed was so comfortable with lovely linens. The nespresso machine with all those delish coffees was a real treat. There was some construction in the neighborhood, and a bit of noise due to a jackhammer, but that is to be in a very old city. When we had a small problem, the staff was professional, quick and accomodating, even going so far as to take 50% off our nights stay. I am not sure if they have larger rooms, as this would be quite tight for more than a couple of days. The carpet could use a shampoo, but that would be our only complaint., and my husband hit his head on the chandelier a few times, but I would never take that out of the room, as it makes the room so pretty. Thank You Hotel Toren.

Reviews.Title: “Plush and Romantic”
Reviews.Author: Babydoll_Nexa
Reviews.Content: We went to Amsterdam for a weekend break and it was our amazing luck to find out then that it was the Gay Pride Weekend. After a long research of hotels, we have decided on this one and got a really good deal directly with the hotel. We booked it immediately knowing that the little city will be packed with tourists from all over for that weekend. When we arrived here, we instantly loved it! It's location is perfect. About 10-15 minutes walking distance to the center. The breakfast here was soo good and the decor in this little boutique hotel was so exquisite, detailed and just lovely! The reception staff were so accommodating and helpful and our room was very cozy, plush and romantic. The toiletries were even from Rituals! Such lovely smells! We highly recommend this hidden jewel in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Comfy beds, good location but no real concierge service”
Reviews.Author: MM90402
Reviews.Content: The good: Super comfy beds and pillows, which was a welcome surprise after our long flight from the states. Pretty rooms. Location was convenient to most of the city attractions yet still felt safe. The not so good: We booked a special rate through the hotel website and got shuttled off into an annex of the hotel about 5 brownstones down. Room was very tiny, even by European standards. Also, it was like pulling teeth to get any kind of recommendation for activities or food (other than the same pre-printed list they pulled out every single time you asked for a recommendation). We didn't have a restaurants book so, after a few disgusting burgers, we ended up finding an American bookstore to get a book. WiFi was absurdly expensive (something like 20 or 25 euro per 24 day) so I popped in the Bagel And Beans Coffee shop whenever I saw one because its free there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: SteBr
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Amsterdam with a friend, and was originally going to stay in budget accommodation. My friend didn't fancy this and searched online and found the Toren. It was worth the extra cost. It's in an excellent location and all the main sights and attractions are really easy to get to, from Anne Franks house to the Red Light District. The staff were very accomodating, polite and friendly. Nothing was too much trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Great room with a view and an air conditioner that works.”
Reviews.Author: ScottHouston_tx
Reviews.Content: We loved our room (especially when compared to other European hotels that we've had in the past). Roomy, a good view of the canal, great location, working AC, clean, good and free breakfast. No free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Such a charming hotel...”
Reviews.Author: CinthiaMRiodeJaneiro
Reviews.Content: Very well located,nice staff,an excellent room with a magic Jacuzzi and an expresso machine for coffee and tea at any time.The breakfast was the best in all Europe....

Reviews.Title: “Good, but some issues”
Reviews.Author: dshep25
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Toren for 3 nights. On the plus side, the location is perfect -- the neighborhood was in a quieter part of town and less overrun with day-tripping tourists. Our room faced the canal, which is was pretty and quiet. The staff are very friendly and amicable and spoke excellent English (as did nearly everyone we met while in Amsterdam). The hotel/room decor is an upgrade from your larger hotel chains. On the down side, the hotel room and decor were "trying too hard" and were already showing signs of wear & tear. The bathroom, while spacious by European standards, was not as clean as I would have liked and there was mold in the shower grout (that I could detect without my contacts in!). When trying to look for excursions and activities, the front desk staff was not very knowlegable and could only recommend very toursity activities that were part of organized tours, even though we asked for independent stuff. Also, there was a daily charge for internet that was very expensive. In general, we enjoyed our stay, but felt that it was overpriced given the problems we encountered. I'd recommend to a friend, but would want them to know what they were getting into first.

Reviews.Title: “The Toren , a great experience”
Reviews.Author: meertje
Reviews.Content: The Toren is a very luxury , guest free hotel in the middle of Amsterdam. All the main spots are in walking distance. We went there with our small boat , and it was no problem to lay the boat near the Hotel. Our room was very luxury and nice , and the staff was very friendly. The service was great. We felt very welcome. I would surely recommend this hotel to my friends. I do want to come back here when I can. Kind Regards , Merel van den Burg

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: alisi2704
Reviews.Content: The Toren is a unique design hotel with a lot of focus on the little things. It has beautiful unique furniture and a great modern bathroom. It is well equipped with everything you need (I especially liked the "Rituals" Body Lotion with Cherry Cent and the radio where it was possible to connect an Ipod). It is tidy and very classy. It's perfectly situated in the beautiful central neighbourhood of Keizersgracht. They say "Designed to charm" on their homepage - a true experience.

Reviews.Title: “Super stay! Great service and location.”
Reviews.Author: fredhowlett
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel experience. Our family stayed for 4 nights. The location is great, facing on to the canal and close to all the city center attractions. The hotel is strikingly furnished - making the most of the slightly cramped townhouse space. The rooms are nicely appointed and neatly designed - the jacuzzi in one of our rooms was a big hit. The breakfast area and the breakfast itself are particularly delightful. Best of all the service was just great: friendly, informal, witty, unobtrusive but always ready to help. They certailnly helped us to feel at home in a new city and to make the most of our time. Every member of our family enjoyed themselves - and that is special!

Reviews.Title: “excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelpats
Reviews.Content: Eric and Petra Toren should give lessons on how to manage a hotel! We stayed for two nights in August and have already reserved for our next passage through Amsterdam. I was a little afraid of getting a triple room (we travel with our 5 yerar-old son) in the city, as I know space is uslally limited, but this room was large and inviting, with a gorgous view of the canal. That had me thinking about the noise, but my worries were completely unfounded. At first I thought it was only because the street was quiet, but one day saw a group pf people talking and laughing just a few feet away, almost directly under the window, and the noise was barely perceptible. It's still within less than 5 minutes' walk from the hustle and bustle, and has two different canal tour stops within a block of the front door. Extremely comfortable beds, a powerful shower, great toiletries in generous quantities, an assortment of teas and Nespressos in the room, very friendly staff, and one of the best hotel breakfasts I have ever seen, what is there to complain about? Oh, by the way - the breakfast room/bar should be a tourist attraction in its own right! In addition, I have remained in contact with the hotel, and can say that every contact with them has been a pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at the Toren was wonderful, a kind and helpful staff, very welcoming to first time visitors in the city”
Reviews.Author: willbarks
Reviews.Content: The Toren is a great small hotel, elegant in design and professionally run by staff who make you feel at home away from home. This was our first visit to Amsterdam and we wanted a location close to the Anne Frank House and the Westerkirk as well as convenient to other sights and sounds of the city. Location for us was perfect. Amsterdam is such a beautiful and interesting city and our 4 day stay there was only too short. But the service and kindness of the Toren's staff made such a difference to us in being able to navigate to different venues in the area and around the city. Especially appreciated was the kindness of staff when my wife sprained her ankle during one of the museum visits, providing ice and pointing us to medical assistance and nearby pharmacies (Apothek) as needed. The Toren's elevator (lift) was especially appreciated (rare for for small hotels here) at that point.
