If you visit Amsterdam, do consider the Toren as your home base to see the city...you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: WillibrordGroningen
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff. Extraordinary special setting. Excellent breakfast in a perfect atmosphere. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: kristina925m
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Toren last month for two nights. We highly recommend it. My top priority is a comfy bed . . .which the Toren has! Of course the bathroom was small, but perfectly fine. The bedroom itself was actually bigger than I expected. Fun decor gave it a cosy, comfortable feel. The staff was very helpful and kind. We especially enjoyed Jimmy--not sure of spelling-- (pronounced "yeemy), the bartender. He had quite a few bartending adventures to share and makes fantastic cocktails. I wouldn't get the breakfast there, though. It was 15 EU...good food, but very expensive! Overall we had a great stay at the Toren and would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “High Class, Wonderful Staff and Perfect Location! Kicking off the Honeymoon at the Toren...”
Reviews.Author: dmeeker
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent almost three weeks in Europe for our honeymoon. We decided to book through a travel agent (who was excellent), and she had us stay at the Toren in Amsterdam, our first city of the trip. We arrived at the Toren early in the morning, because our flight came in at 7 am. Our room was not ready, but we expected that to be the case. To pass time, we decided to explore Amsterdam, and immediately, the front desk staff were helping us get our bearings, making suggestions and really making us feel comfortable in the city. The hotel's location is perfect. It is on a nice, mellow canal, but just a few blocks from the hustle and bustle of city center. It is walking distance from everything, and close to many private homes, with niche restaurants, cafes, boutiques, and local flavor peppered throughout the neighborhood. When we returned to the Toren, we were offered a drink before heading to our room. The bar in the hotel, along with the sitting/dining room is really well designed. It is a perfect mix of old world (as in castle) furniture with a fresh, modern feeling. I can't say enough about the friendliness of the people that worked at the hotel. Anyway, they had us follow the bellman to our room, and it was way, way, way better than we could have ever anticipated. It was probably the most unique and relaxing hotel rooms I've ever stayed in. With direct access to the courtyard, our room was fully loaded with a huge bed with a ton of soft and fluffy pillows, a giant jacuzzi tub, high-tech steam shower, cappuccino/espresso machine, flat-screen tvs, and even a bottle of champagne and some other goodies. It was the perfect environment for us to relax, unwind and retire to after explorations in such a neat and unique city. The question I always ask myself after exploring a new city or place: "Will I go back?" I can say that the comfort offered by this boutique hotel, the helpfulness and friendliness of the staff, location and overall experience of staying at this place added a ton of value to our trip and helped to make Amsterdam stand out in my head as one of the most friendly, fun and interesting cities in the world. Will I go back? Absolutely! I would recommend anyone traveling to Amsterdam to spend their nights at the Toren Hotel. I've found "my spot" for sure. Highly recommended for an upscale, non-snooty, warm, comfortable and laid back place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “For business travellers who crave a little personal service in their hotel accomodations”
Reviews.Author: AskLG
Reviews.Content: As a business traveler I truly appreciate a hotel like The Toren. Having stayed in everything from big hotel chains to trendy design hotels it's amazing how few hotels manage to deliver the kind of service which make life on a road that little bit easier. The Toren gets it right every time though; from the consistently welcoming service (it truly is a place "where everyone knows your name"), to sorting out anything you might need (continental plugs, sushi craving sorted and delivered to your room or bar, last minute meeting room required for an all-day workshop for 10 people, cash back, etc.). It must be said though, that if you are looking for a bland and beige, blank canvas-type of hotel then this place is not for you. But for me, it's a relief to stay somewhere with a little personality, somewhere I can happily recommend to my friends and colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: philb59
Reviews.Content: Where do I start to explain how we feel about the Hotel Toren, My husband and myself have been going to the hotel for the last 8 yrs we have stopped in Feb, Easter, and June. every-time has been fantastic. great location. great food . great atmosphere, great staff. great owners, lovely bedrooms lovely garden to relax in. near all local attractions,and close to the Jordan where you will find Anna Frank house. great places to eat right on your doorstep.would fully recommend. we love this hotel very-much and would not stop anywhere else in Amsterdam. we will be back for the 9Th year next year can't wait. Phil and Kay staffordshire England.

Reviews.Title: “Good old fashioned service and hospitality”
Reviews.Author: matthepburn
Reviews.Content: I booked my parents into my local hotel in Amsterdam which I use frequently for my business guests. They were both delighted with the welcome and level of service, which is especially important as my father has mobility difficulties. The staff at the Toren made them feel very comfortable and even arranged a wheelchair for my father. The Toren overlooks the Keizersgracht so is both quiet and central. I will continue to direct my friends, family and business guests there.

Reviews.Title: “Not our kind of Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: thegourmandcouple
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Toren in mid-June 2009. The entire hotel seems to have been designed to evoke a feeling of being in a hipper-than-thou lounge bar or nightclub. Right from walking into the little lobby, it is all dark velvet drapes, scarlet and purple wallpaper, black desks and chandeliers, and a general feeling of deliberately hip gloominess. We absolutely hated it. Our room in the annex to the hotel [the hotel is split into two buildings, 164 and 146 Keizersgracht] smelt musty and the bed linens did not feel fresh. The carpets are thick pile, the duvets on the bed are thick velvet in black and red, and both of them felt dusty and a bit dirty. There was a black chandelier right above the bed, giving a very dungeon-like atmosphere. The bathroom was adequate, with a powerful shower, and the toiletries by Rituals were excellent. The hotel staff was friendly enough and we received prompt and cheerful help with our bags and at checkout. We have no complaints about the staff or the amenities of the hotel. In fact, the location was fantastic with an excellent Thai restaurant just around the corner. We just absolutely despised the decor, and as this hotel ages [some signs of aging are already visible], it is not going to be a graceful proceess.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: kaley1kt
Reviews.Content: Overall, I LOVED this hotel! I stayed in the Annex, which is about half block from the main building. I had a double room for 2 days, then a single for the remainder of my stay. Overall, VERY impressed. The first single I was in was not the best location (right next to the elevator) and therefore noisy, but I was able to move to a different room without issue. The rooms are very comfortable, and the single rooms are large by European standards with oversize single beds. I would recommend earplugs as the building is very old, so sound does tend to travel through the floors. The rooms are also clean, have an espresso machine in each room, and also have internet available for a small fee. The rooms are a bit dark, but not bad - it is really relaxing. Be aware that there are no elevators (at least not in the Annex), and the stairs are narrow given the building style. The location can not be beat - 5 minute walk to the Anne Frank House, and 10 minute walk to Dam Square, Centraal Station and Royal Palace. Very easy to get a tram to anywhere you want to go within a 5 minute walk. The hotel is on a quaint canal, and the area is not noisy like the hotels on Dam square. The restaurants close by are more upscale, but I was able to find nice neighborhood restaurants in a 5 minute walk. Staff is incredible - very accomodating, polite and knowledeable. I did not try the restaurant while I was a guest, but it looked very inviting.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, great service!”
Reviews.Author: slvc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Toren for 3 nights in early May. It was our first trip to Amsterdam and we couldn't have picked a better place to stay. Our room was small (very typical European size) by American standard but clean, cozy and elegantly decorated. The location was wonderful, away from the urban grittiness of being in the city centre but close enough to walk to all the touristy sites. Many wonderful cafes, restaurant and shops nearby. Staff was extremely helpful in getting us museum tickets, restaurant reservations, cabs, etc. Definitely will recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Acclimate”
Reviews.Author: IowaGrandparents
Reviews.Content: Arriving from North America at 6:00 AM can be disorientating. However, the Hotel Toren helped tremendously make our transition to Holland a pleasant one. We arrived at the hotel about 8:00 AM and they were more than gracious, offering us breakfast, restroom facilities, storage for our luggage, and travel hints for the day. When we returned in the afternoon to complete our check in, they offered us several choices including an upgrade to a junior suite. Everyone was helpful and they suggested a marvelous restaurant (De Tour) for our dinner. I had stayed there last about 20 years ago when the hotel was just beginning its upgrade. The progress has been stunning although the price increase has accompanied the upgrade in facilities. There could not be a better location or a more welcoming environment for a first day or two in the Netherlands. And, indeed, not only is it convenient to trams, canal boats, and museums, it can be reached by an easy ten minute walk from the Centraal Station. And be sure to note that it is literally on a canal. Everyone's picture of what Holland is like the Hotel Toren fulfills. Yes, the price is a bit steep but it is a "Dream of Holland" come true.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive staff.”
Reviews.Author: Ellemay
Reviews.Content: The Toren Hotel is located on the canal a brief stroll to Anne Franks House and approx 5 min walk into the Dam Square. The hotel is housed in a charming old building which sits proudly on the canal avenue. Check-in â€“ Fast, efficient and totally professional. Room â€“ On arrival we were disappointed with the small size of the room. We had large suitcases which just squeezed in making it very squashy. However, the room 223 was tastefully furnished but lacked natural light. In the middle of the room was a massive spa bath which sat next to the walk-in shower. Basically, we found the room too small. Coffee and tea facilities and internet connection were also supplied. Breakfast â€“ was served in the main sitting room which was sufficient with cooked eggs and pastries. Dinner was offered at Restaurant Christopher just around the corner from The Toren Hotel. There are a few good quality restaurants to be found around the area just ask the concierge for suggestions. Staff â€“ The best !! and a credit to this establishment. Nothing was a problem and at all times they were polite, gracious, cultured and ready to please. Overall â€“ a small intimate and romantic hotel with excellent staff, the hotel would certainly suit B&B lovers . We also enjoyed having evening drinks at the cosy warm bar. Apart from the size of the room we thought the hotel to offer a comfortable stay although itâ€™s a little pricey.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: AdrianFlorea
Reviews.Content: It was a very pleasant surprise that a pretty small hotel is offering you facilities that you won't find in well known hotels. After may stay to The Toren I have decided that I won't chose in the future for 4 or 5 * hotels with big names. It doesn't worth it. Hotels similar to The Torren are the best choise anytime.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous hotel with a great staff”
Reviews.Author: Arlenie
Reviews.Content: We had a terrific stay at The Toren. While the room was (European) small it was beautifully appointed with a nice bathroom. Bathtub was large and bubble baths were the order of the day after walk, walk, walking all over Amsterdam. Staff was excellent and had friendly suggestions of things to do and how to get there. Nespresso machine in the room was also a BIG HIT with us. Stephen in the bar was very funny and very accommodating. No constructive comments for improvement. Everything was wonderful. A little pricey by American standards but worth it! We will be going back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms not the largest but perfectly made.”
Reviews.Author: Taro33
Reviews.Content: Really good location with easy access to all cultural goodies. Just around the corner from Ann Frank's house (and the canal bus stop) . The staff were friendly, helpful and extremely efficient. The hotel is quirky as it is a canal house so the rooms are not enormous but perfectly adequate for a couple of nights stay. The rooms are beautifully presented and the coffee machine also makes tea ! We had breakfast in the room and there was enough to feed a family of four for a week ! It was not cheap, but worth every Euro. A lovely break in a lovely hotel - will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “This was such a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravel59
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right on one of the canals in a quiet area of the city, but you can comfortably walk to everything. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet was a bit pricey, but it was very good. The room was nicely decorated, but a bit small and there weren't any drawers to place clothing. The Nespresso machine in the room was a nice touch. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service & charming rooms!”
Reviews.Author: JLC24
Reviews.Content: We booked The Toren for our honeymoon given the great feedback from TripAdvisor. We were not disappointed as the hotel delivered as expected. It is very accessible by tram & a short walk from the tram stop. The rooms are very charming. And the owner gave us a room upgrade to the junior bridal suite which was the highlight of our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, comfortable and romantic”
Reviews.Author: AliceBush
Reviews.Content: The Toren hotel is wonderfully over the top in decor, a real antidote to minimalist style of many modern hotels. The room was beautifully decorated with chandaliers, gold mirrors, and all sorts of luxurious touches, including a huge double jacuzzi, coffee machine and ipod station. The staff were extremely helpful, friendly and polite. Breakfast was delicious and plentiful and the decor of the dining room was, again, plush, flamboyant and fabulous. The location of the hotel, a couple of minutes from the Ann Frank house, on a stunning canal with beautiful architecture was quiet, peaceful and yet very convenient. At night the the canal is lit up with twinkly lights and is very romantic and beautiful. There are lots of good restaurants within easy walking distance. We had a great time in Amsterdam and the Hotel Toren was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Friedyam
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Toren for a city trip in march and it was good from the start. Our room was upgraded to a deluxe room with a very nice and big Jacuzi. The room was not to big but was very nicely decorated with a luxurious bed. It is a very romantic place to spend your nights in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ElVikingo
Reviews.Content: We stayed over easter break. A great litte hotel in a quite location. The bed was comfy and the bathroom nice and clean. The mini bar in the room had decent prices, so you could enjoy at beer after walking town. The TV was nice and had a good choice of tv stations. The location was great, not too far away from things, yet far away from all the noise. Easy check in and check out, and the reception was nice and friendly. A nice place that we definitely will stay at next time we visit Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but you get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: CAT2222
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in the Toren and although we had a small room it looked out onto the houses behind the hotel and was very quiet. The service was excellent and the area was the best we saw in Amsterdam. There are very good local restaurants and you can walk to many of the main areas of the city. The breakfast was very good, but you have to pay extra for this. I would stay again if I go back.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service, Comfortable and Stylish Rooms”
Reviews.Author: haroonr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Toren on March 16-17, 2009. I had a Double Room with one large bed. The most significant thing about my stay was the service I experienced. When I checked-in to the time of my check-out, the staff was just incredible. At the night of my check-in, there was a gentleman (Peter) and a lady who gave me a very warm welcome and addressed me by name before I had a chance to state it myself; they were expecting me. My first ever visit to Netherlands thus started on a note of warm hospitality. What a great way to make a guest's introduction to one's country! Unfortunately, I had lost my travel bag on way to the hotel, on the street somewhere. The staff filed a report on my behalf to the tram service as well as the police. I didn't have to deal with any hassle. Kudos to their staff! The hotel has a feeling of grand decor on a smaller scale (size of rooms isn't too large). It is done with a lot of taste and all supplies are good. There is also a private locker for which the guest sets their own password. There is internet available for 8 Euros a day. My room was facing the garden at the back. The hotel is located on the route of the tram service and is very convenient. It is one block away from the famous Anne Frank house (now a Museum). I could hear the bell of the old church ring in the distance; the same bell that Anne used to hear as she recounted in the diary. There was an air of spiritual serenity to it and was a profound experience! The hotel's bar has a real fireplace and plush interior. It is very stylish. It is open until 1 at night. Even if you don't feel the urge to drink, just go and sit there late at night to reflect on the happenings of the day. It is very cozy. One tip to keep in mind: my room did have some smell of smoke from the previous guest. The valet bringing my luggage at check-in noticed that before I had to say anything and asked if I wanted to request front desk to change it. But I didn't mind. However, if someone is really allergic to smoke odor, they might like to request a non-smoking room and make a note of it during their reservation. All in all, a great time spend there. Very relaxing, warm, and friendly!

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RKH_Law
Reviews.Content: I first came across The Toren while searching the internet for hotels in Amsterdam in preparation for a long overdue holiday. On reviewing the photos on The Toren's site I was immediately taken by the combination of the elegance of the rooms and guest lounge and the modernity of the amenities offered. A map of Amsterdam suggested the hotel was fairly close to the rail station and other attractions so I booked a room with a double jacuzzi for three nights. On arriving in Amsterdam I discovered The Toren was about a 10 minute walk from the train station and within easy walking distance of all the major sites and attractions. The hotel is located along one of Amsterdam's canals, the exterior very well kept like the neighbouring buildings which provided a great selection of architectural types. Notwithstanding the central location, there was little traffic or noise. The lobby and guest lounge were immaculately clean with a feel of elegance. The staff were, without exception, very pleasant and helpful and appeared genuinely concerned with my comfort. Check-in was a breeze and I was soon ensconced in the the hotel's excellant lounge and bar, tended again by very helpful and friendly staff and supplied not only with some excellant Heineken but a very good selection of wine and champagne. My room was absolutely beautiful coloured in a striking black and red motif with a very comfortable king sized bed, all the usual amenities, a large jacuzzi and marble walk in shower. The Toren does not have a restaurant of its own although an excellant breakfast boasting a wide selection of hot and cold items, fruits, cereals etc. is available daily and the hotel does have an arrangement with, if memory serves, two or three local restaurants and limited room service is available. Anyway, after spending my first night in Amsterdam and enjoying The Toren's hospitality, I completely reorganized my holiday and extended my stay, in large part due to the hotel's comfort, a further 5 nights. The Toren is a first class hotel at less than first class prices and, in my view, worth every Euro. I am looking forward to my next stay. So, should you find yourself in Amsterdam needing a little pampering and comfort give The Toren a try.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: paris_1204
Reviews.Content: After looking at many reviews here and because the hotel offered some excellent low rates for our stay (more than 50% less) we decided to book The Toren. We loved the location which is just three tram stops from Centraal Station (Westermarkt stop) and the staff were all very patient, kind and welcoming. We were happy to have an overnight away from our terrible Paris hotel whose staff were so unwelcoming to us. The hotel is right around the corner from the Anne Frank House and is short (15 minutes) walking distance from the Dam Square, Red Light district, Kalverstraat shopping, the flower market, and more. We had their buffet breakfast (12 euro/pp) and it was very good. There were pastries, breads, fresh fruit salad, cereals, eggs, ham, sausage, etc. They offer an in room internet for 8 euro/day not per hour as that Paris hotel we booked. They also have a 20 euro/day combination package including the internet, movies, and games. Since we there for one night we booked a regular double with bath and shower (Room 116) for a low rate of 115 euro. The room, like the entire hotel, is decorated in black and red something like a boudoir. The hotel is a boutique hotel and while the room size was a bit small it was okay as it had room for a little sofa. The bathroom was extra small yet it was equipped with a very nice bathtub with rainshower and shower curtain. The toiletries were good (Rituals). However, I must say there some minuses with the room. First of all, the a/c is not available and it was a bit warm; the front desk said they could turn off the heat in order for us to get the a/c. We could open the windows but the room overlooked the back of the hotel's interior but had a set of steps that made the room accessible to anyone if they had wanted to enter. The bathroom had just one narrow shelf space so anything more than the two glasses and a couple of small items there was no place to rest one's personal items. The floor is a black smooth granite or tile and there is no rug so the floor gets wet from the small sink where water is easily splashed out of. The bathroom floor is a slight step up from the bedroom floor so one has to remember this or one can easily trip and fall badly. The room lighting is not good for reading also. But I must say that to me after reading the many mixed hotel reviews for other hotels here The Toren is really a good choice and I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Trekmates
Reviews.Content: My other half and I were in desperate need of a romantic break together, away from all the stresses of modern life, and The Toren seemed the ideal location to take her on a surprise long weekend (3 nights). The warm welcome we received echoed the lengths to which the staff will go to ensure a wonderful stay. Without any pretensions, your hosts make you feel comfortable within opulent, though slightly theatrical surroundings. Our room (109), with massive Jacuzzi bath within the room, separate shower and WC along with a delightfully enticing bed, was a pleasure to occupy. The stained glass window added a real sense of history to the room. Breakfast was a typical continental affair with a good selection and eggs to order were available. Coffee or tea was waiter served. There is no restaurant at the hotel but they do serve a range of snacks / light meals and they can order you in food should you chose, which can be taken in the dinning area or in the privacy of your room. They even have an arrangement with an upmarket Michelin rated French restaurant which is just around the corner to deliver food. We ate out each evening and took the advice of the reception staff on two nights which proved to be spot on (Paso Doble [Tapas] and Long Pura [Indonesian]). The hotel bar is cosy and perfect for enjoying a drink or two! Give the Heineken Extra Cold a try. The hotel has a good canal side location in the more peaceful part of Amsterdam but yet still within easy walking distance of most places you may wish to visit. Overall, a great stay despite being a bit on the pricey side due to the current poor Sterling v Euro exchange rates. We would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rooms, Lovely Staff, Great City”
Reviews.Author: EmilyH25
Reviews.Content: Went with my boyfriend for a Valentines weekend in Amsterdam. Having read the reviews we decided on The Toren. Upon arrival (at 11am) we were informed our room was not yet ready so we were presented with lots of free drinks! (We were hoping to just drop off our luggage and did not expect our room to be ready until the afternoon- so it was a lovely surprise!) We were shown to our room around 12 and it was beautiful. A lovely whirlpool bath, beautifully decorated and a canal view! We were very impressed! I would definately recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in an ideal location for exploring Amsterdam...”
Reviews.Author: matt_from_nottingham
Reviews.Content: It is a little expensive with the current Euro vs Sterling exchange rate; however this is a great hotel. You get the air of luxury from when you first walk in, and it continues when you settle into your room. It is worth paying the extra to secure one of the well equipped rooms. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel, instead had a lovely breakfast pancake at Cafe - De Oude wester, Rozengracht 2/Hoek Prinsengracht, 1016 NB Amsterdam. In the evening, we enjoyed a hidden gem, set back from the road: Manganb Tapas Restaurant and Bar, Rozengracht 106, 1016 NH Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Torentastic”
Reviews.Author: JackofEire
Reviews.Content: Having not been in Amsterdam in over 10 years my wife and I decided to head back for a sneaky mid-week break after a tough few months. Having read a lot of reviews and research I choose the Toren due to its querky design and given Amsterdam is a unique city we wanted to stay in a unique hotel. Well I can tell you thats what we got. We had booked a Junior Bridal Suite but on arriving we were informed that we were upgraded to their best room - the Garden Suite. This is a real funk little one room villa in the centre of the city - quite an interesting experience. We really enjoyed our stay except for the work that is going on kicking off at 9am on the first morning we were there. In saying that they seemed to stop doing any work until we woke up the 2nd day at 11am. Location, staff and rooms are pretty good and while not Ritz Carlton standard I felt there is no better place to stay in a city like Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: ArtBeirut
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our trip to Amsterdam, where we stayed at the Toren Hotel as usual. I say as usual because we've been travelling to Amsterdam for the past 10 years at least 3 times a year on buisness and pleasure. We also tried staying at different hotels around the city. For the past few years, we decided to stick to the Toren Hotel!!!!!!!! Like any traveller we look for the comfort, good service, and that extra thing that makes you feel welcome and at home even when you are in a foreign country. We walked into our room after a long day of travelling and working, and we were welcomed with a bottle of champagne and choclates. I guess this is normal procedure in any hotel for their regular guests; but there was an added value to all this they remembered from our last trip that we like bananas; so bananas we also got. It's the whole atmosphere in this beautiful hotel that compells you to go back time after time, and the effort and hard work of the owner Eric Toren (I mention him by name because every time we are there he's around to sit and chat and make sure that every body who stays with them is welcome as a friend and not a mere client) and all his staff to make each and every guest's stay comfortable and memorable time after time.

Reviews.Title: “FAB fab FAB !! 5 star service”
Reviews.Author: konakid77
Reviews.Content: Fab Fab fab, hotel, booked this place on the strength of the reviews on this site and it did not fail us. Hotel location 10/10, hotel staff 10/10 hotel 10/10. I had stayed in the radisson sas previously but this did not really compare to the Toren for the feel you get from the min you walk through the door ! My girlfriend and me spent our birthday here (we have the same birthday) and it was exactly what we wanted. oh and the breakfast was 10/10 too, we took the option to have it in the room and found we had enough for lunch too !! GO ON STAY HERE !!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: ISj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this great hotel a weekend in November. We had a flight in to Amsterdam very early one morning and were able to check in almost immediately! Our room was very small, but beautifully decorated. And we absolutely loved the bar/dining room as well as the breakfast which was better than most big international hotels. Also the location is great. 10 min walk to the Dam The staff were polite and very helpful and I can definetly recommend this to anyone. A great experience.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect nice hotel with friendly team!!!!”
Reviews.Author: erkan_belek
Reviews.Content: One of the great hotels EVER!!!! And certainly the team is so friendly and very nice Rooms and soo quite!!!!! Located in the middle of Amsterdam!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The very best in my 70 years”
Reviews.Author: Holcus
Reviews.Content: I wanted to celebrate my 70th birthday by taking my wife and my daughter and her partner for a short trip to Amsterdam for a visit to the Resistance Museum, the Hollandsche Schouwburg and a meal at "Heavenly Mud" (also highly recommended) with old Dutch friends. I wanted the hotel experience to be relaxed, happily sophisticated and memorable, near a reasonable tram line, on a canal and quiet. I researched dozens - many dozens - of downtown Amsterdam Hotels on the internet, and again and again I found myself coming back to The Toren with its support of apparently sincere and appreciative visitors. Once I'd taken the plunge and telephoned for a booking, the relaxed and friendly reception was the first in a series of good experiences. The choice was one of the best I've ever made. My party all shared my happiness with this hotel and I very much hope to be able to return for a longer stay in the future. I unreservedly recommend The Toren, thank the designers who fabricated and sustain its unique environment, selected the quality of furnishings, and also the charming and helpful staff who match the delightful ambience with their generosity. And its really not at all expensive, compared with so many others, and more than worth what it charges.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite Hotel EVER!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: amelia9
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 4 night stay at the Toren to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary. I absolutely loved the Toren. The bar/breakfast room is stunning. The staff are the friendliest I have ever encountered in all my travels, so helpful and welcoming. The rooms are a little scuffed around the edges but decorated beautifully, a lovely big bed with lots of cushions, a modern bathroom, a flat screen TV, a coffee maker and a mini bar. The decor was definately to my taste lots of romantic touches and fabulous christmas decorations. The breakfast was simply perfect, a huge selection, fruit salad cheeses meats hot food smoked salmon cereals juices yoghurts etc plus anything else you could wish for prepared by the chef. I would never stay anywhere else in Amsterdam, this is by far my absolute favourite hotel. It is also very convenient about a 10min walk to the Dam. My only negative comment would be the small rooms (ours was a deluxe and still very cramped) but this is typical for Amsterdam and was more than made up for by everything else.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheFunLover
Reviews.Content: The hotel is unique. Rooms are designed with perfect style. You feel like staying in somebody's home - not in hotel. I tried a dozen hotels in A'DAM - this on is the best. Perfect balance between quite nice street and short distance to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel....loved it!”
Reviews.Author: AnnaB08
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 3 night stay in The Toren with my BF. We stayed in a standard double...got a great deal on the hotel website, only 250euro for the 3 nights!! Breakfast wasn't included as we usually sleep in past breakfast when we are away! loved the look and feel of the hotel...the decor is amazing and really added to the romantic feel of our holiday...they put up the xmas decorations while we were there and they were fab...look at the pic of the bar! The room was small enough but definintely manageable.....bed was sooo comfy and loved all the pillows! Bathroom was spotless with a fantastic power shower and a bath...i'm a bit of a monica when it comes to cleanliness and am very fussy about what hotels we stay in, so was impressed with the overall cleanliness of the entire hotel as well as our room. Rooms were quite warm but air con was available... a mini bar was also in the room but there was enough space to put in our own big bottles of water to keep them cool throughout the night. The staff were very nice, efficient, our check in was litterally 2 mins, our bags were brought to our room and when we asked for a late checkout on our last day we were allowed to stay until 1pm instead of the usual 11am without any additional charge. They stored our bags afterwards so we could still walk around Amsterdam in comfort until we had to leave for the airport. The only thing that was missing was an iron in the room!! not sure if an iron is available in the larger rooms....but overall I cannot fault this hotel at all....loved every minute we stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Loved every second”
Reviews.Author: stupot08
Reviews.Content: I booked one night at the toren for me an my fiancee as it was my birthday, from the website and reviews this hotel sounded amazing, and it was. Upon arrival the staff were extremely friendly helping us in anyway, our luggage was taken upstairs and we were showed our room, it was stunning, spacious clean and tidy with everything you could ever need. i would recommend this hotel to anyone its has to seen the styling and elegance is great.

Reviews.Title: “Like nothing you've seen before”
Reviews.Author: bhhandel
Reviews.Content: I was travelling with a friend, and left it up to him to book the hotel, so I didn't really know what to expect, but this hotel is really like nothing you can expect anyway. The hotel is decorated by an award-winning designer, and done entirely in black, red and gold. This could result either in the place looking like a whore house, or extremely dramatic and spectacular, and luckily, The Toren landed on the last result. The hotel is relatively small, situated in a quiet area not far from Anne Franks House and The Nine Streets, so a LOT of interesting shops nearby. The hallways in the hotel are dark, and decorated lavishly to the point of almost ridiculous, EVERYTHING is glossy finishes, velvet, cut-glass, chandeliers and huge fake flower arrangements. The rom wasn't VERY big, but very well-equipped, with flatscreen tv with cable (and several english language stations), an ipod docking station, a complimentary nespresso machine, and a huge bathroom, actually almost the same size as the rest of the room. The bathroom was just closed off from the rest of the room by a curtain, but had a large shower with a rainfall showerhead, and the biggest jacuzzi i have ever seen in a bathroom. The jacuzzi had several programs,and built-in colored lights. Oh yes. We were happy to find that despite the whole curtain-scenario, the toilet was shielded by a door. The room was like the rest of the hotel done in a black, red and gold color scheme, and the bathroom was largely in black marble. The bed was extremely comfortable, VERY big and had lots of pillows and cushions. If you go for the look that this hotel has chosen, wear and tear IS going to show, but why mope about the fact that there are some scratches in the wallpaper, if you look closely? I prefer to focus on the point of thoughtful and luxurious complementaries, such as the Nespresso machine, and some extremely nice toiletries, by Rituals. Breakfast is served in a room that doubles as bar for the rest of the day/night, and the room itself is quite something. Breakfast was not included in our rate, bur had a great selection, and the food was delicious, well worth it. Service at the hotel is efficient and friendly, but professional. My friend had problems with his credit card when we were checking out, and they couldn't have been more helpful in a stressful situation like that. We were very happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: marcusmonaco
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived the welcome was fantastic. The team were young, friendly and fun. The room was beautiful with a very romantic atmosphere. Everything we needed for a great week end was there. I spend 150 nights a year in hotels and this was easily the best this year!

Reviews.Title: “great chic hotel”
Reviews.Author: MASHURA
Reviews.Content: Great design hotel. You will love interior of the hotel and rooms. Staying in the hotel you will find yourself in a boutique with perfect design. Breakfast is great and delicious. The dinner room is decorated in very rich style. We loved everything in this hotel and with any occasion will return there. For some people it may be important that it is situated in 10 minutes walking from the center, but for travelers that are coming for explore the city it is not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “The Toren- Stunning !”
Reviews.Author: abbeyk
Reviews.Content: Fantastic experience, rooms are gorgeous, pure decadence, big chandeliers above the beds, very modern, super clean and well kept. Staff are lovely and very helpful. Will definantly stay there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: kirkmcquest
Reviews.Content: The hotel Toren is ideally located within walking distance of the central area, red light, etc.., yet Toren maintains a dignified distance from the humbuggery of downtown Amsterdam. Just around the corner from the Pankake Bakery and the Anne Frank house, mere blocks from the red light, old church, several great pubs and 'cafes' ( specifically 'grey matter'). Rooms are small ( welcome to Europe) but clean, staff is friendly and helpful. Coffee machines in the rooms. The only draw back is the price, which seems a bit hefty for such a small room. Internet available in rooms,tv (english), etc. I have stayed in Amsterdam twice and both times at Toren simply because I love the location. Next time I might try another hotel only for the benefit of diversity.

Reviews.Title: “Great Accommodations and People”
Reviews.Author: Happy_Wanderer050
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful little hotel in a great part of Amsterdam. Our room was in the "annex", and so was a few doors down from the lounge and front desk. The room was large with a great view of the canal. We never heard noises from other guests, and the neighborhood is quiet as well. Wonderfully situated near many points of interest in this most walkable (and bikeable) city. The staff was universally friendly and accommodating. They helped us on several occasions with restaurant choices and did extensive research for us on good bicycle shops in town. Their English was flawless, and their friendly attitude put us at ease.

Reviews.Title: “So good I almost don't want to review it!”
Reviews.Author: Wuffa
Reviews.Content: I have been going to Amsterdam for many years. It is a lovely city and as I have got older I just appreciate its diversity and interest more and more. This hotel is by far the best place I have stayed in the city. It has real charm....its is boutique and well designed without being pretentious and intimidating. Intimate and romantic in a perfect location! I go back over and over again.....and in fact I almost don't want to recommend it in case I cant get a room next time I go!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Hotel Stay”
Reviews.Author: Gruffy1
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam. The Netherlands The Toren Hotel. September 8th to 12th.2008. I arranged this trip as a surprise birthday present for my wife's 60th birthday. After searching the websites I chose The Toren because it had all the special features I was looking for. Ann's birthday was 6th September but I told her the news the day before! That was a good move because Ann was able to share it with her father who was ill in hospital. Sid was so keen for Ann to enjoy the trip. Tragically Sid died on Sunday morning the 7th. It was a tough call but with the family's support we set off via Eurostar from London through Bruxelles. Feeling tired and emotionally drained we arrived to find The Toren Hotel in an ideal quiet and peaceful location. The staff, on hearing our news were absolutely magnificent. They could not have been kinder or more compassionate. To our surprise and delight there was champagne awaiting us to celebrate Ann's birthday. The room was delightful - the jacuzzi such a wonderful aid to alleviate the stress and strain we both felt. The whole ambience of the hotel was excellent. Breakfast was truly great and exactly what was required. The Toren was in just the right location for us to enjoy the canals, the museums, the park and the local restaurants. In addition to the champagne on our arrival the staff arranged for food to be delivered to save us having to go out to find a restaurant. Later in our stay we were delighted again with the gift of strawberries and chocolates. The fire in Eurotunnel on 11/12 September made us feel marooned! Yet again the staff were so helpful and considerate. What might have been a difficult and stressful experience was made so pleasant and memorable because The Toren Hotel is such a beautiful relaxing place and everyone there took such excellent care of us throughout. Nothing was too much trouble. We thank you from the bottom of our hearts for your warmth, your care and your professionalism. We hope to return as soon as we can.

Reviews.Title: “One of Amsterdam's Finest!”
Reviews.Author: BrucedNH
Reviews.Content: I've had the privilege of staying at the Hotel Toren a few times over recent years and have always been thoroughly impressed with both the property itself and the staff. The hotel is in an excellent location within the heart of Amsterdam, which makes it convenient for sightseeing, especially if you plan to tour much of the city by foot. The accommodations are excellent, with nicely furnished rooms and an overall elegant charm and very comfortable atmosphere. The staff at the Toren are some of the best I've encountered in all my years of extensive travel. The clearly go out of their way to ensure your experience at their hotel is the best possible from the time you book your room, until you checkout and everything in between. I can't speak highly enough of this hotel. The rooms and the staff, coupled with their location and very fair prices should make the Toren the #1 choice for accommodations when visiting Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, service and facilities”
Reviews.Author: northantsfamily
Reviews.Content: Excellent. Lovely clean room with everything you need. The double Jacuzzi in the bedroom was fantastic. The hotel staff were friendly and very helpful. Check-in time is 1pm. We arrived at noon and our room was ready. Our bags were taken to the room and we were immediately impressed. The room had a separate wc and shower room which was clean and spacious. The bedroom was very ornate and spotless. I have to say the bed was the most comfortable we have ever experienced in a hotel. Facilities included a coffee making machine with various complimentary coffees, mini bar, broadband access (via your own laptop or via the TV), air conditioning, great lighting with dimmer controls and the lovely double Jacuzzi with various settings and coloured lighting. I thought we had experienced a brief lapse in the otherwise excellent service one evening when we waited about 10 minutes to be served a drink in the bar. We realised that the bar tender was showing some newly arrived guests to their room. When he returned he apologised for the delay, took our order and then said they were complimentary drinks as an apology for the delay (we had not mentioned that we had been waiting). It is this sort of attention to detail and service mentality which sets the Toren apart! An excellent location too. Just a short stroll from the '9 streets' shopping area, Dam Square and the shopping main areas. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who appreciates good service and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Plush, great value for money”
Reviews.Author: AK_Dublin
Reviews.Content: This is a great find - we checked in for one night and were brough to a room in the "annex" just a few doors down from check in. It was a great room with high ceilings, ornate decoration but with all the trimmings - iPod dock, Nespresso coffee maker, flat screen tv, robes and slippers. We didn't have breakfast but it looked good, with lots of choice. The hotel is well located in the Jordan district of Amsterdam, a 15 minute walk from central station, just around the corner from Anne Frank's house. Couldn't fault the place - we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish & Ecclectic”
Reviews.Author: foord
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel for one night before we checked into hour canal boat for the weekend. It was sublime. Our room was small but very clean and the decor was decadent. I like to have a decent coffee machine in my room, and the coffee itself was v.nice. We enjoyed a late night drink in the lavishly decorated bar and stylish breakfast in the morning. Would love to stay longer in a bigger room (small room for two nights max). Great location, on quieter canal but immensely close to Dam Sq and the Jordaan.

Reviews.Title: “Chic and Plush!”
Reviews.Author: Enough
Reviews.Content: Not just a super location but a really stylish boutique hotel. I had the good fortune to pick this hotel and to book a Superior room with canal view, I can only say that if I didn't have to attend various meetings I would have been happy to stay in this room all day, decadent interiors, plush furnishings, a Nespresso Machine! (Yes in my room!) and a whirlpool bath make a stay in the Torens truly delightful. The staff were most friendly and helpful and the breakfast was pure joy - FRESHLY SQUEEZED OJ! - and there is a really cool bar. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. Elizabeth - Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Amsterdamse Hotel in the heart of the canal belt”
Reviews.Author: DJPage
Reviews.Content: This wonderful hotel is in a fantastic location, central and in walking distance of anywhere you would want to go. In the heart of the famous canal belt, overlooking the Keizersgracht Canal, with the Jordaan and the 9 Staatjes on the doorstep, and perfectly placed for a stay in Amsterdam. The hotel was really lovely, a real little boutique gem. Our room was pretty small, but to be expected from a city centre hotel, especially in Amsterdam, however it was immaculately presented, beautifully decorated, and the bed was so comfortable we nearly didn't make it up in the morning. The bathroom was also small, but with a great powerful shower and lovely Rituals toiletries for that extra touch of luxury, you couldn't ask for more. The staff were very helpful, and friendly, and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. We used to live in Amsterdam, and this was the first time we'd ever been back and stayed in a hotel rather than been there "at home", which felt very strange, however it turned out to be lovely. Booking a hotel you don't know on the internet is always a bit of a lottery, but this time it was a complete success. We will be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Drumaddict
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a romantic weekend in Amsterdam. Though normally too expensive, we managed to wait for a "hot deal" whith reduced price. And a hot deal it certainly was. Besides of it's very romantic atmosphre the hotel has one major benefit, namely the location. In one word: super. Walking from the Amsterdam Central Station to the hotel takes 10 minutes because it's only a few hundred meters away. The Keizersgracht, were the hotel is lying, is in the middle of old Amsterdam. Whatever you want to do or see, most of it can be done walking from the hotel or by channel taxi-boat. This last option is a wonderful way of travelling through Amsterdam, check it yourself. It has a stop near by the hotel. We stayed 3 days in Amsterdam (and got the Gay Pride Parade as an amusing and exciting extra) and wandered for hours through cosy streets along the channels and did two very long channel trips which has lovely views. Also the visit at the Zoo was nice. We spent the evenings at Leidseplein, Central Station area and the famous "Walletjes" in the Red District. There's a lot of very good restaurants and cafÃ©'s in all kind of styles, so all of you will find something to your taste. The Rembrandt Museum, the Anne Frank House and all of those famous spots are very near by. Our hotel room was very nice, tidy and quiet. It had a romantic and authentic touch to it and all kind of services were available. The hotel staff was exceptionally kind and helpful and they were able to give smart and solid advise on all kind of things concerning Amsterdam. Allthough breakfast had to be paid as an extra, it hads all we needed and wanted. Meat, fish, vegetables and fruits, dairy, everything was fresh. Coffee and tea were also really OK. If you ever want to travel to Amsterdam and experience the romantic inner city, this hotel is one of your best options.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: gkaplanios
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at above hotel for four days with my wife, after thoroughly researching the large number of central hotels available in Ams. Booked through hotel website, as it had a very attractive offer, a deluxe double with bath and shower. A small remark about the shower, it was a huge rainshower type element which turned bathing into an experience every time. The room was big enough for two, very classy, great bed, lots of pillows, big lcd tv with plenty of sat channels, well stocked minibar and on top of everything it provided a nespresso machine! There was a wardrobe with plenty of space and a big safe inside. The bathroom was also big, very impressive shower and sink, with Rituals toilettries and bathrobes with slippers. The hotel is located on a central canal, 5 minutes on foot from Dam square, 2 minutes on foot from Anne Franke house, surrounded by many restaurants and cafes, very close to the tram stop, very quiet location day or night. Overall an excellent hotel, highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “very special toren”
Reviews.Author: timjordan
Reviews.Content: my wife and i stayed a the toren for 6 nights,the room was very comfortable,with good aminities and a fantastic view over the canal, the toren is idealy located ,its just far enough away from the real centre of amsterdam to be quiet, but close enough to walk there in 5 mins, the hotel was special with its opulent design and colours, the staff were tremendously helpful in giving advice on resturants and bars, this was with out doubt one of the best breaks we have had,we were not expecting to be so taken with amsterdam,but with its quiet pace of life the beautiful canals and freindly people we were truly impressed, the toren made the break extra special. we will be returrning to the toren and wonderful amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Suited Us To a T!”
Reviews.Author: BCJay
Reviews.Content: After researching countless hotels on the internet, my wife and I finally chose The Toren for our first-ever visit to Amsterdam. We hoped it would live up to everything we had learned about it online. It did, and more. The Toren and our Amsterdam trip as a whole exceeded the high expectations with which we had arrived. Location, charm, cleanliness, friendliness, uniqueness, hospitality, elegance, comfort â€“ The Toren has it all! And to top it off, it's sexy! (Hey, I'm sixty-one, so I'll take whatever help I can get!) We booked a "Hot Deal" room, knowing full well that we wouldn't be able to cancel should we have to do so. Well, wouldn't you know it? The day we were set to take the train from Paris to Amsterdam, one of those infamous French strikes struck! We had to stay yet another day in Paris. (Yah, like that's a problem?) I emailed The Toren to update them and to say we would arrive on the 21st instead of the 20th. Wendy Vissar said our room remained booked, but if they could resell it, we'd get the refund. We couldn't ask for better than that. As it turned out, Wendy was able to give us that refund and, true to form, did so graciously. So we need to add "honesty" to that string of honorific nouns provided above. (Recollecting Wendy, let me add "beauty," too. If my wife comments on this, I'll swear I'm referring to The Toren's beauty only.) My wife and I will stay at The Toren again if we can. We do not hesitate to recommend it to folks we know. You should do your own research, though. The Toren suited us to a T. I hope you find what suits you, too.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience”
Reviews.Author: roy_kant
Reviews.Content: this hotel has what it takes to welcome you. The staff is warm, friendly and always at your service. My room was very nicely decorated and has all facilities you may need (tea and coffee, minibar, room service). The mini bar items have very decent prices. This hotel worth at least a try that you will certainly not regret.

Reviews.Title: “Romance in the Heart of Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: Tim-Tam8
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay in this fabulous hotel. Our room was a luxury double with whirlpool bath and it did not disappoint!! The staff were very friendly and I would especially like to thank the guy on reception (cannot for the life of me remember his name, sorry!) for his help and concern when we needed to find a doctor â€“ much appreciated. All in all the location, the hotel and the staff made our weekend one to remember â€“ we will definitely visit with them again!! .

Reviews.Title: “Quirky hotel offering laid back comfort in the heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: balso
Reviews.Content: After a flight cancellation we stayed one night at this hotel suggested by hotel reservations desk at Schiphol airport and were impressed by its originality, friendly helpful staff and unique room design. It's canalside location in the heart of the Jordaan district meant that some of Amsterdam's best cafe's and buildings were within easy reach and the station for trains to the airport was also a manageable walk. As much as we enjoyed the unusual decoration the room, although clean and comfortable was a little small and we would hope for more space if we stayed there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy with Hotel Toren”
Reviews.Author: jgalt114
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Toren for 5 nights this April 2008. We stayed in the annex a few doors down from the main building in a superior room with a canal view. I have traveled to europe many times over the years and I am aware of what is considered a spacious room. I was very happy with the size- not huge but plenty of room on either side of bed and several feet from foot to furniture. The beds were comfortable with beautiful linens. The room had a safe, refrigerator, robes and slippers and the bathroom was a decent size and recently renovated. I was very pleased with the accomodations. The annex should be considered- it is quiet and convenient and apparently the superior rooms are a bit larger than the main building. The breakfast was excellent with a large variety of foods. The staff was young, friendly, and extremely helpful. They arranged tickets for museums and recommended an excellent restaurant nearby for dinner. I would stay at the Toren without hesitation in a heartbeat!! Some restaurants that I would recommend, they are excellent but not inexpensive: Brasserie Harkema, 11, and Restaurant Luwte (Toren). Amsterdam is a beautiful, relaxed, and friendly city. I am in my fifties and my friend and I rented bikes and rode all over the city- it's the best way to get around. The toren recommends Bike City. They are nearby and very accomodating. JG

Reviews.Title: “The "Beautiful" Toren Hotel”
Reviews.Author: samson23
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one bitterly cold night (outside) in December last year.This has to be one of the best hotels I have stayed in, and I have stayed in a few over the years, let me tell you. On arrival you will be surprised at the lovely decor of the ground floor, not to mention the warmth and charm of the friendly staff who greet you (they even went to the trouble of sorting out the complex car parking fees for overnight parking on the canal side, insisting on walking across the canal with me in the snow to make sure I paid the right fees and did not get a ticket). On being shown to our room we where again surprised at its elegance. Combining a mixture of modern technology - flat screen tv, wi-fi, etc - with an opulent decor of satins, silks, fluffy cushions and warm colours. The effect instantly took the chill of an Amsterdam December evening from your bones, as if the 19th & 21st centuries had collided to produce an oasis of charm in the desert of winter. Changing after a hot shower in the spacious and well designed bathroom we where thus well prepared to enjoy the delights of Amsterdam, returning in the early hours when we were encouraged by the ever so friendly night porter to enjoy a night cap in the spacious bar area. The charm offensive continued the next day when, after a sumptuous continental breakfast, we sadly had to check out. The staff seemed genuinely sorry to see you depart, wishing you bon voyage as you left and hoping that you would return some day. Our trip was complete when, on leaving the hotel, we were greeted by a picture postcard scene of the canal banks draped in snow in a scene that could only have appeared on a Christmas Card. A lovely ending to a wonderful experience. I hope to go back to Amsterdam in the summer and will definitely be looking to stay in The Toren Hotel, can't wait.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy New Year”
Reviews.Author: LunaFez
Reviews.Content: I wanted to spend my New Year in relaxed and comfortable surroundings and since I've stayed at 'The Toren' before and always been very satisfied, it was surely my first choice..! There where 4 main reasons for picking 'The Toren' for my New Year visit..! First of all the very friendly and helpful staff..! But secondly 'The Toren' is the most stylish and cosy hotel in Amsterdam - nicely furnished and always clean..! Another good reason is the location - especially considered that Amsterdam turns itself into a party-city these days..! 'The Toren' is perfectly located nearby Westerkerk - which is only 10 min. walk from the very center of Amsterdam and yet placed in a quiet and idyllic area..! Finally I just love 'The Toren'..! I've stayed there 4 times now and always been very satisfied..! The rooms are big considered Amsterdam standard and very well furnished and in a very cosy and royal-like fashion..! All rooms got nice flatscreen TV's and your own cappucino-machine..! I can only recommend 'The Toren' to anybody going to Amsterdam..!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: karenwendy81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Toren Hotel for 5 days from 11th Jan - 16th Jan 2008. We were very impressed by the feel of the hotel it is decorated in a 17th century style with big chandeliers and open fireplaces. The location of the hotel is excellent it is just round the corner from Anne Franks House, and in walking distance to the whole city. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. We arrived at the Hotel very early in the day, we were allowed to leave our bags in a secure locked room so we were free to go look around the city. We were also given free drinks in the restaurant while we waited. Our room was very clean with a comfortable bed and flat screen TV. The bathroom was spotless with everthing you need. The only downside was the hairdryer which was so slow and hard to use as you have to keep the button held in to make it work. We had breakfast included with our room, it was a buffet with hot food, ceral, juices, cold meats, chesses, pastries and tea/coffee. There was more than enough to keep us happy. The bar in the hotel is very cosy and friendly and open until 1am. Overall the hotel was excellent and we would definatly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Really Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: ChiChiinEurope
Reviews.Content: The Hotel and the building three doors down were both incredibly decorated. Our canal side room had a magnificent view, was luxuriously furnished and really had all the conveniences. The staff were very helpful, and though we only partook of the breakfast buffet once (on Christmas morning) it was very nice. We were taken aback at 12 euros per person, we found that was about the going price. The one shocker was the cost of parking in Amsterdam (30 euros per day if you can find a spot.) But that's not the fault of the hotel, and for most travelers who arrive by train or taxi not an issue. We were recommended several excellent restaurants, all within walking distance and the beautiful fireplace and bar were very welcome after the cold walks around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Neighborhood, Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ericksonpa
Reviews.Content: My first impression of this hotel was very positive. The hotel was walkable from the train station, about 10-15 minutes and is a great way to immediately get a sense of the neighborhood in which you will be staying. The staff checked us in promptly and the bellman took our bags up to the second floor. I didn't see an elevator during our stay and we were always using the stairs, so not sure if there is one. Both desk agent and bellman were friendly and helpful, so no issues here. Room #115 was at the back of the hotel. They call this the "quiet side" of the hotel. Which is really just a way of saying there is no view, unless you count the skylight of the kitchen below, a view. The room was decorated nicely with nice deep red colors and fluffy down comforters. It looked a bit like a brothel, which I thought was kind of interesting, considering the city we were in. It felt cozy, very small, but cozy. I have stayed at a variety of hotels in Europe and this one is smaller than most. I wondered why there was so much furniture in the room, (bed, 2 chairs, desk, 2 nightstands and table), which only made it seem smaller. Maybe if it was cleared out a bit it would have felt larger. The bathroom was a great size, with plenty of room and all the normal amenities to keep you from bringing your entire bathroom. My favorite feature in the room was the coffee maker. This might seem a bit trivial, but, as an American travelling to Europe, one of the things I really enjoy is great coffe almost everywhere you go and it was nice to have a "proper" coffee maker in the room. It was a "Nespresso" machine that could brew you espresso, coffees and teas. Easy to use with a lot of selections! Breakfast was "ok", very standard fare for a European Hotel. Pastries, juices, meats and cheeses. Although the chef/cook, did come out to each table to ask if there was anything additional or special he could prepare, that was not already out on the buffet. The hotel staff were friendly enough, although I get a feeling they were not completely happy with Americans. I am very sensitive to this subject, as it comes up often enough, lately, while travelling in Europe, so I am careful to be, almost over courteous, and still felt a bit affected by the overall attitude. The best reason to stay at this hotel is the location. Situated outside the city center, you are close enough to walk to all attractions, but still able to enjoy the "quietness" and "local" feel to the area. There are a few Dutch restaurants on the hotels, recommendation list and found two of them to be outstanding. The "De Reiger" and "Clais Claisz", hope I am remembering these correctly, were outstanding, with De Reiger being the better of the two. All in all, I think the hotel is, just a bit overpriced, but would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: jry-i
Reviews.Content: Great location! Friendly staff and wonderful wine drinking spot behind the hotel in the garden.

Reviews.Title: “Classic but small”
Reviews.Author: tpom
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and had many accents. It is on one of the canals and a relative quiet street, with in walking distance to central Amsterdam. The front desk staff were both helpful and friendly. We arrived at 8 am and were exhausted. They managed to get our room ready my 11:00 instead of waiting until the 2 pm check in time. The room was small and expensive, the bathroom was the same size as the bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: RedLiverpoolUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Toren for the second time and will probably return. Pricey, we paid extra for a room witha canal view. Breakfast was an extra - 12 Euros for a good buffet with hot choices. we chose to eat breakfast in the hotel but there are planty of nearby cafes where you could get a breakfast for less money. The hotel was as lovely as we remembered it, especially the public rooms. We have invited friends for drinks at our hotel and they are always impressed. The bedroom decor is a bit old fashioned but clean and looks fine. Lovely big bed. Very friendly staff came out to wave us off when we left for the airport. Location on Keizersgracht is very pleasant and within easy reach of Dam Square, Central Station, museums, shopping etc. if you enjoy a stroll. On the parallel Prinsengracht, there are some nice cafes e.g. Cafe Prins, Cafe t'Smalle and futher down, past the Noordkirk, the Papeneiland.

Reviews.Title: “Cute and friendly, but over-priced”
Reviews.Author: CarsDublin
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend stayed there for 3 nights in June 2007... The website lead us to believe the hotel & rooms were huge but they weren't. This was a little disappointing but I find hotel rooms, in general, are never quite what they seem. The breakfast, while being overpriced, most definitely, was not a disappointment. The choice of cereals, juices, fruits, not to mention the non-healthy, eggs, sausages and bacon, were all plentiful and tasty. We arrived down late one morning and early another and the quantities were fine. It is worth knowing that we were there from a Mon - Wed so that may have had something to do with the amount of food available coming up to the 11.00am mark ... Overall though, I would say that the hotel was a nice, friendly, place to stay. Overpriced somewhat but I think this can be made up for by the unusual decor, which for me is important. Bedclothes matching paintings matching curtains is not something I like to pay for. Toren is not this. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, quiet rooms”
Reviews.Author: Bluette92
Reviews.Content: Our flight from Seattle arrived Amsterdam at about 8am. The room at Hotel Toren wasn't quite ready, but when we were able to access the room at 12noon, we were shown to a quiet and peaceful place to rest. No city noise, just birds chirping. Our room was in the second building of this hotel, and couldn't have been a more restful place to recover from jet lag. This is the second time we have stayed at this hotel, and we'll be back. The location is fantastic - very close to the center of the city and walking distance to many interesting sites. The breakfast is nice with many options, but a bit pricey, and there are places to get coffee close by. My only negative is that the area around the check-in desk is oddly layed out so it is awkward to interact with the hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “toren the tiny”
Reviews.Author: aveller
Reviews.Content: This Hotel had loads of character and was generally very pretty.However the double room was tiny and it was difficult to find a place to leave your case.The room had a very good coffee machine and was maintained well.T he breakfast which was extra was poor as once certain foods were gone they were not replaced so if you came down late you were unlucky.The staff were very friendly and polite.All in all a good hotel but pricey considering size of rooms

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Uz27
Reviews.Content: It was a Excellent trip and Excellent hotel. The room wasnt so big but very clean . The hotel a litle bit "off centre" .

Reviews.Title: “Bad Omen with Reservation”
Reviews.Author: joni*girl
Reviews.Content: I don't know if this review will pass the screening, but I did want to let everyone know what happened when we tried to reserve the Large Bridal Suite in October for our vacation in May. I'd actually heard about the Hotel Toren through a guidebook, which also mentioned a 10% discount if you mentioned the book at the time of reservation. So, I checked out the price of the suite on the Internet, then contacted the hotel via e-mail for their rate (hoping since we were booking a 7-night stay, I could negotiate a bit of a discount from the internet price - then plus the tourbook discount. I figured, can't hurt to ask.) The hotel staff readily responded with a rate higher than quoted on the internet. When I brought this fact to their attention, they agreed to hold the room for me, and to discuss the discrepancy with Mr. Toren, to see what would be a fair rate. So, even if I'd wanted to book at the first internet rate, I couldn't. I did not hear back from them for weeks (despite a quick reminder a few days after our initial contact), at which time, the hotel was able to honor the initial internet rate. I'd already booked at another hotel, and declined this room. I just didn't have a good feeling about it.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: buster29
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fantastic, well worth the 10minute walk from Central Station. We arrived at the hotel 4 hours before we could check in, although our room wasnt ready at time we checked in and left our luggage in the secure baggage room. We were assured if we came back 2 hours later our room would be ready, which it was. The room itself was lovely and clean with a whirlpool bath, which was great. The hotels location is far enough away from the nightlife to be quiet, but near enough to stagger back to. The staff were very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: sajchicken
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for our honey moon and we LOVED IT! Everyone at the Hotel was very helpful and very kind. The room was large, walk in closet, very comfortable bed, and the bathroom was HUGE! And most of all VERY clean!! We had a canal veiw and loved hearing the clock tower as well as the passing ducks from the canal.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the walk home over the bridges”
Reviews.Author: Ariii
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in the Hotel Toren and had a very pleasant stay. The weather in Amsterdam was poor alot of rain and it was cold. It was very relaxing to return to the hotel to warm up and revatilise ourselves with a drink in their cosy bar with the added bonus of a fire. The staff were excellent, very helpful, gave good advise on where to eat and booked trips for us. This was a positive experience as most hotels we have stayed in the staff are "too busy on their computers" to spend any genuine time chatting to guests. We weren't disappointed with our bedrooms as thanks to your site we were fore warned that they were small, they were very elegant, beautifully decorated and cleaned every day. Shopping advise- stay away from the big malls like "The Magna Plaza" and "De Bijenkorf" tres expensive. I found a very good dept store on Dam Square "Peek & Cloppenburg" good quality clothes, reasonable price and helpful staff. We visited the Irish bar "O'Reilly's" and while we enjoyed our visit we were charged 10 euro for a pot of tea and a pot of hot water to top up. A bit of a rip off for a pub claiming to be an Irish bar. We found a lovely short cut home back to the hotel over four bridges/canals away from the main thorough fare and you felt you were heading into the real Amsterdam. We walked every where and when we felt weary we hopped on a tram and found the drivers very willing to set you on the right track. We found everyone from hotel staff, tram drivers, restaurant staff, shop assistants, tour guides etc. very courteous and helpful. We felt that we were very lucky that we booked to stay in the Toren I think our break would not have been as enjoyable if we stayed at a big impersonal hotel. Thanks to all at the Toren for helping to make our stay in Amsterdam a pleasant one.

Reviews.Title: “Torrents of Praise”
Reviews.Author: Aldo_Nola
Reviews.Content: We just loved this place. Suite 406 is large, quiet, tastefully appointed, and located in the "annex" a few doors from the main hotel. At first I was concerned about not being in the hotel proper, but this was no problem. There is an espresso maker in the room with complimentary coffee and tea...try finding that elsewhere in Europe. Everything was sqeaky-clean. Bed was extremely comfortable. There is a small rooftop patio (no view) for smokers or those in need of fresh air, The photos on their website are accurate, especially the 360 degree "tours" of the rooms. The bathroom has a real "wow" factor, very large and modern with a jacuzzi large enough for two to share. My only quibble is that one has to descend a steep and curved staircase to get to the bathroom so you must be VERY careful especially at night and you'll be fine. Do not book this suite if you have trouble with stairs. Bath linens were very high quality. Location is quite good on a very lovely canal, very close to Anne Frank's house and the Westerkirk. We walked everywhere (train station, Rembrandt's house, Rijk's Museum, Van Gogh museum, etc. with no problems. The surprisingly young staff is gracious, professional and very helpful with suggestions for dining, sightseeing etc. The bar is elegant and friendly. Barman Thomas is a model of Dutch courtesy and effciency. Breakfast is reasonable and well done with pastries, cold cuts, cheeses, even sausage and eggs.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: tweeddoc
Reviews.Content: My family of four stayed here in August for three nights and we really were not impressed. Toren is part of the Canal House hotel and shares the bar/breakfast room. Aside from those two very elegant rooms, the hotel is pretty much a 1 - 2 star flop house. Our room, which had an extra bed added, was extrremely small and did not allow for any space to put our luggage. Even with three in the room it would have been too small. There was no A/C and the bathroom was really quite grungy. The hotel is close to Ann Frank House and within easy walking distance of the Dam and the museum district, but these are not good enough reasons to stay here. From what I saw, the Canal House was not much better. The staff was indifferent, at best, and truly not interested in us. On a related note, I have to say how dejected we were with Amsterdam in general. Having been there some ten years ago were were really looking forward to exposing our children to what used to be a vibrant, beautiful city. Sadly, it is nothing of the sort anymore. Drugs (pot and magic mushrooms) are king now, with prostitution running a close second. At one time it was a chore to find the famed "brown cafes" that sell marijuana. Now these "coffeehouses" are on virtually every street corner, and so too are the legions of stoned "drug tourists" that go with them. Moreover, it seemed that the entire city was under construction - even the museums which were very disappointing since so many exhibits were closed. I hate to say this, but we were even disappointed by Ann Frank House - sacred ground indeed, but badly in need of work. I could go on, but suffice it say that Amsterdam is off our travel map for a while.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and undersized”
Reviews.Author: BrightonMelbourne
Reviews.Content: After extensive research as well checking the hotel's website I asked our travel agent to book this hotel for us. Upon arrival we were showed around the main building, shown the lovely breakfast room / bar; then came the shocks: "By the way your room is not in this building, it is in our annex; also breakfast is not included either." The annex happened to be about 10 houses down the road, a real run-down, dirty old place with our either canal or garden view promised room turned out to look over some toilet block between the 3rd and 4th floor. The room was so small that our luggage almost didn't fit, there weren't enough coat hangers, there was a kicked in hole on the bathroom door, numerous light globes were missing and so on. As we were charged 170.00 Euros for this, we felt totally ripped off and could stand one night only, before we moved to a better, nicer and a lot cheaper hotel just next door. It is possible that the main building is OK, but the secondary building wouldn't be good enough for a student dormitory.

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous Toren”
Reviews.Author: Jimisdead
Reviews.Content: Just returned after our 25th anniversary break at this lovely hotel. It's an old renovated canal house with usual narrow stairs but good lift.
