We booked a junior suite and had a great canal view and a real espresso machine for our regular coffee fix. Hotel exceptionaly clean with great friendly staff. Ideally situated if you don't want to be right in the centre (very noisy) but everything about 5 to 10 minutes away. Anne Frank House behind the hotel but go early in the morning and take a box of tissues. (a moving experience). Watch out for the mad cyclists on silent pushbikes. Amsterdam people are very helpful and friendly and we will return and probably to the Toren. We booked all our holidays this year using Trip Adviser, so if this report helps you as others have helped us, thanks to everyone who writes them, good or bad. Hope this helps you. Signing off now!! Toodlepip.. from a Welsh tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore Any Negative Comments - This Place Is Perfect”
Reviews.Author: eezardogs
Reviews.Content: The perfect hotel! An idyllic location, being in the prettiest part of Amsterdam, on the canal, yet just a short walk to anywhere and everywhere you would like to visit. The staff can not do enough for you and the decor of the hotel is beautiful. The air conditioned room was very welcome and the whole place was spotless. You will feel like royalty with the settings and the attitude of the staff but comfortable enough to have a very reasonable priced drink in the bar(cheaper than any other bar/cafe we found) or breakfast in the lounge in your jeans and T shirts! Definately worth the extra to get a room with a (very large) whirlpool bath - great fun! During our stay we saw a selection of hotels. Our opinion is that the nicer ones are too far out from the attractions and the closer ones are awful; except the Hotel Toren. A truly magnificent, friendly hotel in the perfect location for a romantic break. Looking forward to visiting again soon. --- I have not attached photos because the 360 degree reality rooms on view are exactly as you will find them. Infact, they do not give them the justice that they deserve. - We would love to stay in one of the bridal suits though. In a city notorious for small rooms, they look fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Right Place at the Right Time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were travelling to Europe for the World Cup and paid a visit to Amsterdam. The World Cup seemed to have driven up hotel prices in Amsterdam, but the rates at the Hotel Toren were reasonable, which was a main reason for our decision to stay there. The hotel was in an excellent area of Amsterdam - within walking distance of all of the attractions and the train station but in a quiet enough neighborhood. We stayed in the second house in a standard room which was small but, like another reader mentioned, that was fully disclosed in the website so we were not surprised. The room and bathroom were clean but the biggest plus - especially considering that this was the hottest week in Amsterdam in years - was the excellent AC. We've stayed in hotels all over Europe and experienced the often weak air conditioning and we were pleasantly surprised that the AC at Toren was powerful and kept our room cool. We normally don't care about hotel bars, but this bar was charming. The bartender was friendly and chatty but above all the prices were reasonable and we were pleasantly surprised by the bar tab at the end of our stay. We also made a couple of international and were charged a very reasonable rate. The only drawback was that by being in the second house, we felt a bit cut off from the main house and the bar, which was probably a minor inconvience all things considered. Rarely make these types of posts but we so enjoyed our stay that we thought our positive experience would be helpful to finicky Americans and other travellers alike. Would recommend this hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints at all”
Reviews.Author: Tedcof
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night stay at the Toren. Arrived at 10.30am. Our room was ready which was an unexpected bonus. We had a standard room which was small. No room for two people to pass between the end of the bed and the wall. However this is clearly shown on their website pictures so no complaints. The temperature was 28 degrees so the air conditioning was a blessing. The room had everything you could ask for, hairdryer, radio satellite tv and tea and coffee (some five star hotels could learn from this). The bathroom was excellent. Really good size with bath and shower overhead. The bathroom looked newly decorated. The location is perfect. Beautiful quiet area but only a ten minute walk from Centraal Station. Ideal for the trams. (We paid 13 euro each for a 72 hour tram pass which saved us loads) Lots of nice canalside bars and cafes close by. Housekeeping was efficient and friendly. Nice bar. Didnt have breakfast as it was 12 euro for a continental and the local cafe does a full breakfast for 8 euro. Service was good and it was easy to get a toasted sandwich in the bar at midnight. (Again a lesson for some fancier hotels) There is nothing about this hotel which wows you. It is simply a very nice, efficiently run establishment where everything works. We wont even bother looking anywhere else when we go to Amsterdam again

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: JacnChris
Reviews.Content: Hotel very clean, staff very friendly. I had a query about our booking and e-mailed prior to our stay, they e-mailed back straight away. Room was lovely, overlooking canal, so quiet on an evening. 5mins walk to anywhere you would want to go. Really enjoyed ourselves, breakfast was great too!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: ok, so this hotel is not enormous and the rooms are not big but this is normal for Amsterdam. (and accomodation is never cheap here). However, this hotel is FANTASTIC - full of charm and character. rooms are spotless and homely. the location is the best in this city - on a quiet canal street, very safe and peaceful yet only minutes on foot from the lively cafes and restuarants. I have stayed here 5 times now and last time took friends who have since returned on their own and stayed here again. I would always book this hotel as a first choice. The bar area is gorgeous and i have always found the staff to be superb. Tip - if you are returning to this hotel, email them directly for reservation enquiries instead of using their web site search and tell them you have been before and would like to come back. they always send a personal email back and offer me a 10% discount. Check out the pancake factory round the corner, a superb cafe with the most amazing choices of pancake. stay at Toren - you will love it!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: VennDutch
Reviews.Content: A great hotel. We had the deluxe room with a fantastic view over the canal. Don't expect big corporate hotel gloss but you can expect a spotless room, great service and friendly staff. It's a quiet spot ideally suited for the main sites, even on foot. Thoroughly recommended.

HotelInfo.Name: The Toren
HotelInfo.Address: Keizersgracht 164, Amsterdam 1015 CZ, The Netherlands
